loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Нормуродова Саломат в возрасте 41 года имеет 4 детей, живет в районе Турсун-заде и занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Она этим видом бизнеса занимается более 15 лет. Саломат обратилась к нам за кредитом чтобы купить бычка. Муж находится на заработках в России, высылает деньги не часто, и поэтому ей приходиться много работать, для того чтобы обеспечить свою семью.
texts.en:
N. Salomat is 41 years old, has 4 children, lives in the Tursun-zoda region and fattens and sells livestock. She has been working in this type of business for more than 15 years. Salomat turned to us for a loan in order to buy a bull. Her husband is earning money in Russia and does not send money often, because of this she needs to work a lot in order to provide for her family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
N. Beatrice is the leader of Balisiima group in Lugazi. She is 29 years of age and the mother of a child aged 8 years who is in Primary 3.

Beatrice has a stall that she has been running for eight years, ever since she divorced her husband. She sells tomatoes, egg plant, green and yellow bananas, and so on.

This is her 13th loan with her lending group and so far she has no regrets because she has been able to increase the stock on her stall, as well as buying a plot of land and building her own house, as well as caring for her child single-handedly. She also has staying with her, her young brother for whom she pays school fees. She is happy that, in addition to her persistence and hard work, the loans have made all this possible.

Beatrice needs a loan to help with restocking her stall with more produce and partly to pay school fees for her young ones.

loans.use: To restock her stall and to pay school fees for her young ones

loans.name: Mondoukpè

texts.fr:
H. Mondoukpè est née le 21 Décembre 1963 à Porto Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Mondoukpè est mère de trois (03) enfants dont deux (02) sont scolarisés. Mondoukpè réside avec sa famille  dans la Commune d'Adjarra où elle mène son activité. 

En effet, Mondoukpè est dans le secteur de la bijouterie. Pour acheter le matériel nécessaire pour son activité Mondoukpè a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’elle n’en possède. C’est la raison pour laquelle Mondoukpè s’est tournée vers ALIDé pour avoir de prêt pour équiper son atelier de bijouterie en vue d'une meilleure prestation à sa clientèle.
texts.en:
H. Mondoukpè was born on December 21, 1963 in Porto Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. Mondoukpè is the mother of 3 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. Mondoukpè lives with her family in the Township of Adjarra where she also runs her business.

In fact, Mondoukpè works making jewelry. In order to buy the necessary equipment for her business, Mondoukpè needs financial means that she does not possess. This is the reason why Mondoukpè has come to ALIDé to take out a loan to equip her jewelry workshop so as to better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of material for her jewelry workshop

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily E. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin. She is forty years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling fish in the local market, and also selling Avon, Fullerlife, and Natasha products. Emily has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $215 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by giving her the ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to purchase new items of Fullerlife to expand her product offerings. Emily is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used for her fish-vending business, and also to purchase a school uniform for her college student. This will be Emily's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to expand her business and to provide educational support for her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria S. sells frozen fish in Ayisa. Victoria has received a primary schooleducation. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Victoria has been selling fish since 1999. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy fish to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Arco Iris (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Arco Iris esta ubicado en el barrio Tres Marías de la parroquia Turí, a 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, es un sector semiurbano, su clima es frío, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y el comercio, sus fiestas patronales las celebran en el mes de Mayo, en estas se realizan diferentes actividades como juegos pirotécnicos,  vacas locas, castillos, y muchas diversiones que llama la atención a propios y extraños.

El banquito esta conformado por 7 socias quienes son muy responsables y agradables con todos, el grupo es muy unido y colaborador así como también muy dedicado a sus labores.

A continuación citamos algunas socias que pertenecen al banquito y cuentan su testimonio:

María vive en el barrio Tres Marías, tiene 64 años de edad,  es viuda hace 20 años y no se ha vuelto a casar, tiene 5 hijos  de 40, 36, 34, 32 y 30 de edad,   los 4 primeros ya casados y con familia cada uno, el ultimo hijo todavía soltero vive con ella y es su compañía, todos sus hijos le ayudan económicamente ya que tiene que realizarse chequeos médicos todo el tiempo debido a que sufre muchas enfermedades y también por su edad, nos cuenta que ella ya no puede cultivar las tierras y debido ha esa razón entrego todo en herencias a sus hijos para que ellos las sigan cultivando.

Tiene 3 años siendo socia y ha realizado ya varios préstamos, se dedica a la crianza de pollos  los cuales están listos para la venta en unos 2 meses aproximadamente, los vende pelados por libras, y los entrega en tiendas o en el mercado.

Ahora tiene 50 pollos, el préstamo realizado lo va ha invertir en el alimento y compra de más pollos y así ampliar más su negocio, su meta es de que si Dios le da vida y salud seguir ayudando ha sus hijos y verles a ellos realizar sus sueños que se plantearon en la vida.

Marcia vive en el Barrio Tres Marías, vía ha Punta Corral, tiene 26 años es casada y su esposo le ayuda económicamente en la casa ya que trabaja en la construcción y entre ellos tienen una buena relación matrimonial en la cual concibieron  2 hijos de 7 y 6 años ellos estudian en la escuela Aurelio Ochoa de la comunidad y viven en la casa de sus padres.

Marcia trabaja en una fábrica de jeans de 8am a 12pm y de 1pm a 5pm de la tarde, también tiene un criadero de  15 pollos y  45 cuyes, cuenta que no tienen dificultad en sus 2 trabajos, a lo contrario le da muchas ventajas ya que así ha logrado comprar materiales como son hierro y ladrillo  para la construcción de su vivienda.

El préstamo lo va ha invertir en la compra de más pollos y ampliar su criadero ya que cada pareja de estos le cuestan 5,50, su meta es seguir adelante como hasta ahora lo ha hecho para construir su vivienda y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Mariana vive en el Barrio Tres Marías, tiene 51 años es casada, su esposo es jubilado y le hace compañía en la casa, en su vida matrimonial han procreado 5 hijos de 29, 26, 22, 20 y 18 años de edad,  todos viven con ella, trabajan  y le ayudan económicamente, viven  en casa propia ya que con el esfuerzo y el trabajo en su juventud la construyeron.

Mariana se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, agricultura y a la crianza de los animales, tiene 70 cuyes, 40 pollos, 3 chanchos y 8 pavos, no tiene horario fijo de trabajo, las verduras que cultiva en su terreno las vende en la feria libre (lugar comercial de Cuenca).

Lleva 3 años trabajando junto a la FUNDACIÓN  ESPOIR  y ya ha realizado  varios préstamos. Entre las socias son muy unidas y se llevan muy bien  y así lo demuestran en cada reunión ya que siempre se encuentran entre risas y bromas es un grupo muy alegre.

El préstamo que realiza hoy es para comprar mas pollos, cuyes ya que el costo de cada cuy pequeño es de 5 dólares, sus metas es seguir con crianza de los animales ya que es su sustento.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Arco Iris" (Rainbow) is located in the Tres Marías neighborhood in the parrish of Turí, which is 15 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. It's a semi-urban sector, the climate is cold, and the people are dedicated to agriculture and business. They celebrate the town's founding during the month of May. During this time, different activities are held like games, fireworks, and other fun things that attract people from both inside and outside the town. The bank is formed of 7 members who are very responsible and friendly with everyone. The group is very united and collaborative. They are also very dedicated to their work. We will now profile some of the members of the bank: María lives in the Tres Marías neighborhood, is 64, and has been a widow for 20 years. She hasn't re-married. She has 5 children who are 40, 36, 34, 32, and 30. The oldest 4 are already married with families of their own. Her youngest son is still single and lives with her and keeps her company. All of her children help her financially since she has medical checkups all of the time since she suffers different illnesses because of her age. She tells us that she can no longer farm her land, and because of this, she has given her children their inheritance so they can keep farming it. She has been a member of the bank for 3 years and has had several loans. She raises chickens, which will be ready for sale in approximately 2 months. She sells plucked chickens by the pound to stores or at market. She now has 50 chickens, and she will invest the loan in the purchase of feed and more chickens so she can expand her business. Her goal is that God gives her life and health to keep helping her children and to see them reach their dreams that they have made for themselves in life. Marcia lives in the Tres Marías neighborhood. She is 26, is married, and her husband helps her with their home's expenses since he works in construction. Between them, they have a good marriage, and they have two children, who are 7 and 6. They go to the Aurelio Ochoa school in their community and live with them. Marcia works in a jeans factory from 8am-12pm and 1pm-5pm. She also is raising 15 chickens and 45 guinea pigs. She says she doesn't find it difficult to have 2 jobs. In fact, it gives her a lot of advantages since she has been able to buy materials like metal and bricks to construct her home. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of more chickens to expand her business since each pair of chickens costs $5.50. Her goal is to get ahead, to construct her home, and to give her children a better future. Mariana lives in the Tres Marías neighborshood, is 52, and married. Her husband is retired and keeps her company in the house. They have 5 children, who are 29, 26, 22, 20, and 18. All of them live with her, work, and help her financially. They live in their own home that they constructed with hard work when they were younger. Mariana does domestic chores, practices agriculture, and raises animals. She has 70 guinea pigs, 40 chickens, 3 pigs, and 8 turkeys. She doesn't have a fixed work schedule. She sells the vegetables she grows at a market in Cuenca. She has worked with Fundación Espoir for 3 years, and she has had several loans. The members are very united and get along very well. At each meeting, you can find laughter and jokes because this is a very happy group. This loan will be used to buy more chickens and guinea pigs since each guinea pig costs $5. Their goals are to keep raising animals since this is their source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for their animals and to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Hannah Achieng

texts.en:
Hannah O., age 47, is a married mother of four. She raises pigs to sell to local butchers and sausage manufacturers. She has been in this business for four years, and in this period the demand for pork has increased steadily especially after her acceptance by the society.

Hannah learned about KADET from a friend. They both joined KADET to borrow funds that will enable them to increase the profitability of their businesses. This is Hannah's fifth loan and she will use it to complete a fattening pen that she started building but stalled due lack of funds. She aspires to expand the business and diversify into breeding ducks and chicken.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To build a fattening pen and buy pig feed.

loans.name: Mame Khaty

texts.fr: Mame Khaty N. est une femme de 45 ans elle est mariée et a la charge de ses 2 neveux. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO depuis 4 ans et demi. Avec son crédit elle veut développer une activité de vente de draps de lit. Elle s'approvisionne à la capital, à Dakar pour revendre à Ziguinchor sa ville. Ses bénéfices lui permettent à contribuer au bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mame Khaty N. is a 45-year-old married woman who has two nephews to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois BOUCOTTE PLACE GAO for four and a half years.  With this loan, she wants to develop a business selling bed sheets.  She stocks up in the capital of Dakar to resell in her town of Ziguinchor.  Her profits enable her to contribute to her family's welfare. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen and advance her commerce

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
Marcel M. is 33 years old,married with four children aged between 9 and 2.
he lives in Nyarugenge district,kigali province ,capital of Rwanda.
she owns a small shop of shoes since 2004 .she starts his business everyday 8h00 AM to 7h00 PM.
before doing this business he could not get all needs for his family.

with the loan requested in vision finance company,he plans to purchase more shoes so that he gets more profits witch will help him to change the life of his family such as to feed his children,to pay school fees of his children and also to save money for the future.

loans.use: Purchase more shoes for sales

loans.name: Proscovia's Group

texts.en:
Proscovia is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a hard working lady and married with five children, ages 22, 20, 18, 12 and 3 years old. She also cares for her parents. Her eldest two children are at the University, two are in secondary school, and the youngest is still at home and soon joining nursery section. 

Proscovia is a businesswoman who has been selling first class clothes from a boutique in Lugazi central market for ten years. At the moment, she is able to make 350,000/= as profits a week. She is grateful for her loans because they help boost her business by enabling her to buy quality clothes for her inventory. She is working so hard to ensure that she becomes a wholesale supplier of clothes to other retailers, as well as be able to build rental houses for her children. Proscovia needs a loan to help buy more new clothes for resale from her boutique.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda O. is from the village of Suarez, Iligan City. She is 33 years old. Yolanda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling "ukay-ukay", or used general clothing, to local community members. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Yolanda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her clothing business

location.town: Suarez, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Uktamjon

texts.en:
M. Uktamjon is 42 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housekeeper. Uktamjon processes and sells dried apricots in the central local market. He is experienced in the business of making the dried apricots. As a rule, he purchases dried apricots in the market and processes them himself. Because he buys dried apricot wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Uktamjon to make his business quite successful and it brings a stable income for the family. Today Uktamjon requests $800 USD. He is going to spend the loan to purchase dried apricots to process to sell. He would like to increase his income and give his children a good education. Uktamjon expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años y es madre de 05 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella y está estudiando.

Hilda, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de anticuchos, negocio por la cual se hizo conocida, de esta manera hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de Comidas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes y pensionistas. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, muy bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Hilda F. is a member of the Las Nazarenas Communal Bank in the Bellavista district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 57-year-old married mother with 5 children, 1 of whom is a student and still depends on her financially.

Hilda used to sell anticuchos (grilled meat on a skewer), which was how she became so well-known in the area. For this reason, she now sells fast food in a well-equipped area inside her home, where she attends to her customers and lodgers. She states that sales are great on a daily basis because of the flavor that she gives her dishes. She is well-known and very welcoming.

She currently runs the same business and is very happy with the work she does every day. She is the one who attends to patrons personally with the charm that she is noted for.

With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare her daily meals, such as kilos of rice, liters of cooking oil, crates of chickens, vegetables, and some utensils to provide better customer service.

She feels full of vitality and the desire to keep getting ahead. She has many goals and dreams in life, such as establishing her own well-equipped grocery store. At the same time, she is also grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her launch her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for meal preparation

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La señora Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desD. hace 4 años atrás, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 59 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado y sogas.
Celestina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar materiales para la elaboración D. sogas.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar una vaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprarse un terreno en Puno y ahí construir su casa, para posteriormente abrir una tienda D. ropa.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Sra. Celestina has been a member of the Communal Bank “Lupakas” for the past four years. She lives in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. Celestina is 59 years old and a widow with two children. She completed her high school education. Her businesses incluD. trading livestock and selling rope.

Celestina tell us that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles and used to buy materials for making rope. She is now seeking a loan of 2500 soles so that she can buy a cow.

Her dream for the future is to purchase land in Puno so that she can build a house. After that, she wants to open a clothing store. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the savings account.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Genoveva Nadhesta

texts.es: La Señora Genoveva es cliente antigua que comenzo a trabajar junto a Empreder desD. el año pasado junto al Banco D. Emprendimiento Pagando en Fe y amor, el cual hasta el momento sigue vigente, por la actividad economica que la señora realiza. La actividad a la que se dedica es la D. comercializacion D. prendas D. vestir tanto para damas como para varones, especificamente chompas provenientes del Ecuador las cuales las reparte en oficinas del centro D. la ciudad D. La Paz, la forma D. pago D. las cuotas D. su credito son D. forma mensual.  Ella vive en la zona D. Miraflores en casa propia juntamente con sus hijos  y nieto, los cuales colaboran a la misma en los gastos correspondientes del hogar. El destino del credito sera el D. comprar chompas por cantidad ya que por la temporada sus pedidos han crecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Genoveva is a long-time client who began working with Emprender a year ago when she joined the Communal Bank “Pagando en Fe y Amor” (Paying in Faith and Love), which is still in existence. She sells clothing for women and men, specifically sweaters imported from Ecuador. Genoveva visits different offices in downtown La Paz to offer her merchandise. She pays her loan installments on a monthly schedule. She lives in her own home in the district of Miraflores with her children and grandson, who help with the household expenses.

Her loan will be used to purchase sweaters for this season since her orders have increased.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweaters

loans.name: Venus

texts.en: Mrs. Venus N. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 26 years old and married with one child. Venus busies herself managing a sari-sari store to support her family's daily needs. Her husband works in a shop. They both work hard to fund their child's future education. Now, Venus is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP as additional capital to purchase more stock. Venus aspires for her store to become a convenience store someday and wants to see her child finish his education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying sewing machines

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo es una persona que cuenta con 28 años de edad, Ricardo tuvo hijos con una señora, ambos se unieron de manera libre son concubinos y ya tienen 3 hijos. Ricardo trabaja como transportista de pasajeros, es chofer de taxi. Si bien hay bastante competencia en el rubro del transporte de pasajeros de taxi, también hay bastante demanda del servicio por lo que se hace rentable el negocio. Como en anteriores oportunidades se mencionó que el transporte urbano es muy rentable en la zona del Oriente. El crédito fue solicitado para capital de operaciones de su conyugue que vende productos de belleza por catalogo, también se dedica a la venta de joyas de fantasía y plata. Ricardo tiene una buena experiencia crediticia ya que no es la primera vez que saca un crédito, durante todo el tiempo de la relación comercial él demostró un buen cumplimiento de pago en sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 28 years old and has three children with the woman he lives with. Ricardo is a taxi driver. There is a lot of competition in the taxi business, but there is also great demand for this service, which makes it profitable. As we have mentioned before, urban transport is very profitable in the eastern area of the country. This loan was requested for capital for Ricardo's partner, who sells beauty products by catalog; she also sells silver and costume jewelry. Ricardo has a good credit history, as this is not the first loan he has taken out. Throughout our entire business relationship, he has paid off his loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of debts

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Eneria T. is from the city of Litapan, Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Eneria owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products like, shampoo, coffee, salt, sugar, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Eneria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eneria is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Pita

texts.en:
Pita E. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Pita is 40 years old and is widowed. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar at the market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Abisola

texts.en: Abisola is 45 years old and married with four children. She sells soft drinks and is requesting a loan of N30,000 to purchase drinks in large quantity at a reduced cost. She said this will enable her to meet customers' demands while also increasing her own profit. Abisola has been in this business for over eight years ago and is doing well. She lives with her family in Lagos state. She says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
Thun P., 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its clay and ceramic products. She is a housewife while her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of about USD 20 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is pictured here at Credit's office in Kampong Chnang.

P. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to pay for the construction worker’s labor. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s study. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To pay her husband's construction worker

loans.name: Gloria Silva

texts.pt:
Glória Silva B. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 35 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 07 anos, e vai a escola. Fez 10a classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com 0 seu filho e sustenta sua mãe e irmãos enviando algum valor monetário para ajuda nas despesas de casa.
Saiu da Cidade da Matola em casa dos pais para Boane na sua própria casa. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 07 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua tia que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é seu 4° empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar mercadoria (fardos de roupa usada, lençóis, mantas, cortinas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na habitação.
texts.en:
Gloria Silva B. was born in the city of Matola, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 35 years old, unmarried, and has a 7-year-old son who is in school. Gloria only studied through 10th grade, and didn't continue because of her parents’ lack of financial resources. She lives in her own home with her son and helps to support her mother and her siblings financially by sending them money to cover household expenses. Gloria left her parents’ house in Matola to move to her own house in Boane. She has had her own business for more than 7 years and doesn’t have any other employees. She earns around 4500 Meticales a month, which she uses to cover household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account each month. Gloria has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through her aunt, who also works with the institution. This is her 4th loan, for the amount of 12,000 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy products (packs of used clothing, sheets, blankets, curtains and other items) in order to increase her stock of merchandise. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to put towards improving her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (packs of used clothing, sheets, blankets, curtains and other items)

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie G. is from the village of Kiorob, Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Jessie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a business venture buying and selling rice and corn grain in the local community. Jessie has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase grains and was used towards her additional working capital. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more corn and rice grains to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Jessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more corn and rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia H. is into the sale of secondhand clothes in Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Felicia has been educated up to the senior high level. Her loan will be added to her existing capital to acquire more stock of secondhand clothes to sell. She anticipates saving the new profits from her business to take care of her children's needs.

loans.use: To acquire more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Ligia del Socorro B. G., tiene la edad de 41 años habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, habita acompañado por su pareja de vida, ellos tiene 2 hijos, el cual uno de ellos estudia la universidad, y apoya a sus padres en el negocio, la familia se dedica al comercio desde hace ya 7 años que este ha sido su fuente de sustento.

Fue con el apoyo de su esposo que se emprendió en esta actividad de oferta de mercaderia en general para uso personal, a futuro espera instalar un tramo de venta en el marcado de Masaya, pero por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería que le permita aumentar las ventas y por ende los ingresos, y de esta manera gozar  con el capital necesario para futuras fuentes de ingresos que traiga beneficios económico-sociales a la familia, sobre todo que su humilde hogar necesita de remodelaciones que beneficien a su diario vivir.
texts.en:
Ligia del Socorro B. G., 41, lives in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla with her life partner. They have two children. One of them is in college and helps the parents with the business. The family’s source of support for the last 7 years has been commerce. She started her general personal use merchandise sales business with help from her husband. In the future, she’d like to set up a sales stall in Masaya’s market. For now, she is asking for funding to buy a larger amount of stock merchandise that will allow her to increase sales thereby leading to higher income that will bring socio-economic benefits to the entire family especially because their humble home needs improvements that will make daily living better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Wolale Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WOLALE II   est  constitué de femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la préfecture de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4  enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide, du fonio et du sésame. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents qui étaient des prêts solidaires, elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne.
NANA T., compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de fonio, d’arachide,  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN, DAH et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 26000 à 27000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Wolale II Group are married women living in Cinzara, a village in the prefecture of San in the region of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. On average, they are 43 years old and have four children. They grow groundnuts, fonio and sesame. In order to ensure that their agricultural investments are profitable, the members of Wolale I Group decided two years ago to participate in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After having properly repaid their previous loans, which were solidarity loans, they apply now for their first farming loan. Nana T. wants to use her loan to buy adequate quantities of fonio and groundnut seeds, small equipment and farming supplies at the great market in San. After the rainy season, the harvest will be warehoused long enough for its value to increase, before it is sold at the great market in San, in Dah and at the nearby markets, retail (or often wholesale) for cash to customers who mostly come from big towns. After their produce is sold, the group members expect to make a profit of 26,000 to 27,000 CFA francs each, which they will use to pay the interest on the loan and ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Nubia del socorro R., tiene la edad de 45 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, los que habitan de manera independiente y apoyan a sus padres, la señora labora como maestra de primaria en un colegio público, desde hace mas de 15 años, siendo este una de las fuentes de ingresos más importantes de la familia.

Ellos habitan en el Barrio San Antonio en una humilde casa, es para su hogar que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, que le permitan llevar a cabo la construcción de un cuarto, esta inversión le traerá mejores comodidades para el buen vivir de la familia.
texts.en:
Miss Nubia del socorro R. is 45, married and has 3 grown children who live independently and support their parents. She has worked as an elementary school teacher in a public school for over 15 years. This is one of the most important sources of income for the family. They live in the San Antonio neighbourhood in a modest home. She is requesting this loan for her home, for the purchase of construction materials. This will allow them to carry out the construction of a room. This investment will provide them with greater comfort and living standards for the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Mi Amigo Jesus Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: MI AMIGO JESUS 
Marina M. C. de 73 años de edad, viuda con 05 hijos  independientes, participa recientemente en la ALCANCIA COMUNAL “MI AMIGO JESUS”, el resto de los siete integrantes son personas muy emprendedoras como lo demuestran cuando se reúnen para efectuar sus pagos, día a día se esfuerzan mucho para dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 

Tal es el caso de Marina quien  tiene  un kiosko en su casa, donde vende gaseosas, galletas, panes, frutas, asimismo alquila baños públicos a los viajeros de la zona de Corcona,  por la edad que tiene Marina se le es difícil caminar por lo que cuenta con la ayuda de un bastón,  pero a pesar de ese impedimento se esfuerza por dar lo mejor de ella y  seguir trabajando, 
El sueño de la señora es seguir ahorrando su dinero para terminar de techar y construir su casa, ya que en la actualidad su techo es de calamina.
 Con el anterior crédito la señora compro mercaderia y mejoró sus ventas, es por ello que la Marina confía en la institución EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD,  porque le ha  ayudado a mejorar su economía,  ahora forma parte de esta alcancía el crédito que necesita es para comprar golosinas, galletas, gaseosas.,.
texts.en:
Alcom: Mi Amigo Jesus Marina M. C. is 73, widowed and has 5 independent children and participates regularly in the Mi Amigo Jesus community bank. The other seven members are hardworking people as shown when they get together to make payments. They strive every day to improve their families' quality of life. Such is the case with Marina who has a small shop in her home where she sells soda pop, cookies, bread and fruit. She also rents public bathrooms to the travelers in Corcona. Due to her age Marina has a hard time walking and does so with the help of a cane. Despite this obstacle she gives her best and keeps on working. Her dream is to save up some money to finish building and roofing her home, since currently she has a roof made of aluminum sheeting. With her previous loan she bought merchandise and improved her sales which is why Marina trusts EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, and since they helped her improve her income. Today she is part of the community bank she needs a loan to buy candy, cookies, soda pop etc.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy cookies and soda pop

loans.name: Jammo Group

texts.fr:
le groupe est composé de 20 membres. Il a vu le jour la veille du financement du Banc Villageois le 04/12/2007. Elles sont des femmes très entreprenantes unies dans le but de s'entre aider et de mener des activités génératrices de revenus. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NOP SA JËKËR.

Madame AISSATOU D. à l'extrême droite sur la photo vêtue de robe rose blanc est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est aussi tutrice de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait du petit commerce devant sa maison , elle vend de la glace , de la crème glacée , du pain thon etc… Elle pratique cette activité depuis 4 ans 

Avec Son nouveau crédit elle pourra acheter des provisions pour fabriquer ses crèmes glacées, acheter du poisson faire du ton, et payer ses factures d'eau et d'électricité pour la b=fabrique de glace.

Son objectif est d'agrandir son commerce, aider ses enfants et ses frères dans la scolarité, et participer à la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
This group is composed of 20 members. It has been created the day before the Banc Villeagois’ financing on December 4, 2007. Its members are very energetic women who share a common goal of helping each other and developing their enterprises. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Nop Sa Jëkër. Mrs. Aissatou D., on the far right in the photo, wearing a pink and blank outfit, is the group’s leader. She is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She also takes care of two other children entrusted to her by relatives. She is a food vendor selling ice, ice cream, tuna sandwiches etc. in front of her house. She has been doing it for four years. With her new loan she will be able to purchase supplies for making ice cream, purchase fish for making sandwiches and to pay her water and electricity bills due to making ice. Her goal is to expand her business, help her children and her brother with paying for their studies, and contribute to the famiL. budget.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing and promoting their enterprises

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda R. is from the town of Talibon. She is 29 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from gathering and selling seaweed to the market. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years.

Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Teresa América

texts.es: La señora N. R., labora en la Alcaldía de Catarina del Departamento de Masaya, como Responsable de Finanzas, con este salario que devenga en este lugar logra mantener su hogar, ella solicita un crédito con CEPRODEL para solventar gastos personales que tiene.
texts.en: Sra. N. Ruiz works for the town of Catarina in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Masaya.  She is head of the town's Finance department and her salary from the job goes to paying her normal household expenses.  She is applying for a CEPRODEL loan to pay for other expenses.

loans.use: Personal expenses.

loans.name: El

texts.en: Mrs. El M., a 37-year-old married mother, lives with her husband and children in a small house located in the city of Phnom Penh. Mrs. El M. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead. Mrs. El M. has rented a market store where she sells chicken to earn a living. She and her husband usually go to buy chicken in bulk at the cheapest price possible from rural people whose houses are full of poultry they raise for meat. Recently, Mrs. El M. ran out of chicken to sell, and she thinks that it is the best time for earning extra profit in order to support her family. Therefore, Mrs. El M. would like a Kiva loan in order to buy additional chicken to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional chicken for expanding her business

loans.name: Maria Eulogia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Eulogia G. F.  es trabajadora  de la Esc. El Rosario  se desempeña como maestra de primaria  desde hace 28 años este es el crédito No. 3 que la Sra. Tiene con la institución.
Ella  solicita este crédito con CEPRODEL para Mejoramiento y Reparación de vivienda, vive con sus padres es soltera y tiene a cargo a 3 hijos.
texts.en: Mrs Maria Eulogia G. F. works as an elementary school teacher at El Rosario school.  She has been in the job for 28 years.  This is the third loan which she has had with our organization.  She is requesting this loan from CEPRODEL to improve and repair her home.  She lives with her parents, is single, and has 3 children in her care.

loans.use: To improve and repair her house

loans.name: Dolores Del Socorro

texts.es: Dolores Del Socorro tiene 25 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 11 años que trabaja pues siempre ha sido una madre responsable, pues ella ayudaba a su Madre, pues su Mama no ganaba un salario estable en donde pudiera ofrecerle a Dolores estudios fue por estos motivos que ella empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta y así ayudar a sufragar estos gastos que son muy necesaR.. El motivo del financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como faldas, pantalones, camisas, trajes para niños y trajes formales.
texts.en: Dolores del Socorro is 25 years old and her activity is clothing sales.  She has been working for more than 11 years, as she has always been a responsible mother.  She helped her own mother, who did not have a stable enough income to be able to afford an education for Dolores.  Because of this, she started working on her own so she could cover these very necessary expenses.  The reason she is requesting the loan is to buy items such as skirts, pants, shirts, children’s clothing, and formal wear.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Argenedith

texts.es:
Argenedith M. tiene 23 años de edad y toda una experiencia en el arte de preparar pasabocas  y deliciosos jugos que vende elegantemente en  una zona comercial de Cartagena, donde vive con sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 5 años y con su cónyuge. Su actividad inició desde hace dos años cuando trabajaba en una confitería con un horario extendido de lunes a domingo sin descanso, y debía dejar a su hija al cuidado de su madre, pero como quedó nuevamente embarazada a su mamá le quedó muy difícil el cuidado de dos niños y debió retirarse de su trabajo y con ello iniciaron dificultades económicas, razón por la cual Argenedith aprovechando su conocimiento sobre la preparación de  pasabocas se ideó el negocio de vender fritos en la terraza de su casa y como le resultó exitoso se trasladó a una esquina frente a un parque,  muy cercana a su casa y su clientela aumentó  por eso se siente muy contenta porque además puede estar pendiente de sus hijos debido a que trabaja 6 horas diarias de lunes a domingo y cuando termina la  venta  se va atrabajar en  sus quehaceres domésticos, apoya con los gastos del hogar y gana el doble de lo que ganaba cuando era empleada en una empresa.  
Este su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materia prima por volumen como, aceite frutas, maíz azúcar y sal, además comprará una carpa para protegerse del sol y de la lluvia que ahora es frecuente y un cilindro de gas, porque su sueño es acondicionar bien su negocio y volverlo mas confortable para  beneficiar a sus clientes  y lograr unos ahorros entre ella y su esposo para comprar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Argenedith M. is 23 years old and has a lot of experience in making snacks and delicious juices which she sells smartly in a business district of Cartagena where she lives with her husband and her two children aged 2 and 5.

Argenedith started her business 2 years ago when she was working in a café.  She  worked long hours from Monday to Sunday without a rest and had to leave her daughter in her mother's care.  However, as she became pregnant again, her mother found it very difficult to look after two children and consequently she had to leave her job.  This led to some economic difficulties, so Argenedith took advantage of the knowledge which she had about preparing snacks and came up with the idea of starting a business selling fried food in the patio of her home.  As it was very successful she moved to a street corner opposite a park which is very near her home and her number of customers increased.  She is very happy with her success and is also happy because she can look out for her children since she works 6 hours a day from Monday to Sunday.  When she finishes selling her food she can get her household chores done.  Argenedith supports her household expenses and earns twice what she was earning when she worked for somebody else's company.

This Kiva loan is Argenedith's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy ingredients in bulk such as oil, fruit, corn, sugar and salt.  She will also buy an awning to protect her from the sun and the frequent rain and a cylinder of gas because her dream is to fit out her business well and make it more comfortable for her customers.  She would also like to manage to save some money together with her husband so that they can buy their own home.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk such as oil, fruit, corn, sugar and salt.  To buy an awning to protect her from the sun and the frequent rain and to buy a cylinder of gas

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 34 years old and blessed with two children.  She does dairy farming so as to earn a living.  She sells milk to the people of her local neighborhood.  Besides farming, she is employed as a nursery school teacher.  She dreams of increasing the cows in her farm for more output.  She also plans to buy a pick-up for transporting milk from the farm to her customers. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more cows.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Naam

texts.en: Naam is a 57-year-old widow and mother of three children from Baalbeck. Naam has owned a butcher shop and a bakery for 30 years. She has worked hard to fill the space her husband left to raise her kids. She is both the mother and the father, as her neighbors describe her. Naam is a hard worker and she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary flour and gas to increase her business. Naam hopes to keep growing her business for her children.

loans.use: To buy flour and gas to increase her business

loans.name: Jonna's Group

texts.en:
Jonna A. is from the village of Manaoag, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 33 years old and the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jonna is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a recycling service, hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $159 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jonna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase scrap metals and bottles to sell. 

Jonna is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase scrap metals and bottles to sell. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metals & bottles to sell

loans.name: Miriam Juliana

texts.es: Miriam tiene 37 años de edad, casada, originaria del Municipio de San Cristóbal, departamento de Totonicapan,  Madre de 5 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de aves  y esta solicitando su primer crédito en Asociacion ASDIR , ya que tiene 2 años de tener  experiencia  en crianza de aves y desea esta ayuda para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en: Miriam is 37 years old, married, and a native of the town of San Cristóbal in the Department of Totonicapan.  She is the mother of five children.  Miriam sells poultry and is requesting her first loan from Asociación ASDIR.  She has two years of experience raising poultry and wants assistance with growing her business.

loans.use: Operating capital for her poultry business

loans.name: Sop Cheikh Makhtar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP CHEIKH MAKHTAR est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 25 femmes qui sont toutes du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité, par parenté et par voisinage. Leur principale activité est le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DVF GUEOUL 

Madame AMINTA N., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, vêtue de robe noire parsemée de petit points blancs est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, d'habits, de pagnes et d'encens. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de dix ans. Elle s'approvisionne à la capitale (Dakar) pour revendre dans le quartier. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The borrowing group SOP CHEIKH MAKHTAR was created on December 30, 2009.  It consists of 25 women who are all from the same neighborhood.  They organized by affinity, kinship, and neighborhood.  Their main activity is small business. The group is part of the Village Bank of DVF GUEOUL.

Mrs. AMINTA N., standing at the far right of the photo, wearing a black dress with small white dots is the group manager.  She is 51 years old, married, and mother of 6 children.   She runs a small business in fabric, clothing, “pagnes”, and incense.  She has been in this business for over 10 years.  She stocks up in the capital (Dakar) for resale in her neighborhood.

Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her level of supply of goods.

Her goal is to support her husband in taking care of the family.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, clothing, "pagnes" and incense.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Paying the school fees for his children

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro menores hijos en el caserío Insculas, una zona rural que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Olmos, provincia de Lambayeque, el lugar se encuentra ubicado a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la compra y comercialización de carne de pollo, gallina y otras aves en su domicilio. Ella adquiere los animales a los negociantes y vecinos de la zona para luego comercializarlos entre sus vecinos. El negocio es de mucha ayuda a su comunidad ya que, al estar alejados del pueblo más cercano, pueden adquirir carne fresca a diario. Su esposo es agricultor y actualmente siembra sandías, con lo que ambos ganan tratan de salir adelante y progresar.

Mercedes desea adquirir más animales para seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus vecinos, asimismo desea realizar algunas mejoras en su negocio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles. Ella ya es una cliente antigua de Edpyme Alternativa y debido a su puntualidad y responsabilidad se ha ganado la confianza y estima necesarias para seguir trabajando juntos.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 36, lives with her husband and their four young children in Insculas, a small town in the rural districut of Olmos, about two hours from the Peruvian city of Chiclayo.  

Mercedes has operated a business buying and selling meat for six years.  She operates the business at her house.  She buys chickens and other birds from local traders and others in the neighborhood who have poultry to sell.  Her neighbors are also her customers.  The business is an important service for the neighborhood because it's the only place in the immediate area where local people can buy fresh meat.  Mercedes' husband farms watermelons and their combined income allows them to support their family.  

Mercedes wants to buy more birds so that she can better meet demand for her products.  This 1,800 new soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa will allow her to improve and expand her business.   Mercedes is a long-time customer of Edpyme Alternativa and the bank trusts that she will repay this loan on time.

loans.use: buy more animals for meat business

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child who is currently in school. Jalia has the business of a small hotel [restaurant] with cooked food, which she has had for 10 years.

To help expand her business, Jalia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chairs and saucepans for the hotel. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jalia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. In the future, Jalia hopes to expand her business. 

Jalia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to improve on her way of living.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and saucepans.

loans.name: Nelsy Sofia

texts.es: Nelsy Sofia M. S. es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 15 años; ella iniciò el negocio de vender mercancias impulsada por la necesidad de generar un ingreso familiar, para apoyar la gestion de su esposo en el hogar, pero sobre todo para atender a su familia y trabajar independientemente,  con tal de ser su propio jefe. Este es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y gradualmente sus ganancias, tema en el cual trabaja cuando acude a finanaciamientos. Con su credikiva comprarà chancletas, libretas, sueteres, camisas, hilos, botones, desodorantes y jeans para la venta.  Su sueño es tener otro punto de ventas en un centro comercial, donde logre expandise con mayor facilidad. Su màximo desafio es lograr comprar lo que la gente necesita y le solicita,  porque tiene muy poco capital con relaciòn al aumento de sus clientes. Mientras tanto continua rotando rapidamente sus inventarios para ver la utilidad,  reinvertirla y cubrir sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Nelsy Sofia M. S. is married and has two children aged 12 and 15.  She started her business selling merchandise as she needed to make an income for her family so that she could support her husband in running their household.  Above all, she wanted to be able to look after her family, work independently and be her own boss.

This is Nelsy's second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  By working with the organization, she has managed to increase her working capital and gradually increase her profits.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy thongs (flip flops), notebooks, sweaters, shirts, threads, buttons, deodorants and jeans to sell.  Her dream is to own another sales location in a shopping mall where she will be able to expand more easily.  Her main challenge is being able to buy what people need and are requesting because she has very little capital in relation to the increase in her number of customers.  In the meantime, she continues to experience a rapid turnover of stock, make profits, re-invest them and cover her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy thongs (flip flops), notebooks, sweaters, shirts, threads, buttons, deodorants and jeans to sell

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita C. is from the village of Buenavista, Oroquieta City. She is 59 years old. Tita is single. 

To make a living, Tita prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Tita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Tita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Tita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her motorcycle, which she uses for her business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Tita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle, which she uses for her business.

loans.name: Rodelio

texts.en:
Rodelio G. is 48 years old, married and has two school-aged children. He is from the village of Bagakay within Ozamiz City, a part of Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Rodelio operates a motor transport service. He has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Rodelio joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. He is requesting a loan, his first from GDMPC, of 14,000 PHP which will be used to repair his motorbike’s engine. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike’s engine.

loans.name: Jessica Marianela

texts.es:
Jessica de 27 años es madre de familia, vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, que se encuentra a unos 40 minutos aproximadamente de distancia del departamento de Piura.  Las cuales  se caracterizan por la actividad agricola, ganadera, artesana de sus pobladores.

Jessica se dedica a la venta de ropa y bisutería, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace 2 años, pero también deja sus productos en otros caseríos quincenalmente, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus  gastos familiares.

Al observar Jessica que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadría y abastecer su negocio con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, de una manera responsable y con mucho empeño.
texts.en:
Jessica is 27 years old and she is the mother of a family. She lives in a house of her own together with her husband and her children. Their house is equipped with all of the basic services and it is located in the district of Tambogrande, at approximately 40 minutes from the department of Piura. It is known for its population involved agriculture, farming, and crafts.

Jessica has been selling clothing and jewelry, a business located in her house, for the past 2 years. But she also travels to other communities biweekly to sell her products in order to have a larger demand by clients and to earn more income to cover her family's expenses.

Jessica observed that her business is more successful every day so she believes it necessary to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. She will purchase a greater quantity of merchandise and to supply her business with innovative products with the goal of increasing her clientele. She will be able to repay her loan and to improve the quality of life for her family in a responsible and very dedicated way.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of clothing and jewelry merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Agbei

texts.fr: Revendeuse et distributrice d’ignames,de mais,et de céréales à Lomé depuis 2006, Agbeî est mariée à un chauffeur et maman d’un enfant. Elle a 41 ans et ne ménage aucun effort pour voir grandir son enfant dans de meilleures  conditions. Elle s’approvisionne à SOKODE une ville de la région centrale située au centre du pays à 355 km au nord de LOME. Elle est à son quatrième prêt dans notre institution.
texts.en: A retailer and distributor of yams, corn, and grains in Lomé since 2006, Agbeî is married to a driver and the mother of one child.  She is 41 years old and does whatever it takes to see that her child grows up under the best of conditions. Agbeî purchases her supplies in SOKODE, a city in the Centrale Region, located in the middle of the country and about 355 km to the north of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is on her fourth loan with our institution.

loans.use: to buy yams and corn

loans.name: Saodatkhon's Group

texts.en:
Saodatkhon, 42, is the leader of this group. In order to earn money to meet the family's needs, her husband went to work in Kazakhstan.  There are four children in their family: two sons and two daughters. The older son works in Kazakhstan with his dad and the other children study at school. 

Saodatkhon breeds cattle to contribute additional money to the family budget. At the moment she has a cow and a calf.  She earns an additional 2000 soms per month by selling milk. With money received from this loan, Saodatkhon wants to purchase more farm animals for breeding and further reselling. In the future, with the money gained from reselling cattle she plans to start repairing their house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals for breeding

loans.name: Tiessiri Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Tièssiri IV sont  des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne  29 ans, en moyenne 4 enfants et  vivant  dans des familles polygames à Baba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AWA  compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 15.000FCFA environs  en  fin  de campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group Tièssiri IV are married women who average 29 years of age and 4 children. They all live in polygamous families in Baba, a village in the Commune of Massigui, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their work better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their fifth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, AWA intends to buy farm inputs and to pay for plowing in order to maintain about 0.25 hectare of rice and peanuts.

After the harvests, the produce is sold in the city of Massigui to a customer base composed of women and men. AWA plans on making an average profit of about 15,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, and manure

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en:
Ghazi is a 62-year-old married man and father of four children. Ghazi has owned a grocery store since 1995. He has 30 years of experience in such a business.

Ghazi is a hardworking man who seeks his customers' satisfaction. Ghazi works hard to provide a healthy living for his family and improving his business at the same time.

To get ready for Holy Ramadan month, Ghazi is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua (a Kiva partner) for the second time, in order to increase his store's capitA. with sugar, tea, herbs and seeds, as well as speciA. dates, syrups and nuts requested a lot during this month. His previous loan was very effective and helped both his sociA. and financiA. situation.  He was a borrower in good standing, too.

Ghazi is optimistic about this loan and hopes to achieve what he looks forward to.

loans.use: to increase his store's capital and purchase items to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. She has had a shop that sells canned goods, detergents, and snacks for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, detergents, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La Sra. Betty pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 39 años y 02 hijas de 8 y 7 años, estudiantes del nivel primario.
A partir de los 16 años empezó a trabajar con la venta de chupetes (helados de hielo), golosinas y kekes en las afueras de su casa, esto le permitió contar con independencia económica, desde entonces, la idea del negocio fue su inquietud.  Decidió solicitar un préstamo a Manuela Ramos por S/. 500.00 nuevos soles y vender abarrotes en su casa, actualmente ha incrementado nuevos productos como carnes, huevos, verduras, frutas, todo tipo de bebidas, cereales y cosméticos, cuenta con una buena clientela, pues brinda una buena atención y se esmera por proporcionar a sus clientes lo que ellos necesitan.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará  insumos como productos enlatados, conservas, cajas de leche, sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, aceites en litros, golosinas, sacos verduras, galletas en cajas, perfumes, talcos desodorantes y carnes de vacunos, de aves, y porcinos.
Betty es una mujer creativa y emprendedora,  su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener un minimarket, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Betty, 39,  belongs to the communal bank “Los Eucaliptos”, The Eucalypses, from the Tarapoto district, province and department of San Martín.  She is married and has two daughter, 8 and 7, who are in primary school.
