16 years ago she began selling “chupetes” (popsicles), candies and cakes outsides of her house.  This gave her some economic independence and since then she had been eager to start a business.  She decided to request a loan from Manuela Ramos of 500 new sols and sell groceries in her house.  She has now added new products such as meats, eggs, vegetables, fruit, all kinds of drinks, cereals, and cosmetics.  She has a good customer bases because she gives good service and she wants to offer her customers all that they need.
With this loan of 2,500 new sols, she will buy products such as canned goods, conserves, boxes of milk, sacks of sugar, sacks of rice, liters of oil, cookies, sacks of vegetables, boxes of cookies, perfumes, talcum powder, deoderants, beef, poultry and pork.
Betty is a creative and entrepreneurial woman whose dream is to increase her business and have a minimarket.  She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering the opportunity to women like her to be able to fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as canned goods, conserves, milk, etc

loans.name: Hiek

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as planter. One of them is Mrs. Hiek, 32, who has been working in this sector since 1999. Presently, Hiek grows maize and potatoes on her own farmland, which she inherited from her grandparents. From this business, she can generate an income of around US$ 2 per day. She is married to Sokhan, age 36. This humble couple has two children who depend on them. Both of their children are in school. 

This growing-maize and potatoes season, the family planted one month ago but their maize is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Because of this condition, Hiek and her husband would like to request a loan from Kiva in order to purchase fertilizer to improve her business. She says the income will help her improve her family's living standards. She is grateful to all lenders that help her family. She is shown with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita is 44 years old and has 2 children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Helenita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Helenita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 18 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Helenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Sophy is 40 years old and a farmer who earns $1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $7 per day. They have two children; one is studying and the other is working and earning $2.3 per day. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy construction materials for her husband’s career. Before, her husband found the market of construction work very hard, but now he can have a lot of customers because the villagers know about his achievements. She wants to buy more equipment for her husband, so that he can successfully do more construction work.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her husband's career.

loans.name: Sarn

texts.en: Sarn, 30 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a Tok Tok driver (a motorcycle-based taxi) who earns $7 per day. The couple has one 4-year-old son. Every month, Sarn has to spend $50 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a new Tok Tok for her husband's Tok Tok service. This loan will help her husband earn better income than before. She wants to repair her house when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a new Tok Tok (a motorcycle-based taxi)

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is 37 years old, married with two children. One of them is studying while other is less than 4 years old.  Her husband is a fruit seller. He sells different varieties of fresh seasonal fruit to his customers. The quality as well as the price of his fruit is very fair; that’s why he makes a good number of sales and earns reasonably good profits from his business. 

Safia herself is an active and efficient lady and performs her household duties very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband because the winter season is coming and he needs new season fruit to sell to earn better profits. 

He has been operating his business for the past four years and Safia is hopeful that an investment will help him make better profits from his business.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.es: Floriana tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Filomeno de 43 años y su adorado hijo Marco de 5 añitos, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar Floriana, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café y hojas de coca, dependerá el empeño que le ponga en sus plantas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y maduros. Tiene 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es llevar lo cosechado hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, que es el lugar donde los vende. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores cultivos y ofrecer a mejores precios. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP; por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprar sacos de abono para fertilizar sus plantas de cacao y café.
texts.en: Floriana, 41 years old, is a very cheerful, hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house with her husband, Filomeno, 43, and her little son, Marco, who is 5 years old. All of her efforts in life are for Marco. The products that Floriana has managed to grow with such hard work and dedication have helped her get ahead in life. Every morning, she starts working her fields, because she knows that the quality of the care she gives her cacao, coffee, and coca plants depends on the effort she puts into them. Her favorite part of her job is taking care of her crops, and she feels really happy when she sees that they've grown large and ripened. She's been farming for four years and thinks the hardest part is transporting her harvest to the city of San Francisco to sell it. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops in order to produce better harvests and sell them at higher prices. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she is hoping for your collaboration in pursuing her goals. She will use the 3,000 soles requested to purchase sacks of fertilizer for her cacao and coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert, a 30-year-old farmer who lives in Pinto Alfonso Lista village, has been managing his corn farm business and he has had this business for four years. Patience and hard work are his instrument to make his farm business grow allowing him to pay all of his family expenses, and since he is single, he take care of his parents and look after their farm.

In order to continue increasing his profits, Albert is requesting a loan of P27,000 to buy farm supplies to make his farmland more productive. He is hoping that someday he could expand his cornfield to earn greater profits to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for his corn-farming business.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. Her children are aged between 11 and 23 years old. Zosima's husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Zosima sells viands to earn a living. She requested this loan to purchase ingredients such as meat and vegetables. Zosima will also pay for her children's school fees. She works hard to support her family and improve their living situation. In the future, Zosima hopes for her children to finish college and to build a bigger house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat and vegetables and pay for school fees

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 63-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children, two of them are working and one still attends school. In order to fulfill his family needs, Haidar works hard and is ready to help whenever they need it. He has worked as a taxi driver since 1975. His job consists of transporting people from inside to outside Lebanon upon request. 

Today, Haidar is facing problems with his car, so he is asking to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to replace his old car with a new one in order to be able to carry on his work properly. In the future, he plans to buy a van and serve a wider range of people.

loans.use: to replace his old car with a new one

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 32-year-old lady who is married to Yefta, a 32-year-old man. They have been blessed with three children namely: Gere, 7, studying at the second grade of Elementary School; Jelita, 4, attending Kindergarten; Gusti, 8 months old. 

Regina runs a kiosk business at her house, and it has been operating for almost two years. Some kinds of daily needs items are displayed at her kiosk, i.e., snacks, instant noodles, coffee, and detergent. Regina is only able to display very limited stock at her kiosk as she only had a little capital. This situation really affects the income that she gets. 

The desire to improve her business and income led Regina to seek a loan but she couldn’t find one until she met one of TLM’s loan officers who introduced her to TLM’s lending program. Regina is interested in joining the lending program and requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She wants to build a small kiosk in front of her house and expand the business stock by adding a greater variety of household needs such as sugar, coffee, tea, wheat flour, cooking ingredients, etc. Regina is hoping to get the loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as sugar, coffee, tea, wheat flour, cooking ingredients, etc. and to build a small kiosk.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells maize in Brasi near Elmina.  She is married to a farmer.  Aba uses her income to help her husband pay utility bills.  Aba will use this loan to purchase bags of maize to sell.  With the new profits generated by this loan, Aba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru:
Mansur jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Mansur 31 qod. 
On uchitel po Fizike uje 4 qoda, ranshe on prepodoval v gosudarstvennoy shkole , no zatem on nachal provodit chasniye uroki dlya postupleniya uchenikov v universiteti. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye testi, knigi i razniye pribori dlya provojdeniya laborotornix rabot(opitov) po fizike tak kak vse eto stoit ochen dorogo i ne kaydiy uchenik mojet pokupat ix. Mansur lubit svoyu rabotu i predmet kotoriy uchit detyam kotoriy budet nujen dlya ixnego budushego razvitiya.
texts.en: Mansur lives in the Baku region with his parents.  He is not married and has no children.  Mansur is 31 years old.  He has been teaching physics for four years.  He previously taught at a public school, but then started to teach private lessons to prepare students for universities.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to purchase necessary exams, books and various equipment to do laboratory work (experiments) for physics because all of this is very expensive, and not every student is able to purchase it.  Mansur loves his work and subject that he teaches to children, knowing that it will be useful for their future development.

loans.use: to purchase necessary books and exams

loans.name: Sabali B Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Sabali B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KAZANGASSO, un des villages du cercle de Bla  , 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 2eme prêt avec l’institution, le prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec BINTOU,  1ere debout de la gauche vers droite  sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,50 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Bla et Dougouwolo, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75.000FCFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Frais de labour,  achat d’intrants et de semence

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 43-year-old, married man who has ten children. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a tailor, who makes men's suits and is always updated with the current style trends, thus attracting many customers. Inadequate capital hinders his business growth, while his dream is to own a fashion house. Moses intends to use the loan to buy cloth materials for tailoring.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Adjovi Epiphanie

texts.en:
Married and without children, but with two (02) dependants, Madam Adjo A., was born on January 2nd, 1978 at Ahépé in the prefecture of Yoto, she is a hair dresser who exercises, beside her hairdressing salon, the beauty products trading. Issued from a numerous family and very poor, she has the mishap to marry an unemployed husband and all the family charges remain on her. However, her husbands, an accountant by trade but jobless, train her in accountancy to allow her to better manage her businesses. From her cleverness and experience, she succeeded to manage and repaid without incident her three first credits. Today, she is requesting a credit of $1000 to acquire a modern hair drier to buy and resell beauty products. She is convinced that this project will strengthen the increasing and profitability of her activities, and will develop her incomes to improve her family living conditions.

Mariée et sans enfant, mais avec deux (02) personnes en charge, Madame A. Adjovi Epiphanie, née le 2 Janvier 1978 à Ahépé dans la préfecture de Yoto, est une coiffeuse qui exerce, à côté de son salon de coiffure, le commerce des produits cosmétiques. Issue d’une famille nombreuse et très pauvre, elle a eu la malchance d’épouser un mari sans emploi et toutes les charges familiales reposent sur elle. Toutefois, son mari, un comptable de formation en chômage, lui donne des cours sur la comptabilité pour lui permettre de mieux gérer ses affaires. De par sa spécialisation et son expérience, elle su gérer et rembourser sans incident ses trois premiers crédits. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $1000 pour acquérir un séchoir moderne et pour acheter des produits cosmétiques. Elle est convaincue que ce projet renforcera la croissance et la rentabilité de ses activités, et augmentera ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to acquire a modern hair drier to buy and resell beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Kabura would like to buy 20 bags of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia would like buy seven bundles of iron sheets

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Antonio Aguero S. is 28 years old, married and has a son. He has been working in this field for 10 years. He attended school and finished high school but couldn't continue his education due to the limited resources and funds that his parents had. Since an early age, he had to look for work to help with his family needs.

He started to work at the mechanic shop that his uncle owns. He quickly learned the skills to repair cars and after years of savings, he became independent. 4 years ago he started his own shop. Today, he works happily at his shop where he provides employment to other young men that help him and like he are looking to prosper and become independent.

Antonio's shop has a very good reputation and is well recognized in the zone that he lives. He has a good clientele and they are very satisfied with his work. Antonio specializes on auto body repairs and painting. He had asked for a loan before and had paid it on time. He invested that money in buying a car painting machine. Today, he is asking for a new loan which he will invest in buying car paints and other supplies for his body shop. Thanks to his great work, the demand has increased

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, KIva Volunteer.

El Sr. Antonio A. S., tiene 28 años, está casado y tiene un hijo, trabaja en esta actividad desde hace 10 años. Curso sus estudios hasta terminar la secundaria (High School) pero no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a los escasos recursos de sus padres, por lo que desde temprana edad tuvo que salir a trabajar para poder de esta forma ayudar con el sustento de su familia.

Empezó a trabajar en el taller mecánico de su tío donde adquirió rápidamente habilidades en la mecánica automotriz; tras años de ahorro pudo independizarse y desde hace 4 años posee un taller propio. Hoy día el trabaja alegre en su taller donde provee de fuentes de trabajo a otros jóvenes que lo ayudan en el taller y que al igual que El están en busca de prosperar e independizarse algún día.

El taller de Don Antonio es muy reconocido en la zona, tiene muchos clientes y estos están bastante satisfechos con su trabajo. Antonio se ha especializado en el ramo de la chapería y pintura. Anteriormente ya había solicitado un crédito, con buena puntualidad en el pago, y lo invirtió en la compra de una máquina para pintar autos. Hoy está solicitando un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de pinturas para autos y otros insumos, pues gracias a su buen trabajo la demanda ha aumentado.

loans.use: Buying paints and supplies for his auto body shop.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old. She's married, and her husband is unemployed. They have two children, and one of them is going to join the primary school this year. The family is living in a rented house in Kirkuk. The entrepreneur applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some fabric in order to increase her income and create a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her charcoal-selling business

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana S. is 50 years old, married and has 5 children. She hails from Ishashi in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and has been in business since 2002. She requests the loan to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for sale and boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Kung C., age 48, works with her husband, pictured here in her place. They both are electricians, and collectively make around $15 a day in revenue. Mrs. C. and her husband have six children. One works as a laborer in Korea, one is a factory worker, one works at a Casino, and the other three are married and live separately. Mrs. C. would like a loan of $500 to purchase more wires and electrical tools to support and grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase electrician tools and wires for her business.

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married, and has one daughter, Victoria. They live together in Vasilyevka. Yuryi sells sausage, meats, and other groceries in the local market. His vending stand is well known for the prices he offers, and the affordability compared to market prices. Yuryi knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them the best quality in groceries. He has been selling goods for a total of 6 years, with consistent profits. Currently, he earns around $3000 a month.

Yuri has been dreaming of opening a small grocery store for a long time. He is hoping for a loan of $1200 to open a store in his neighborhood. He has planned and envisioned the plans for expansion for his trade and believes that it will be truly helpful for his entrepreneurial endeavors. This loan will help Yuri persist and take the necessary steps to achieve the success he has been dreaming of.

loans.use: To purchase a small store

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando is 41 years old. He is a dentist and his wife makes t-shirts. They have two kids, the eldest is a girl in 6th grade, and the youngest recently enrolled in pre-school. The family live in a house which they bought partially on credit. They are a very united family and their kids are very well behaved.

Armando has a lot of experience in dentistry and in the health care arena, and his wife has been sewing for many years. She does this from home so that she can look after their kids. There is quite high competition for Armando and his surgery is in a very busy shopping zone. However, he has gained many clients, and his wife has also been contracted by schools and institutions to make sports kits.

Armando now has some equipment he needs to buy, such as a dental chair for about $700. He will repay this loan with his wages. They are long-term clients of this institution and this is their third loan with them to date.

Translated form Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Armando es un señor de 41 años de edad de profesión dentista y su esposa es confeccionista de poleras. Ambos tienen dos hijos, la mayor es mujer y cursa el 6to de primaria y el segundo recientemente ingreso a Prekinder. La familia vive en una casa donde tomaron unas piezas en anticretico. Son una familia unida y sus hijos demuestran mucha educacion. Armando tiene muchos años de experiencia en odontologia y en el área de salud, la esposa esta muchos años tambien con el negocio de costura, esta actividad la realiza en su casa lo que le permite estar cuidar de cerca a sus hijos. La competencia de don Armando esta entre media y alta, su consultorio esta ubicado en zona muy comercial. Pero tiene ya ganada una cartera de clientes, la esposa de igual forma es buscada por colegios e instituciones para trabajos de poleras de educacion fisica por ejemplo. Armando presento proforma de equipos que desea comprar, aproximadamente un sillon dental le cuesta 700$us, con el saldo cancelara su crédito vigente en la institución. Son antiguos clientes de la institución, esta es su tercera secuencia, actualmente estan identificados con la institución.

loans.use: To invest in equipment/Inversión en equipamiento

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 51-year-old father of 5. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Ahmad sells birds. This is the third time he's applying for a loan through Al Majmoua. Ahmad wants to buy other birds to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy other birds for re-sale

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap S. is 56 and a single mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while one other is a construction worker. Another one weaves palm leaves together for roofing. The youngest is too young to work or study. Mrs. Pheap S. is a subsistence farmer and lives in Ang Tunloap Village in Kampong Speu Province. The household relies on the three children to earn money to support the family expenses. Mrs. Pheap S. has never obtained a loan from any institutes but has decided to ask for a loan to buy lumber to build her new residential house in the village.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a new residential house.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort S. is married, but her husband's income from teaching is not sufficient for Comfort and her four children. Comfort sells food items. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina is a domestic employee, and her husband drives a dump truck to transport sand and bricks. The requested credit will go towards maintenance for the dump truck (purchase of tires and general maintenance) to maintain their level of income, and ideally to increase it.

Their home is located in the zone of Irpavi II in the city of La Paz. She doesn't have her own home, so she cares for one in exchange for not paying rent.

This is the fifth time that she is requesting a loan from Impro, and the third time that she needs Kiva's support. Her history of repaying her loans is very good.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Justina es empleada domestica y su esposo es chofer ya que conduce una volqueta pata transportar arena y ladrillos, y el crédito que ahora solicitan será destinado para el mantenimiento de su volqueta (Compra de llantas y mantenimiento en general) para mantener su nivel de ingresos y en el mejor de los casos mejorarlo. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, No cuenta con un domicilio por lo que cuida una casa a cambio de no pagara alquileres.

Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva su historial la califica como cliente bueno es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación.

loans.use: Maintenance of their dump truck and purchase of tires

loans.name: Asha's Group

texts.en:
Asha has been selling vegetables in Arusha since 1999. She is single with no children. Everyday, Asha works from 8:00am to 6:00pm which allows her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $20. Asha is hoping to take out this loan so that she may expand her business and increase her profits.

Asha will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Matilda, who also sells food in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to expand her business.

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de six femmes ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent avec leurs enfants et époux dans des familles monogames au quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Unies par des relations essentiellement professionnelle et de voisinage, ces femmes exercent le commerce des produits de beauté(de differentes sortes laits, crèmes, pommades, lotions... et des chaussures(généralement en plastique).
Afin de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante de la clientèle, les membres de Danaya ont décidé ensemble d’intégrer le programme.Ils sont à leur  première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Elles comptent achèter  avec ce prêt, au grand marché de Sikasso 40 paires de chaussures en plastique, 10 cartons de produits de beauté de differentes games. 
Les produits ainsi achetés seront vendus  dans la ville de Sikasso en ambulant, au marché du quartier de Médine et dans les foires des villages environnants pour la plupart en détail et au comptant à une clientèle essentiellement féminine. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFAqui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Danaya is a merger of six women with an average of 33 years of age and 3 children. They live with their children and spouses in monogamous families in the Hamdallaye area in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). United by professional relations and by being neighbors, these women are involved in the sale of beauty products (various types of milks, cremes, pommades, lotions) and shoes (generally plastic). In order to satisfy the increasing demands of their customers, members of Danaya have decided to integrate their plans. Their first experience is now, with Soro Yiriwaso. They plan to purchase, with this loan, in the large market of Sikasso 40 pairs of plastic shoes and 10 cartons of different types of beauty products. The products bought will then be sold in the city of Sikasso through mobile methods, at the market in the Médine area and in the fairs in the surrounding villages comprised mostly of female customers. They are hoping to earn a profit of aproximately 20,000 FCFA per month (about $ 43) which will be used to pay off the interest on this loan and to serve the needs of thier families.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and shoes

loans.name: Sonia María

texts.es: Heredó de su mamá un pequeño negocio vende de manera ambulante en el mercado de Rivas donde ofrece gaseosas y una variedad de comidas como vigorón, tacos, etc. Con el crédito obtenido en ADIM pretende seguir creciendo y un día vender en un lugar fijo comidas rápidas variadas e incrementar mas la venta. Trabaja todos los días con horario de 6am. Hasta las 10 am. que es donde ya ha acabado de vender, en ese momento realiza las compras de la comida de su casa. Vive con su esposo que es maestro de escuela y sus dos hijas, a las que ella piensa darles estudios y que tengan una profesión.
texts.en:
Sonia inherited from her mother a little business doing sales in a traveling manner at the Rivas market, where she offers sodas and a variety of foods like vigorón (a Nicaraguan dish of pickled cabbage, tomatoes, onions, yuca, and fried pork skins), tacos, etc. With the loan obtained from ADIM, she aims to conitnue growing and one day sell her quick foods from a set location and increase her sales. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 a.m., which is when sales ends, and at this time she makes ingredients purchases from her home. She lives with her husband, who is a school teacher, and their two daughters, who she plans to give an education so they will have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy primary ingredients.

loans.name: Fatou Kiné

texts.fr:
Fatou Kiné S. tient un commerce à Belfort sur le grand boulevard 54m. Elle vend diverses marchandises (habits, cartes de crédit orange, parfums etc)
Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises
texts.en:
Fatou Kiné S. has a business in Belfort on the grand boulevard 54M. She sells diverse merchandise (clothing, Orange cell phone cards, perfume, etc.). She is requesting a loan to bolster her stock of merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Doña Agripina es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo”  del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, del Distrito y  Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 64 años y es madre D. 6 hijos que ya están casados (viven en Lima)estudio el segundo grado D. primaria. Ella junto a su esposo se dedican al negocio D. venta D. ropa americana desD. hace muchos años, nos cuenta que con este trabajo hizo estudiar a todos sus hijo. Con el primer préstamo D. S/: 300.00 nuevos soles que recibió D. Manuela Ramos  compro fardos D.  ropa americana para vender los días Jueves en el Barrio Bellavista D. Puno, negocio con el continua trabajando para cumplir con su pago puntualmente.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles que será pagado en 5 cuotas, comprara ropa americana para aumentar su mercadería.

Ella desea continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Agripina is one of the founding members of the ‘Espíritu Santo’ Communal Bank in Chimbo, in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 64 years old and is the mother of 6 children, all of them married (and living in Lima); as a child she was in school through the second graD. of primary school. Agripina, together with her husband, has worked selling American clothing for many years now. She tells us that by doing this work she was able to put all of her children through school. Agripina used the first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) that she received from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos to purchase bundles of American clothing, which she sold on Thursdays in the city of Puno’s Bellavista neighborhood. She has continued to work in this business in order to complete her payments on time. Agripina will use the current loan of 3000 Peruvian Soles ($975) to purchase more American clothing so that she can increase her merchandise; the loan is to be repaid in five installments. Agripina hopes to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing American clothing wholesale

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị H. năm nay 50 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 4 con trong đó 3 con đã trưởng thành. Năm 2004 chị H. tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Công việc kinh doanh đang phát triển thuận lợi cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Hiện nay đây là công việc đem lại thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị H..
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi H. is 50 years old. She has four children and three of them are grown up. In 2004 Mrs. H. joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in a general store. The business is going well and produces a monthly income of VND3,000,000. This business is the main source of income for Mrs. H.'s family. In this loan cycle, Mrs. H. would like to borrow VND15,000,000 to invest to expand her general store business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the general store

loans.name: Christina M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Christina M. from Tukuyu. She is single and has four children between the ages of 16 and 20. Christina has run a food-selling business since 1992. She buys her goods from local farmers and sells them in nearby villages. She works at the business for 9-12 hours a day, seven days a week, with help from her children. Christina currently earns about $370 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 to purchase ten bags of maize, three bags of groundnuts and two bags of beans in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of the goods she has for sale. Christina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase ten bags of maize, three bags of groundnuts and two bags of beans in bulk

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Abena B. is the mother of one girl and two boys, two in school and one yet too young to attend. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a farming and commercial town not far from Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Trading in bananas and oranges for the past eight years, Abena works very hard to support her husband in taking care of the family. She buys bags of oranges and unripe bananas from farmers in the nearby villages, stores the bananas to ripen and then sells to retailers in the local market. It has been her dreams to save enough money to support her children in school, so she is requesting a loan to procure bananas and oranges in bulk in order to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure bananas and oranges in bulk.

loans.name: Omolabake

texts.en: Omolabake sells medicines and provisions. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She requests the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and medicines to sell

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: VIRGEN D. FATIMA  se encuentra situado en el B/ 24  D. SEPTIEMBRE. El grupo  esta en su 3° ciclo.Esta compuesto por 16 personas. En el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta D. cosmeticos ,comida ,abarrote y venta D. ropa , mermeladas.  son actividades que necesitan creditos rapidos, las reuniones del grupo se llevan acabo los dias jueves  a horas15:30 PM en la casa D. la señora Tesorera .Ruth Negri Rodriguez  A .Las Sra:estan conformes D. trabajar con Emprender por que aprendieron ahorrar y tener mucha responsabilidad, ademas que comparten entre ellas.
La Sra Delicia V. M. es Presidenta del grupo, tiene 3 ciclos D. antiguedad como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento.La Sra Delicia nacio el 11 D. Junio  D. 1973 en el Beni .Ella se dedica al rubro D. venta D. cosmeticos ,tambien se dedica a los   tejidos D. carteras ,bolsos,monederos ,ect. Es muy responsable y cumplida en el grupo.Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas.La Sra Delicia con los ingrersos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su hogar, ella tiene dos hijos pequeños, que estudian en el nivel primario .
texts.en:
The "Virgen D. Fatima" entrepreneurial bank is in its third cycle, and consists of 16 people. The group includes women who sell cosmetics, food, groceries, clothing and jams. These activities require quick credit. The group meetings take place on Thursdays at 3:30 PM in the home of the treasurer, Ruth Negri Rodriguez. The partners are committed to working with Emprender; they have learned to save and they have a lot of responsibility, which they share with each other. Delicia V. M. is the president of the group, and has been for three cycles. Delicia was born June 11, 1973 in Beni. She works selling cosmetics, as well as fabric wallets, handbags, purses, etc. She is very responsible and accomplished in the group. She is also one of the leaders of the group and ensures that everyone makes their payments. Delicia helps sustain her family with her income--she has two small children in primary school.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and piola for macrame

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Zenovia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Zenovia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, útiles de escritorio, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su esposo.
Zenovia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Zenovia son comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo, aumentar su negocio y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zenovia is a member of the Banco Comunal Anabella. She is 30 years old, has 2 children and lives with her partner. Zenovia runs a store from her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, meat and school supplies. She works in her store with the help of her husband. Zenovia is requesting a loan of 2000 soles ($650) to invest in the purchase of milk, rice and sugar. Zenovia dreams of buying a car so her husband can work, expanding her business and providing an education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, rice and sugar

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie S., 56 ans est  membre de banc villageois de Pout Diack depuis 6 ans et demi Son activité  est la vente de poisson et de légumes. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Marie S., age 56, has been a member of the village lending group of Pout Diack for six years. Her work involves selling fish and vegetables. She wants to bolster her business. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fish and vegetables

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак кредитор в Микроинвест с 2007 года.Она использует свои кредита для увеличения своего оборотного капитала. За товаром ездит в Истаравшан.У неё трое детей, муж работает таксистом на своей машине. его доход не хватает на семейные расходы семьи, поэтому Муборак помогает мужу по жизни выходя на торговлю каждый день. Она благодарна Фонду , за то, что она смогла увеличить своё дело и стала самостоятельно ездить за товаром.Просит выдать ей очередной кредит в размере 300 сомони.
texts.en:
Muborak has been a borrower of MicroInvest since 2007. She uses her loans in order to increase her working capital. She travels to Istaravshan for the products. She has three children, her husband works as a taxi driver using his own car, his income is not enough to cover family expenses and this is why Muborak helps her husband in life and goes out to sell every day. She is grateful to the Fund for allowing her to increase her business and to be able to travel for products herself. She is asking for another loan of 300 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Mrs. Eluteria B. is 51 years old, and she is a single mother of two older children. She sells basic necessities at her grocery store for a living. When she began this business 10 years ago, she built a little house in front of a cotton-processing factory with the help of her sister, who lives in Argentina. After doing this for some time, she was able to acquire some land, where she currently has a house and her small grocery store. Additionally, she makes Chipa, a traditional, bread-like Paraguayan dish, which she sells on the streets of the city and its suburbs.

She is now seeking a loan in order to purchase various raw materials, such as rice, noodles, sugar, herbal tea, breads, starch, corn, soda, and Chipa-making ingredients. Eluteria’s goal is to expand her business so that she will be able to provide more goods and services to her clientele.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional raw materials (e..g, starch, corn, sugar, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda A. is a food vendor and sells clothes at Melcom in Hohoe. Linda has received a senior high education. She is single and has one child. Linda has been selling food and clothes since 1999. With the high demand for her food and clothes, her loan will be used to buy more clothes to satisfy her customer’s needs. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sokchan

texts.en:
Ms. Sokchan T., 22, is single (shown in the picture with her mother). She lives with her parents on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Her brother is a construction worker.

Sokchan has been a silk weaver since she was 13 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Sokchan is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Elizabeth es soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, negocio que administra con la ayuda de su sobrina, además Elizabeth vende dulces en su casa y tiene un pequeño tópico. Elizabeth tiene proyectado implementar una agencia de turismo.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido para la implementación de la agencia de turismo.
Lo sueños de Elizabeth son tener estabilidad en el negocio, implementar la empresa de turismo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the communal bank group “Nobleza”. She is 40 years old, single and the mother of one child. She operates an Internet café out her home and is assisted by her niece in running that business. Elizabeth also sells candy and runs a small dispensary. She has plans to open a travel agency.

Elizabeth needs a loan of 2000 soles to pay for expenses related to starting her travel agency. She dreams of getting her travel venture up and running, and that it becomes an established business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a travel agency

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es: Damaris del Socorro M. S. tiene 43 años, su prioridad para ella son sus 3 hijos. Desde muy joven se dedico al trabajo como es la venta de cosméticos. Ella siempre ha tratado de brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que tiene que ofrecer sus productos a muchas personas. Siempre le ha preocupado brindarles a sus hijos los estudios necesarios para que no tengan problemas en un futuro. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas, cremas y colonias. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Damaris del Socorro M. S. is 43 years old, and her priority is her 3 children. Since she was very young, she has sold cosmetics. She has always tried to provide good service to her customers. Her business is door-to-door, so she offers her products to many people. She has always been concerned with giving her children the education they need so they don't have problems in the future.

This loan is for working capital to buy lipstick, nail polish, creams, and colognes. Her wish is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Redson M., age 60, is married with six grownup children.   He has owned a general store business since 1970.  He works from 6.30am to 10pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $153. 

This will be Redson’s fouth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to renovate his house and increase his business and has paid the loans back successfully. He now hopes for a new loan to grow the store and to paint his house.

Redson  will share this loan with subgroup A of the Msasani group. The subgroup has 6 members, who are shopkeepers, drivers, grocery store owners and masons.  These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Redson is second from right in a blue t-shirt.

loans.use: To inrease inventory and paint his house.

loans.name: Exito Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Éxito, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia D. Huanta a 48 km. del departamento D. Ayacucho, el cual esta ubicado a 2,625 msnm.

Fortuna es viuda y tiene 03 hijos, se dedica a vender comida, ella cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos quienes la ayudan en el negocio. Fortuna, solicita un préstamo con el cual implementará su negocio con muebles para la comodidad D. su clientes. Fortunata, está ahorrando  para pagar los estudios profesionales D. sus hijos.

Teresa es casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, negocio en el cual recibe ayuda su esposo e hijos. Teresa desea abastecer su negocio con mas mercadería, por ello requiere D. un préstamo. Teresa tiene como meta el adquirir un auto, con el cual podría llevar mercadería a las demás comunidades.
texts.en:
The Éxito Communal Bank is located in the Huanta province, which is 48 km from the Ayacucho department. It is 2,625 meters above sea level. Fortuna is a widow with three children. She sells food. She counts on her children’s support, and they help her with the business. Fortuna is asking for a loan to set her business up with furniture to make it comfortable for her customers. Fortunata is saving to pay for her children’s education to become professionals. Teresa is married and has three children. She sells groceries; her husband and children help her. Teresa wants to stock her business with more merchandise. She needs a loan to do that. Teresa’s goal is to get a car, which she would be able to use to take her merchandise to other communities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Eugenio Ramón

texts.es:
En un establecimiento del mercado El bisne en el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Eugenio O. se dedica a atender su negocio de joyería brindando el servicio de reparación de joyas y de venta de joyas. Él se ha destacado por ser un excelente joyero habiendo ganado en años anteriores el premio al primer lugar habiendo sido el mejor joyero de Chinandega.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para la compra de oro y plata para elaborar las joyas y así comercializarlas en su establecimiento.

loans.use: Compra de oro y plata para la joyería

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 20 years old. He has owned a ground compressor since 2007. He works at the demand of the clients. He works hard with his brother to satisfy the needs of the family. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $600 to renovate the compressor and buy a new one to attract more clients.

loans.use: To renovate his compressor and buy a new one

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
At the age of 54, Mrs. Roberta D. is still looking for another source of income. Roberta is from the village of Aurora, Isabela, and is engaged in the business of retailing goods in her general store. She has already been in business five years, and she dreams of many more years in business. Her business serves her in covering her three children's expenditures in their studies. Two children are about to graduate and finish their studies.

Roberta dreams of succeeding in sending her children to school through the help of her business. At times she suffers shortages to cover her family’s expenditures, but she has strong faith to fulfill it all. Her husband, named Eduardo, is her helper in carrying her family’s difficulties. He is working in a rice mill as a classifier of rice. His salary and his wife's income are insufficient to sustain their needs in general. Roberta wants to improve her business for bigger income. She wants to borrow the amount of 5,000 PHP for additional capital, and to improve her business. She wants to have additional items for her store.

loans.use: For additional items to sell in her store

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf has eight children. With the help of his business, he has been able to provide for his family but he needs to continue to grow to offer his daughters a better education and to support the household. He started his business with skills he learned at a young age. Yusuf has been processing and selling prunes for more than 15 years. Yusuf learned quickly and was good at the job, so he decided to continue with it. He is a very hard worker and a family man without vices. He sought out the microfinance program in hopes of finding the means to support his business. Yusuf is seeking a loan in the amount of 3000 Somoni to purchase prunes to be able to grow his business and improve sales. He and his wife appreciate your support in helping them get ahead and continue to better themselves to be able to offer their children a better quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase prunes.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia T. is from the village of Cabisera.  She is 56 years old and married. To make a living, Constancia raises crops; mainly planting and harvesting rice.

In 2009, Constancia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Constancia from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family. 
----------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Estudió primaria incompleta y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Gloria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar una ternera para que produzca leche.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprar su casa en Ilave para sus hijos y vivir tranquila junto a ellos. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria has been a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank for 4 years. She lives in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. Gloria is 39 years old, married, and has 5 children. She did not complete elementary school, but she engages in buying and selling livestock.

Gloria tells us that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles and was used to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 1200 soles so that she can buy a milk-producing cow.

Her dream for the future is to buy a house in Illave for her children and live peacefully with them. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank is the savings account.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marlene Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Marlene C. forma parte del Banco Comunal Esperanza para Superar que se reúnen en San Jacinto un bello balneario localizado al norte de la provincia de Manabí.

Marlene está casada tiene tres niños, el esposo se dedica a la venta de mariscos, y ella  a la confección y venta  de edredones, cojines, almohadas, toldos, manteles que los trabaja en diferentes telas, utiliza encajes y cintas con detalles tejidos a mano lleva tres años  dedicada a esta labor que la realiza  desde muy temprano, recorrer  en el mismo lugar donde vive y  también tiene clientes de Portoviejo y Manta.

Marlene empezó con cien dólares para invertir en los materiales y le ha ido muy bien tanto así que sus ventas han aumentado, este oficio lo aprendió en diferentes cursos de manualidades y artesanías.

Lleva dos ciclos  trabajando con su banco comunal y  ha salido  adelante con el apoyo de la Fundación, con este nuevo préstamo solicitado   invertirá en  la compra de  materiales como telas, hilos, encajes  y accesorios decorativos para la confección   de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Marlene C. belongs to the communal bank "Esperanza para Superar," that meets in a beautiful resort in San Jacinto, located in the northern part of Manabí province. Marlene is married with 3 children. Her husband sells seafood and she makes and sells comforters, cushions, pillows, awnings and tablecloths in various fabrics. She uses lace and ribbons with hand-sewn detail. She has been engaged in this business for 3 years; she carries out the work starting very early in the morning, traveling in the same area where she lives. She also has customers in Portoviejo and Manta. Marlene started with 100 dollars to invest in materials, and the business has gone very well as her sales have increased. She learned this trade by taking different classes in sewing and handicrafts. She has been with her communal bank for 2 loan cycles, and she has managed to advance her business with the support of the Foundation. With the new loan that is requested she will invest in the purchase of materials such as fabrics, thread, lace and decorative accessories to use in the production of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, lace and decorative accessories to use in the production of her products.

loans.name: Saudie

texts.en:
Mr. Saudie T. is from the village of Southern Poblacion in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old. He is married and blessed with only one school-aged child. He owns and operates an agricultural business. His income comes primarily from the cocoa that he grows on his land. He earns 6,000.00 PHP each month from his business and he will use this money to repay his loan. 

In 2007, he joined PMPC to gain access its programs and services. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from PMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 50,000.00 PHP to buy materials to construct a fence (pictured) and and renovate his house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair and fence construction

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus Irario Etiang’ is a 45-year-old married man and the father of three children. The family lives in Kwirare, Busia District.

Festus used to be a farmer but, with the low income associated with it, he decided to start a retail business in 2004 in which he sells bicycle spares, buying his stock on a weekly basis.

After being taught by KMET ways to generate and save money for economic development, he saw the need to expand his business and, to achieve that, some financial assistance would be needed. He wishes to obtain a loan of KES 20,000 which will be used to increase his stock and, most probably, prepare some land for farming that will ensure his economic stability.

Festus is a man of big dreams.

loans.use: To increase his stock and prepare land for farming

loans.name: Benedine

texts.en:
Benedine is 32 years old and married with two young children, ages 3 and 4, both of whom have started their schooling. She used to be involved in second-hand clothing sales, but in the past two years she has begun operating a mixed farm near Kitale, Kenya. Her primary income comes from the sale of milk products to local residents, and she also earns money through her vegetable farming. She says that the main challenges to her business are the spread of diseases among livestock and that high employee turnover affects her productivity.

Benedine requested this loan through the Kiva field partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for 30,000 KES to upgrade and expand her poultry farm. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family's standard of living and she will be able to support her children in their education. In the future, she hopes to continually progress in her farming capabilities and acquire a bigger asset such as a cow.

loans.use: To upgrade her poultry farm

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
Nérida es una mujer de 26 años, se caracteriza por ser alegre y muy luchadora, está casada con Efraín de 26 años y tienen 4 menores hijos. Todos viven en la comodidad de su casa propia en un zona alta de la selva central peruana.

Café, plátanos, maíz, yuca y fréjol son los productos que cultiva desde hace 10 años, en compañía de su esposo; ambos desde tempranas horas de la mañana salen rumbo a sus chacras localizadas aproximadamente a una hora de camino desde su casa. Esta caminata diaria le gusta mucho a Nérida porque en el trayecto conversa mucho con su pareja y siente que eso fortalece su relación y les brinda estabilidad emocional a sus hijos, puesto que existe confianza. Asimismo, juntos administran los ingresos que perciben en cada cosecha, invirtiendo el dinero buscando el bienestar de toda la familia, además de mantener un ahorro constante para adquirir algunos bienes en el futuro.

Este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, Nérida es la titular del crédito, pero siempre asiste junto a su esposo a las reuniones del banco comunal y es como si él también fuera parte, pues son bastante unidos y les gusta trabajar en cada proyecto que emprende el grupo, como por ejemplo; ahora se está organizando para un proyecto de reforestación en su zona. Con el dinero solicitado comprarán cuatrocientas plantas de frutas cítricas y doscientas de café, puesto que ya cuenta con un vivero donde las colocará conforme vaya plantando.
texts.en:
Nerida is a 26-year-old woman, characterized as being very happy and having a fighting spirit. She is married to Efrain, who is 26 years old, and they have 4 young children. They all live in the comfort of their own home in the upper zone of the central forest of Peru. Coffee, plantains, corn, yucca, and beans are the products that she has cultivated for the last 10 years, with help from her husband. They both leave early in the morning for their farmland, located approximately an hour away from their house. Nerida likes this daily walk a lot, because on the way, she and her husband talk a lot, and she feels that this strengthens their relationship and provides emotional stability to their children, since there is trust. Likewise, together they manage the income that they receive during each harvest, investing the money with regard to the well-being of the entire family. Also, they maintain a savings account in order to acquire some goods in the future. This is the fourth loan that they have with MFP. Nerida is the loan holder, but she always attends the communal bank meetings together with her husband, and it is as if he were also a part of it. They are very united, and they like to work on each project that the group undertakes. For example, currently they are getting organized for a reforestation project in their region. With the money they are requesting, they will purchase 400 citric fruit plants and 200 coffee plants, since they already have a nursery in which to plant them.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit and coffee plants

loans.name: Yadmaa

texts.en:
Yadmaa is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Yadmaa’s husband operates a wooden product manufacturing business. He produces wooden products such as doors, frames, chairs and tables for a ger, and Yadmaa sells them to their customers in the countryside. They have been operating their business since 2000, and their business has grown over the years and they have gained much experience.

Yadmaa has good communication skills and she says, “As a result of our hard work and determination from previous years, our family's quality of life has improved. We have been planning to create our own workplace in the future.”

Yadmaa is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase timber at a wholesales price for their business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for her family's carpentry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut N., 49, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She sells fruit for an income of about USD 5.30 per day.  N. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more fruit to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. N. is pictured with her husband at Credit's office.

loans.use: buy fruit to expand the business

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura, de 19 años, es una joven muy emprendedora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus dos hermanos menores y lo que mas desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Siendo muy joven tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y ser independiente, por ello se dedica a vender bolsos y carteras en el instituto donde estudia. Es así que cada fin de semana lleva su mercadería a ofrecer a sus amigas y con el paso del tiempo ha logrado ganarse muchos clientes, eso la ha motivado a seguir trabajando. Ahora en sociedad con su mama, quien se dedica a confeccionar estos bolsos, salen a vender este producto. De esa manera ha logrado trabajar más de un año, sin embargo su mayor dificultad; es no contar con el suficiente presupuesto para confeccionar variedad de diseños. Es por ello que desea implementar el taller de su madre y contar con variedad de telas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a pagar sus puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta hacerlo. El crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de telas en Jean y cueros en general, para atender la demanda de sus jóvenes compradores.
texts.en:
Laura, 19, is a very enterprising young woman. She lives with her parents and two younger brothers. What she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Although very young, she very much wants to get ahead in life and be independent. For this reason, she sells purses and wallets at her school. Every weekend she takes her merchandise to sell to her friends; with time, she has managed to secure quite a few regular customers and this has motivated her to continue working. Now, in partnership with her mother who makes the purses, they go out to sell them. She has managed to stay in this line of work for over a year now; however, her greatest difficulty is not counting on having sufficient budget to make a wide variety of styles. This is why she’d like to enlarge her mother’s workshop and have an assortment of fabrics. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested funds to buy denim and leather to meet her young customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and leather to make purses.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a father of four, aged 28. He operates a bar which sustains his children and his wife. He lives in his own house in Kibaale, Uganda which accommodates his family and the bar business. He has been in the bar business for five years now. He says he started selling small quantities of alcohol but has seen his bar grow over the years with the help of the profits made and credit facilities from Hofokam. 

Besides the bar, John deals in selling beans and maize to earn additional income for his family. He is to use the loan funds to buy a television screen and generator for his bar business.

loans.use: buying a television screen and generator for his bar business

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  en la Compañía Espartillar distante a 7 km de la oficina de Carapeguá unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para trabajar en conjunto.
 Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las  actividades de artesanía ya que son de zona donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la artesanía.
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual así como la Señora Natividad quien necesita el crédito para la compra de hilos y telas de varios colores y tipos. 
La señora Natividad se dedica a la artesanía desde muy joven se dedica a esta actividad ya que su heredo esta actividad de su familia.
Ella elabora su artesanía y su marido quien decepciona los pedidos y los lleva para la venta hasta los clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá, in the Compañía Espartillar, seven miles from the office of Carapeguá, some Señoras of modest means, joined the group "Committee of Women Entrepreneurs" and decided to work together. These Señoras are hard-workers who make crafts for a living since they are from an areas where most people do craftwork. They need loans to invest in their respective work. This way they will be able to grow their businesses, which will help them grow as a group, and as individuals. Like Señora Natividad who needs a loan to buy thread and fabric of various types and colors. Señora Natividad has done craftwork since she was very young and continues doing it since she inherited this work from her family. She does the craftwork while her husband takes the orders, sells it, and brings it to the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for craftwork like varous types and colors of thread and fabric.

loans.name: Nhoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhoun P., age 57, lives in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Houy Koem, are farmers who own two hectares of land to cultivate rice and vegetables. This allows them to earn a small income to support their family. To support the farm, Mrs. Nhoun P. has decided to ask for a loan in order to dig a well and to buy a water machine to support her farming crops. 

This couple has three children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the youngest is a student. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To dig a well

loans.name: Wolale Vi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WOLALE VI est constitué de 10  femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la  préfecture  de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 42  ans, au moins 5 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide, du fonio et du sésame. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents qui étaient des prêts solidaires, elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne.
SARAN KONI D.  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de fonio d’arachide  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 13000 à 18000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of Wolale VI Group are married women living in Cinzara, a village in the prefecture of San in the region of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. On average, they are 42 years old and have at least five children. They grow groundnuts, fonio and sesame. In order to ensure that their agricultural investments are profitable, the members of Wolale I Group decided two years ago to participate in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After having properly repaid their previous loans, which were solidarity loans, they apply now for their first farming loan. Saran Koni D. wants to use her loan to buy adequate quantities of fonio and groundnut seeds, small equipment and farming supplies at the great market in San. After the rainy season, the harvest will be warehoused long enough for its value to increase, before it is sold at the great market in San and at the nearby markets, retail (or often wholesale) for cash to customers who mostly come from big towns. After their produce is sold, the group members expect to make a profit of 13,000 to 18,000 CFA francs each, which they will use to pay the interest on the loan and ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: La Sra. Luz Marina R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en la comarca las Mercedes desde hace 15 años. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda. Lo solicita para la compra de cemento, arena, piedra y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Luz Marina R. is originally from the town of El Sauce, she has held the post of primary teacher in the Mercedes District for the last 15 years. This is the first loan that she has requested from Ceprodel. Her objective is to improve her house. She is requesting it for the purchase of cement, sand, stones, and payment for workers.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sand, stones, cement, and payment for workers.

loans.name: Gulibada

texts.en: Gulibada R. is 42 years old and lives with her four children in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of Western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her younger child attends a local middle school, and the elder two children are students. Gulibada operates a needlework business where she sews many different household products. She started her business in 2004 after she had worked as a quality examiner for a local wool manufacturer until she became redundant. Since Gulibada has started her own business, her quality of life has been improved noticeably. She says, “My goal is to expand my business and create workplaces for my children so I can help them improve their own lives.” Gulibada is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to import needlework materials from nearby Tashkent, a border city of China.

loans.use: To import needlework materials

loans.name: Hazel Mayela

texts.es: Hazel Mayela tiene 37 años, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a la compra de ropa en general. Ella tiene 3 hijos menores de edad pues la necesidad de obtener. El negocio está ubicado de manera ambulante, pues sie4mpre busca la forma de mostrarles a sus clientes muy buenos productos. Hazel es una persona con mucho espíritu de trabajo y lo ha demostrado ya que  ella sigue luchando. En la actualidad, no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir más su negocio, el crédito lo utilizara para comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas vestidos y trajes.
texts.en:
Hazel Mayela is 37 years old and for more than 6 years she has sold clothing. She has 3 young children. She travels to make her sales, always looking for a way to show her clients her best products. Hazel has a strong entrepreneurial spirit and she shows it every day through her hard work. She currently has insufficient capital funds to stock her business. This loan will be used to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and suits.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha Y. is a widow  who lives in Abuno, Brgy. Pajac, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: General Store, Food Vending and Ready-to-Wear Clothes businesses.  She has four children who are 8 to 17 years old.  One of her children is already helping out in the businesses while the other three are currently going to school. 

Juditha joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Juditha has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,200, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 which she intends to use for her general store and food vending businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future of her businesses, her family, and her children's education. 

Juditha Y. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar S. is 33 years old. She lives in Geghamavan village, Sevan area. Gohar is married and has two sons: one of them studies at the State Engineering University in Yerevan, and second one goes to school in Geghamavan village. 

Gohar and her husband have engaged in sheep breeding for a long time and with profits from their business, they support their family and pay for their elder son’s education.
