Gohar would like a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy 20 or 25 sheep for her farm, and that will allow her to develop her livestock business and increase her family’s income in near future.

loans.use: To buy 20 or 25 sheep for her farm

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina A. is 45 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Agay-ayan, a part of Gingoog City in Misamis Oriental province on the islands of Mindanao. Marina runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products like coffee, biscuits and dried fish to the local community. She also makes and sells snacks like rice cakes and fruit ice candy. Marina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Moisés

texts.es:
El  señor Moisés C. se dedica al servicio de Molino lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación que está situada en el Municipio del Viejo.
Es soltero  tiene 3 personas bajo su  cargo, lleva ya 10 años trabajando con CEPRODEL obteniendo créditos periódicamente  y ha obtenido 12 créditos los cuales los ha pagado en tiempo y forma es muy responsable.
texts.en:
Mr Moisés C. provides milling services from his house which is located in El Viejo district.

He is single and has 3 people in his care.  He has been working with CEPRODEL for 10 years, periodically obtaining loans.  He has had 12 loans which he has always paid back on time.  He is very responsible.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to maintain his mill

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ines; tiene 51 años de edad, y es soletra y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de mates filtrantes, ella distribuye a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mates filtrantes al por mayor.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ines is a member of the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ines is 51 years old, single and has 1 child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling herbal teas which she distributes to grocery stores.  She would like to expand and improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy herbal teas wholesale.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy herbal teas wholesale

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es: Martha Luisa Becerra S., tiene 41 años de edad y vive en Los almendros, municipio de Soledad, con sus 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 14 años, allí tiene su negocio llamado “Tienda y Comunicación  donde Martha”,  que funciona desde hace 10 años en un local arrendado,  pero con un gran numero de actividades, vende ranchos víveres, refrescos, ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje, internet, telecomunicaciones, fax y hasta toma de muestras para exámenes de laboratorio, todo esto comenzó  distribuido en 2 locales y ella viviendo en uno de ellos, lo cual le generó altos costos por el arrendamiento , así fue como  entregó un local  y trasladó a uno de ellos sus negocios y su vivienda,  allí le ayudan sus  hijos  y también tiene un empleado de medio tiempo, porque ella se combate también  los medios día,  vendiendo almuerzos  y los fines de semana perros calientes, hamburguesas y fritos, porque Martha quiere un futuro mas promisorio para sus hijos a quienes quiere ver convertidos en gente de bien y exitosa. Este traslado le significa adecuaciones locativas que requieren inversiones no presupuestadas, pero se traducen en mayor disponibilidad de tiempo para atender los diversos negocios, por eso recurre a un Credikiva el cual invertirá en una estera metálica, un congelador y en la adecuación locativa de su negocio. Este es su tercer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización que la ha apoyado para ubicar su negocio en un punto muy comercial y con mayor seguridad. Su sueño es poder conseguir una vivienda propia para brindarle las mejores condiciones habitacionales a sus hijos y proporcionarle una educación de calidad. Su gran desafío es el alto nivel de competencias que la obliga a diversificar constantemente sus productos para ofrecer multiples servicios que sus clientes requieren y necesitan.
texts.en:
Martha Luisa Becerra S. is 41 years old and lives in Los Almendros, municipality of Soledad, with two children age 12 and 14 years. That is where she runs her business called “Tienda y Comunicación donde Martha” (Shopping and Communication at Martha’s), which she has been operating for ten years in a leased facility. 

She offers a wide number of services: selling snacks, groceries and drinks, photocopies, internet, telecommunications, fax and even taking samples for laboratory tests. The business started by being distributed over two locations, one of which she lived in. This created high leasing costs, so she finally gave up one of the locations and is moving her business and lodging to the other.

She is assisted by her children and also has a part-time employee. She also challenges herself at noon, selling lunches and on week-ends selling hot dogs, hamburgers and fries. Martha wants a more promising future for her children, whom she wants to see becoming good and successful people.

The move means local adjustments requiring unbudgeted investments, but will result in greater time availability to meet the diverse business requirements. As a result she is requesting a Credikiva loan which will be invested in a metal shutter, a freezer and in the realignment of her business leases. This is her third financial loan granted by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation,  which has helped her establish her business in a very commercial and secure location. 

Her dream is to acquire a home of her own to provide the best living conditions for her children and ensure they receive quality education. Her greatest challenge is the high level of competence that requires her to constantly diversify her products and offer the multiple services her customers demand and need.

loans.use: Invest in a metal shutter, a freezer, and the realignment of her business leases

loans.name: Javier Agustin

texts.es:
Javier de 35 años, ha sido un padre responsable desde que tuvo a su primer hijo con su esposa que es ama de casa. Ha estado trabajando como fotógrafo en fiestas y eventos ya que su padre le enseño desde que el era pequeño ha tomar fotos. 

Ya tiene 11 años siendo fotógrafo de eventos haciendo contratos para fiestas, eventos de escuelas, bodas, etc.  Tiene su estudio en su casa para hacer la producción de las fotos, retratos. En la actualidad ya tiene una lista de clientes fijos que le piden sus servicios.  Como él vive en una zona periurbana caracterizada porque es una de las más peligrosas de Guayaquil por el índice de delincuencia no puede hacer eficazmente su trabajo ya que él ha comprado cámaras profesionales para su trabajo y los ladrones están pendientes. 

Para seguir realizando su trabajo eficientemente él quiere comprar con el préstamo memorias y macos para sus fotos. Pero con otra parte del dinero quiere comprar cemento, bloques para construir mejor su casa y asegurarla.   Una de sus metas es tener un local para su negocio de fotografía y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Javier is 35 years old.  He has been a responsible father since he had his first child with his wife, who is a housewife.  He has been working as a photographer at parties and events as his father taught him to take photos from an early age.

Javier has been an events photographer for 11 years, making contracts for parties, school events, weddings, etc.  He has his photography studio in his home where he produces his photos and portraits.  He currently has a list of regular customers who request his services.  As he lives in a peri-urban area which is noted as being one of the most dangerous in Guayaquil, owing to the crime level there, he cannot do his work effectively because he has bought professional cameras for his work and thieves are always hanging around.

To continue doing his work efficiently, he would like to use his loan to buy memory sticks and frames for his photos.  With another part of his money, he would like to buy cement and blocks to better build his house and make it safe.  One of his goals is to have premises for his photography business and to finish building his house.

loans.use: To buy memory sticks and frames

loans.name: Angela De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIA: Ángela D. las Mercedes M. D. Berrío

Ángela D. las Mercedes M. D. Berrío lleva varios años sentada  al lado del Hospital San Vicente D. Paúl ubicado en Caldas, Antioquia, con un cajón D. madera vendiendo mecato, confites, cigarrillos y minutos D. celular; labor que se ha convertido en su mayor bendición puesto que esta actividad le ha permitido obtener el sustento diario para ella y su hijo.

DesD. hace varios años las ventas se han incrementado, por esto Ángela necesita un crédito para poder comprar más insumos para su negocio y acceder a nuevos productos, que le permitan satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes.

Al crecer su negocio, su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia, mejorará notablemente y D. esta forma también podrá cumplir el sueño D. darle empleo a otra persona y proporcionarle un puesto D. trabajo en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Small Businesswoman:  Ángela D. las Mercedes M. D. Berrío

Ángela D. las Mercedes M. D. Berrío has been sitting on the siD. of the San Vicente D. Paúl Hospital in Caldas, Antioquia for several years.  She sits on a wood box, and she sells packed lunches, sweets, cigarettes, and cell phone minutes.  This work has become her greatest blessing given that it has allowed her to earn a daily living for herself and for her son.

Sales have increased during the past several years.  Ángela needs a loan to be able to buy more supplies for her business and to access new products.  This will allow her to meet the needs of her customers.

As her business grows her quality of life and that of her family improves considerably.  This way she will also be able to fulfill her dream of giving work to another person and adding a stand for work in another location.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Honey is the pride of all beekeepers and one of the most valuable products on every Kyrgyz table. Honey collected high in the mountains possesses rare vitamins and a unique taste. 

Gulmira K., 53, is the leader of this group. She and her husband, a construction worker, have their own apiary. All day long they work hard to provide proper care for the bees. Honey has always been a means of good health for the entire family. 

Five years ago, Gulmira got the idea that her product could also be a profitable source of revenue. She started offering the product to her neighbors and acquaintances, and soon the demand became very high, and now she has regular customers. 

Recently she decided to attempt the export of honey to the neighboring country of Kazakhstan. For this purpose, Gulmira would like to get a loan of 20,000 KGS. She believes in a bright future for her business and expects to successfully repay the loan. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase honey

loans.name: Rosa Leonor

texts.es:
Doña Rosa Leonor M. L., es trabajadora de una Empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillado desde hace un año y diez meses desempeñando el cargo de Analista de Cobranza.

Es casada, de profesión administradora de empresa, de 28 años de edad. Tiene una persona que depende de ella. Ella vive en la ciudad de Managua en Monseñor Lezcano desde hace seis años.

Ella solicita el préstamo para hacerle Mejoras en la vivienda. Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL y se encuentra agradecida por haberle otorgado este préstamo, ya que este le ayudará a crear un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa Leonor M. L. has been employed by a water and sewage company for a year and ten months. She works as a collections analyst.

Rosa is 28 years old, married, and has been a professional business manager. She has one person who is dependent on her. Rosa has been living in Monseñor Lezcano in the city of Managua for six years.

She is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to her home. This is her first loan with CEPRODEL and she is grateful for having this loan granted to her since it will help create a better future for her family.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: EL Sr. Manuel Antonio G. D. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa  “Hotel Barceló Monte limar” desempeñándose en el cargo de Lencero tiene seis años  de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel Antonio G. D. is a current employee of “Hotel Barceló Montelimar.”  He works in Linens and has been employed by this institution for six years.

He has had three CEPRODEL loans that have each been used to buy building materials and supplies like sand, cement, stone, gravel, concrete blocks, etc. to expand and improve his home.

Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit to him because they have made it possible for him to improve his and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soap, sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
Román tiene 62 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores, teniendo como experiencia 5 años en esta actividad.  El los engorda y cuando llegan a un nivel de desarrollo adecuado los vende, y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a su familia con los gastos de su hogar. En la actualidad desea obtener más alimento balanceado para su ganado, para después venderlo. Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Roman is 62 years old, single, and he lives with his parents in the district of Olmos, located 2  hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of the department of Lambayeque. 

He raises and sells small livestock, having 5 years' experience in the business. He fattens them and when they have reached an adequate level of development he sells them. With the income that he earns he is able to help his family with the household expenses. He wishes to acquire more balanced feed for his herd for later resale. For this reason he has requested a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Maroufatou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Maroufatou fait le commerce de pagnes et divers produits de beauté. Elle a commencé son activité en 2008 et achète ses marchandises au grand marché de Lomé. Elle est ambulante et a employé une personne qui l’aide. Actuellement elle n’a pas assez de marchandises pour répondre à toutes les demandes. Ainsi elle sollicite un crédit au près de Wages pour acheter 15 pagnes Hitarget, 10 pagnes de Holland et de nouveaux produits de beauté. Elle a à charge un enfant et est née en 1987 à Lomé.  Avec cette activité, elle contribue financièrement aux dépenses de son enfant.
texts.en:
Ms. Maroufatou sells pagnes (colorful African cloth) and beauty products. She started her business in 2008, and gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé. She's a door-to-door saleswoman, and has hired someone to help her.

At this time, she doesn't have enough products to meet demand. This is why she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to buy 15 "Hitarget" pagnes, 10 "Holland" pagnes, and beauty products.

She was born in 1987 in Lomé, and has one child to support. Thanks to this business, she takes part financially in supporting her child.

loans.use: to buy 25 pagnes (colorful African cloth) and beauty products

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel R., es una confeccionista que eligiò trabajar en la lìnea de cortina y cubrelechos porque le gusta ver adornado los interiores de los hogares y es una foma de reflejar su delicadeza y buen gusto. Ella iniciò este negocio hace 30 años cuando habia trabajado 15 en la Zona franca de Barranquilla en una empresa de confecciones; su decisiòn estuvo impulsada porque necesitaba manejar su propio tiempo debido a las responsabilidades domèsticas en su familia, especialmente en su hijo de 20 años de edad a quien ha sacado adelante con sus esfuerzo y quien la ha motivado a lograr obtener una vivienda aplicando toda su energia al trabajo y ahorrando para este propòsito. Este es el sexto fiananciamento que Isabel hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos   ha conseguido mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y tambien ha conseguido apoyar el emprendimiento de su hijo en otro negocio. Su maximo desafio fue lograr cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar una vez separada de su esposo, pero ella reconoce que con el tiempo, sus esfuerzos se han visto reflejados en lo que hoy ha logrado con su tenacidad y disciplina. Mientras tanto Isabel sueña con adicionar un local a su vivienda, para separar el espacio productivo del familia y lograr mayor sociego y trabaja para que su utilidades no sean menores de un 24 %  que es el margen que relativamente maneja y que tiene una  tendencia al crecimiento.Isabel en la actualidad aplica a su credikiva con el cual comprarà  remates de telas que le han ofrecido con buenos descuentos y ella lo aprovecharà para aumentar sus utilidades en cada prenda que elabore.
texts.en:
Isabel R. is a seamstress who chose to work in the line of curtains and bed covers because likes to see homes be decorated inside, and it's a way to reflect her delicacy and good taste. She began this business 30 years ago, when she used to work in a sewing business in the French zone of Barranquilla. Her decision was influenced by the fact that she needed to manage her own time due to her familial responsibilities, especially to her 20 year old son who she has helped to get ahead and who has motivated her to buy a home, applying all her energy to work and saving for this purpose. 

This is Isabel's sixth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With them, she has been able to improve her living conditions and has also gotten help in supporting her son start up another business. Her biggest challenge was to cover all the costs of her home after she separated from her husband, but she realizes that with time her efforts have been reflected in what she has been able to achieve today with her tenacity and discipline.  

Meanwhile, Isabel dreams of adding a store to her home, to separate the work space from the family space and give her more peace.  She also works to manage a profit margin of no less than 24% and to make that grow.  Currently Isabel is applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy fabric borders that have been offered at a good discount price, and she will take advantage of it to increase her profits on every garment that she makes.

loans.use: to buy fabric borders at good prices

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen P., 48.  She is happily married to Roman P., a government employee.  They have been blessed with three children, one of whom is in high school and the other two in elementary school.  Helen is working hard to help her husband, in order for their children to be able to go all the way through college.  Together, they live in Fairview, Quezon City, Philippines.

Helen operates an electric repair shop.  She has been in this kind of business for quite some time now.  She hires a repairman to do what is needed for every item their customers bring to their shop.  These include household appliances like washing machines, electric fans, and televisions, among others.  Serving her local community, she earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 PHP per month.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan.  She intends to use this loan to pay for spare parts needed for the repair of electric items.  Helen believes that through this loan, she will be able to accommodate the needs of her clients that would eventually create income for her business.

Helen prays for good health and success for her business.  She desires that her children will be able to finish their college education and become financially stable someday.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she reads.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts needed for electrics repair

loans.name: Jeniffer Pamela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jeniffer, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 5 años la misma que este año empezó el primer año de escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Ella es un ama de casa que realiza los créditos para el negocio del esposo, el cual se dedica a la venta de  de carcasas y accesorios de teléfono, su forma de venta es ambulante, él se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta para ofrecer sus productos, en la actualidad nuestra amiga también se ha dedicado al mismo negocio ya que ella tres veces por semana le va a ayudar a su esposos y así venden mucho mas. El trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, sus productos los compra en Portoviejo en una distribuidora que le deja a buen precio. Nos cuenta que él lleva realizando esta actividad por más de cinco años.

Este crédito es para comprar carcasas y accesorios de teléfono. Lleva 8 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para el negocio de su esposo.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa bien construida ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The members of the El Pedregal community bank meet every 15 days in Portoviejo, a city known for its thriving commercial zone, for its festival celebrating St. Peter and St. Paul and for the friendliness of its people.

Sra. Jeniffer, 25, and her partner have a 5-year old daughter who just started at a local primary school this year.  Her partner is a merchant and she takes care of their family.  She is applying for a loan to support her partner's business.  

Her partner works as a street vendor, selling phone and phone accessories.  He travels as far as the city of Manta to find customers.  Sra. Jeniffer, too, works at the business, going out three days a week to help him so that together they can sell more than he can sell alone.  Her partner works every day from 8:30 to 5:00.  He stocks his merchandise from a distributor in Portoviejo who provides the products at a good price.

This is Sra. Jeniffer's 8th round at the community bank and she is a happy member because past loans have greatly helped her partner's business.

Sra. Jennifer's dream is to own a well-built house, very unlike the one she and her family live in now.

loans.use: to buy phone supplies for a retail business.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Isabela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Isabela,  ingreso a Pro Mujer por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás y que aprendió de su compañera. El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra para aumentar su producción de mantas (compra de lana) material que comprará de la 16 de julio (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y lo venderá en la Ballivian. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA" is beginning its first term in Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes Social Center.  It is comprised of eight members and its board of directors is chaired by Mrs. Isabela.  The members' business activities are varied and include commerce, production and services.

Mrs. Isabela joined Pro Mujer by invitation from a friend.  She has been in the blanket weaving business for five years and learned the skill from a friend.  The loan she is requesting is to increase blanket production by buying wool at the "16 de Julio" shopping center in the city of El Alto.  She will sell her products in Ballivian.  This work enables her to generate an income to support her family.  She is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the meetings.

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Dork

texts.en:
Mr.Dork has been working as a foreman construction worker since the beginning of 2010.  From his work, he is able to make around $5 income a day to use for the whole family expense.  With the cash, he uses it to pay for food expense, education expense, utility expense and other necessary expenses. 

To supplement this income, his wife plants rice crops and vegetable crop on her farmland following the season. Mr. Dork wishes to buy a new motorbike but he doesn’t have immediate money to buy one. So, Mr. Dork would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to use to commute to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.name: Umuco I Group

texts.fr:
Astere est un commerçant âgé de 62ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« UMUCO». Il  fait le commerce du café et des avocats  depuis 20 ans et il est en même temps cultivateur. Il est divorce et n’a pas d’enfants. Il n’a  pas fréquenté l’école. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 200,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de café et des avocats à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices.
texts.en:
Astere is a 62 year-old merchant who lives in the country heartland, in the city of Gitega. He has been in the coffee and avocado trade for twenty years, while at the same time being a farmer. He is divorced with no kids. He didn't go to school.
The Kiva loan of 200,000 Burundi francs that he is getting allows him to increase his capital to purchase large quantities of coffee and avocados to retail for great profits.

He belongs to the community group "Umuco".

loans.use: to increase his capital to buy large quantities of coffee and avocado to retail and make great profits.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a divorced woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and clothing for the family. 

For the past six months, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in that vegetables and fruits rot when few customers purchase them. She dreams of expanding her business and of starting a livestock selling business. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, cabbages, onions and mangoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, cabbages, onions and mangoes.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 31-year-old man. Ismail is married and a father of five children. He lives in Qalqilia city in Palestine. Ismail owns a small grocery store. Ismail wants to expand the grocery store by purchasing a different variety of items from the ones he sells like a better quality coffee, a variety of cheese, etc. 
Ismail, who is photographed here, took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the goods he purchased and attract more clients to increase the store's income.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing grocery store goods.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en:
Philippe is 27 years old. He is married and has one child, 2 years old. Philippe has been selling goods such as: soap, lotions, rice, sugar, biscuits, etc. for one year. His business is well-organized and he works daily from 8am until 7pm, every day except on Saturday. He currently employs one person to help him.

Philippe has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand his business by purchasing more and various goods such as: soap, lotions, rice, biscuits, sugar, etc. for resale. With any profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as: soap, lotions, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Osman. He is married to an experienced salesperson and has six children, ages 5, 8, 10, 12, 15 and 18. He has two additional dependents who live with him and help in his business. 

In 1996, Osman established his butcher shop. He started his business with money from the sale of a piece of land. He can now maintain his savings.  Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL.   Osman has already received and successfully repaid one loan. He will use the new loan to buy cows (4 @ 900,000 SLL), goats (6 @ 50,000 SLL), and sheep (3 @ 120,000 SLL). He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. In the future, Osman plans to open another butcher shop, support his children's education, and buy a vehicle to transport animals he has purchased. Transportation costs for the animals is his primary business challenge. He support 70% of the community with his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats, and sheep

loans.name: Zaragul

texts.ru: Зарагул жительница города Душанбе. Ей 51 год. Она вдова. У нее четверо детей. Зарагул имеет средне - специальное образование, он портниха. По специальности работает более 25 лет. Кроме того она занимается производством. Недавно она открыла небольшой цех, где занимается производством пельменей. Целью получения кредита является приобретение в оптом муки и мяса для производства.
texts.en: Zaragul lives in the city of Dushanbe.  She is 51 years old, a widow and has four children.  Zaragul has a secondary-specialized education; she is a seamstress.  She has been working in this field for over twenty-five years.  Besides this work, she is involved in food production.  She recently opened a small shop, where she makes pelmeni (meat-filled dumplings).  She wants to obtain this loan for the purpose of buying flour and meat wholesale for food production.

loans.use: to purchase flour and meat wholesale for production

loans.name: Rauf

texts.ru:
Рауф добрый и честный человек. Он занимается транспортными услугами на местном городе. В данном бизнесе он занимается один, супруга домохозяйка. Он имеет 2 детей, и его старший сын уехал в Россию на заработку. Младший сын тоже занимается транспортными услугами, а также иногда помогает отцу. Он уже второй раз запрашивает займ от Имон Интернэшнл, имеет хорошую репутацию и кредитное досье. Тот займ позволил ему  расширить его бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыл. Рауф запрашивает займ на сумму 2000$ США для покупки нового автомобиля с целью расширения бизнеса. Он благодарна всем заранее за помощь и доброты.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rauf is a kind and honest person.  He is involved in transportation services in the local town.  He works in this business alone, as his wife is a homemaker.  He has two children, and his oldest son left to work in Russia.  The youngest son is also involved in transportation services and also sometimes helps his father.  This is the second time Rauf is requesting a loan from Imon International; he has a good reputation and credit history.  Previous loan helped him to expand his business and maximize his profit.  Rauf is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of a new car with the goal of expanding his business.  He thanks all in advance for the help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur, age 33, is engaged in the breeding and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. He and his wife have two children. Elnur is the sole breadwinner for the family.
 
Elnur would like to expand his business, as the income from his existing herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase one additional calf. To do this, he needs to invest an additional 500 AZN in his business. He has requested a loan in order to accomplish this essential investment.

loans.use: to purchase one calf

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Lydia has a duck pen in which she raises and sells ducklings and duck eggs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy animal feeds for the ducks and ducklings.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the ducks and ducklings.

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: Aida habite dans une localité proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Elle s'active dans le domaine de la restauration depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle veut ce prêt pour acheter des marchandises et de renforcer son stock qui est en manque permanent. Avec ce crédit elle veut avoir une activité continue et du profit qui lui garantira une autonomie financière afin d'aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en: Aida lives in a town near the capital of Senegal. She has been active in the restaurant business for over ten years. She wants this loan to buy goods and to bolster her stock, which is continuously lacking. With this loan, she wants to keep her business going and make a profit that will guarantee her some financial autonomy, so as to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Hernaldo José

texts.es: Hernaldo estudia Licenciatura en Química y Farmacia, el crédito será usado para pagar los módulos del curso para poder obtener su título, por medio de su trabaj Hernaldo ha costeado los gastos de la universidad. Le inspiran a seguir adelante sus hijos, desea poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro. Se destaca de los demás estudiantes porque tiene la disciplina y perseverancia necesaria para la culminación de sus estudios.
texts.en: Hernaldo is getting a Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry and Pharmacy.  The loan will be used to pay costs of finalizing his degree requirements.  Hernaldo has paid his university costs through his work.  He is inspired to continue forward by his children; he wants to be able to offer them a better future.  He stands out from the rest of the students because he has the necessary discipline and perseverance to complete his studies.

loans.use: to pay his graduation costs.

loans.name: Pandan Wangi 2 Group

texts.en:
Sri is 41 years old and married with four children.  She has been selling clothes on credit around her neighborhood since 2007.  Her business is going well but she is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to increase the amount of clothing she can sell.  Her income allows her to help pay for food for her family.  

Sri hopes that in the future she can open a second business selling fried chicken.  She would also like to start to build a savings fund from her extra business income so that she will have money to send her children to college when they are old enough.

loans.use: to pay for more clothes to resell on credit.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is married and has six children. She has been farming for four years. She primarily grows rice to sell. Bonifacia does her best to support her family.

Bonifacia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for school fees. She hopes to send all her children to college and build a better house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for school fees.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 57-year-old man. He lives with his wife and two children, one of whom is working. He’s the only one responsible for his family and seeks to offer them a better future. He has operated his own vegetable shop since 1996 and has been working selling all kinds of vegetables for the past 15 years. He is expert in dealing with customers which makes them loyal. 

Today, Mohamad needs to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase his inventory of vegetables. In that way he will enhance sales. In the future, he plans to diversify his variety of vegetables and also expand his products to include natural fruits.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of vegetables

loans.name: Ricorda

texts.en:
Ricorda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Ricorda makes and sells snacks like rice cakes and pancakes. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy the raw ingredients to make snacks.

Ricorda became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Ricorda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Andree Josephine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 51 ans, celibataire avec 8 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 28 ans dont 5 enfants sont encore sur le banc de l'école.Il ya bientôt 30 ans  elle se lance dans la vente des produits divers quand elle arrête  ses etudes en classe de troisième par manque de moyens.
Elle a deja beneficiee de plusieurs prêts de Hope, et elle a remboursée avec succès ses differents prêts, a l'heure actuelle l'impact est très visible dans sa vie, ses enfants ont une vie meilleure, puisqu'ils ont au moins 3 repas par jour, ces deux enfants derniers fréquentent maintenant l'école privée, elle a grandement élargi son commerce.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des vêtements pour garçons, des robes pour filles des jouets et poupées pour enfants de tous ages.
Pour l'avenir , elle compte ouvrir une boutique pour vendre des habits; des jouets et tout articles pour enfants
texts.en: A 51 year old, the client is single with 8 children, who vary in age between 12 and 28 years old.  Five of the children are still in school.  Nearly 30 years ago, she began selling various products when she quit school in ninth grade due to a lack of means.  She has already benefited from several loans from Hope, and has successfully paid back her various loans.  At this time, their impact on her life is very clear, as her children have a better life, given that they all get at least three meals a day, the two youngest children now go to a private school, and she has greatly increased her business.  With this new loan, she is going to buy boys' clothing, girls' dresses, and toys and dolls for children of all ages.  For the future, she expects to open a boutique to sell clothing, toys and items for children.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, boy's clothing, and children's toys.

loans.name: Kuña Paraguaya Group

texts.es:
Kuña Paraguaya es el grupo formado por 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ellas son personas que tienen muchos objetivos y metas, sueñan con un mejor futuro para sus hijo y familiares, por lo que luchan incansablemente. Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya.
Ninfa es una de las miembros del grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, por medio de su arduo trabajo ha logrado mantener a su familia, y ayudarlos para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones. Su meta es tener un amplio local donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella acude a la fundación y a kiva para pedirles ayuda, pues desea un crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, lo cual la ayudará a tener mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kuña Paraguaya is a group of 13 women in the city of Paraguarí. They are people with a lot of objectives and goals. They dream of a better future for their children and families, and for that they fight tirelessly. At present, they are in their second cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women] program of the Fundación Paraguaya.

Ninfa is one of he members of the group. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Through her arduous work she has been able to support her family and help them so they lack nothing. Her goal is to have a large locale where she can offer her clothing and in this way keep growing to keep helping her family. 

She came to the Foundation and to Kiva to ask for help because she wants a loan to buy summer clothing, which will help her have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to later sell

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is a 40 year old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to purchase clothes, perfumes and cosmetics to sell. She plans on opening a store from one of the rooms in her home. She would like to increase her income in this way. Faten prefers that her photo is not on the internet, the photo is of her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for clothes, perfumes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man, 41 years of age, with 5 children all attending different schools. He also has other 3 dependents whom he takes care of. He is an agriculturalist who deals in the growing of beans, maize, and coffee. He works 5 days a week and 5 hours a day and he has been in this produce business since 1988. He was motivated by the desire to get enough income to cater for his family. He also owns a motorcycle (boda boda) from which he gains an additional income to support his family. 

John hopes to use the loan to buy fertilizers for his plantations. He normally sells his products to fellow farmers in Kyotera and neighboring trading centers.

His hopes and dreams are to educate all his children and to buy a new motorcycle. He, however, faces a challenge of unfavorable weather conditions, like drought, and limited capital which affects his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: CARLOS ALBERTO: Es un señor amable de 37 años de edad originario de la Ciudad de Bilwi, casado con un pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad. Actualmente, habita en casa de familiares. Con el propósito de reducir el hacinamiento y brindarle a su familia su propia vivienda, solicita financiamiento para comprar un terreno y construirlo poco a poco. Su sueño es construirle a su familia una vivienda de concreto (cemento) que es mayor durabilidad, para brindarles mayor seguridad y que vivan en condiciones adecuadas.

loans.use: para comprar un terreno y construirlo poco a poco

loans.name: Koami Simon

texts.en:
Mr. A. Koami Simon was born in 1972 in Dékpo. He is married and has two (02) children with four (04) other people he cares for. With an elementary level of education, he has worked as a taxi driver for ten years. His car is currently too old and the repeated repair fees it generates do not allow him anymore to meet the needs of his household therefore, there is a very bad ambiance in the house. Finally, he dropped the car in order not to spend the little savings he made on a car he will no longer be able to use. In the past, Mr A. Koami proved to be a very good head of family and took a very good care of his family. He is a trustworthy man deserving of financial support to restart business and improve the living conditions of his family. M. A. Koami Simon today has saved $1,200 and needs a credit of $2,000 to purchase a new car that he will use as a taxi.

Monsieur A. Koami Simon, est né en 1972 à Dékpo. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants avec quatre (04) autres personnes à sa charge. D’un niveau d’études élémentaires, il exerce le métier de chauffeur de taxi depuis 10 ans. Sa voiture actuelle est trop vielle et les frais de réparations répétés qu’elle occasionne, ne lui permettent plus de subvenir au besoin de son foyer, d’où une très mauvaise ambiance à la maison. En fin de compte, il a du définitivement garer le taxi pour ne pas dépenser le peu d’économie réalisée dans une voiture qu’il ne pourra plus récupérer. Par le passé, Monsieur A. Koami Simon a fait preuve d’un bon père de famille et a su bien gérer son foyer et son affaire. Il est un homme de confiance qui mérite d’être appuyé financièrement pour retrouvé son emploi et améliorer les condition de vie de sa famille. Monsieur A. Koami Simon dispose aujourd’hui, d’une économie de $1200 et sollicite un crédit de $2000 en complément pour acheter une nouvelle voiture pour faire le taxi.

loans.use: to purchase a new car for a taxi.

loans.name: Esih

texts.en:
Esih is a member of MBK who has requested her third loan of $125. Before she met MBK, Esih had borrowed the money from the local bank before, but she felt it was hard because the interest rate was very high and the loan repayment had to be made on a daily basis.

After becoming member of MBK, Esih felt relieved because the loan that she received can be used to buy food or inventory for Esih and Esih's child's general store.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by C. Patriawan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: General Store

loans.name: Adelio

texts.en:
Adelio makes party favors, piñatas and fixes up at party sites. She shapes the piñatas with plastic, and, as you can see in the photo, makes a lot of them for infants. She works with her husband, who is in charge of delivering her products to other parts of the country outside of La Paz.

She lives in the Chijini area of La Paz, which is also where her workshop is located. The party favors and piñatas are sold on a popular city street where all kinds of things for special social functions (birthdays, weddings, baptisms, etc.) are sold.

This is her second request for a loan, and she successfully fulfilled her payment obligation the first time. This current loan will be used to purchase plastics, glue, acrylics, ribbon and other decorative items. Her work experience and her credit history make her an excellent loan candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Adelio elabora trabajos manuales- artesanales de cotillones, piñatas y arreglos de local de fiestas. El trabajo de piñatas lo realiza con plastoformo y se trata de (como se puede ver en la foto) de piñatas infantiles. Trabaja con su esposa la que se encarga de entregar su producto en otras zonas del país fuera de La Paz. Vive en la zona de Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz, donde también es su taller, los cotillones y piñatas entrega en la calle Illampu de la ciudad de La Paz, ya que es ahí donde se vende todo articulo de acontecimientos sociales especialmente para cumpleaños infantiles, matrimonios, bautizos y otros. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 2, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus obligaciones. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de insumos como plastoformo, pegamentos, acrilex, cintas y adornos. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Purchase plastics, glue, acrylics, ribbon and other decorative items.

loans.name: Silvia Payano

texts.en:
Silvia chose the mini market as her business 8 years ago. She is a hard-working woman who has been able to maintain her business for a long time. Now it is time for her to make it grow; therefore, she wants to accept this loan to buy more inventory for her "colmado" or mini market. Every weekend the place becomes a night club for the people in her community to dance and have fun.

She is together with a man but not married to him, even though she has 7 children with him. Before she started her business, she used to stay at home and do house chores.

loans.use: To invest in drinks and food for her mini-market

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn Sokhum is a 36-year-old mother of three children and works selling food and some grocery products to the people in her community, where she can typically earn around $ 4 each day. Her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and also works as a farmer, earning only a meager sum.

Mrs. Phorn Sokhum has recently applied for a loan to expand her inventory by adding more grocery products and invest in her business to grow it.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more grocery products and reinvest in her business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, who is married with two daughters, helps provide for her family with her business selling inexpensive, small electrical appliances and light fixtures. She has a large kiosk at one of the busy markets in Uzhgorod. Hers is one of the few businesses selling this type of product at her market and with a good selection to choose from, her kiosk is a popular stop with customers looking for inexpensive, electrical goods. Anna has been in business for twelve years, so she also has excellent experience to offer customers.

Anna has requested a short term loan of $200 to help purchase new inventory. She hopes to continue increasing her income and has a couple goals for the future. One immediate goal is to pay some wedding expenses for her daughter who was recently married. Eventually she would also like to make a major improvement to her business by moving to a store facility rather than continuing to operate in an outdoor market. We are glad for this new opportunity to help Anna with her business as she pursues her goals.

loans.use: Purchase inventory items

loans.name: Kelli

texts.es:
After many years of hard work Kelli has gained much respect in the sales business. She sells the best quality in natural products in her region. After working 8 years in this immense commercialization she has made great economical changes in a positive way. Kelli makes frequent trips to the city of Huancavelica in hopes of commercializing her products. She puts great effort into what she does because of her three children, whom she loves. Her oldest daughter plans on attending the nearby university. She also does it to progress her well being, as well as her families'. She is also in need of a loan to invest in buying more products this holiday season, so she can make a profit. Your help is greatly appreciated!

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Tantos años de trabajo le han servido a Kelli para hoy ser una de las mejores vendedoras de productos naturales de su región, las habilidades adquiridas la mantienen muy contenta y hoy después de ocho años de estar inmersa en este campo de comercialización, han mejorado notablemente sus ingresos económicos. Kelli realiza con frecuencia viajes a la ciudad de Huancavelica a fin de comercializar sus productos de manera ambulante, sin embargo su anhelo es el de poseer un local propio para convertirlo en una casa naturista que le permita al mismo tiempo obtener mayores ganancias. Todo este esfuerzo que realiza es por sus tres queridos hijos que están estudiando y la mayor tiene planes de estudiar en la universidad de su ciudad, también lo hace para seguir progresando y consolidar el bienestar de su familia; por estas razones Kelli solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mercadería y aprovechar esta época navideña en donde ella tiene mayores ventas. Apoyemos a que Kelli siga esforzándose para progresar en compañía de su querida familia.

loans.use: Rent a site to make into the most visited naturalist store in the city.

loans.name: Ni Putu

texts.id:
Ni Putu M. is a mother of 2 children who works hard everyday. She wakes up early to sell merchandise around her village, Manistutu. Her husband, I Kt Sutama works as a farmer. Besides peddling, Ni Putu M. owns a pig farm with 11 pigs. Ni Putu M. hopes to get $550 loan from Dinari. Ni Putu M. hopes to purchase 11 pigs for $28 each, or $318 each. Her children are also involved in helping Ni Putu M. running th farm after school. Ni Putu M. buys pig feeds directly from supplier as it is cheaper. Each day she spends about $2.20 for feed mix, like concentrate and wheat. Ni Putu M. also pays special attention to her penś cleanliness. She works hard to run her simple wooden pig farm. After 6 month, the 11 grom piglets can be sold for $880. The cost for feeds and piglet is around $660, so she earns $220 profit each 6 month cycle. Ni Putu M. is passionate in pig farming. SHe hopes that Dinari can support her business.

Translated from Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Putu M. ibu dari 2 orang anak yang setiap hari harus bekerja keras bangun pagi-pagi untuk berjualan keliling di desa Manistutu. Suaminya, I Kt Sutama, bekerja sebagai petani. Selain sebagai pedagang Ni Putu M. memiliki usaha beternak babi sebanyak 11 ekor. Ni Putu M. mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari sebesar Rp.5.000.000,-. Ni Putu M. membeli 11 bibit babi dengan harga perekor Rp.250.000,- jadi semuanya Rp.2.750.000,-. Ni Putu M. tidak sendiri mengerjakan semua ini, anaknya tetap membantu setelah pulang sekolah.Untuk pakan Ni Putu M. langsung membeli kesuplayer biar lebih murah. Setiap hari modal yang dikeluarkan untuk biaya pakan Rp.20.000,- untuk campuran pakan seperti dedak dan konsentrat. Untuk kebersihan kandang sangat diperhatikan oleh Ni Putu M.. Walaupun dengan kandang kayu Ni Putu M. tetap bersemangat untuk memelihara babi. Setelah 6 bulan 11 babi penggemukan dijual dengan pendapatan kotor Rp.8.000.000,-. Setelah dipotong pakan dan modal bibit yang menghabiskan biaya Rp.6.000,000 keuntungan bersihnya menjadi Rp.2.000.000,-. Ni Putu M. senang dengan usahanya ini , harapannya Dinari bisa terus membantu usahanya ini .

loans.use: Purchse piglets and feeds

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr:
Single with no children, Miss Florence A. left school early to follow her mother into selling food-producing grain. Self-taught, she became independent and has been carrying out this activity conscientiously and devotedly for 5 years. Her energy and zeal for work make her a woman who is economically very active. In fact the growth in her working fund is proof of this. In three years she has never missed a repayment. She is 25 years old.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Célibataire sans enfant elle a très tôt abandonné les bancs pour suivre sa maman dans la commercialisation des produits vivriers. Formée sur le tas, elle devenue autonome et réalise depuis 5ans cette activité avec conscience et dévouement. Son dynamisme et son zèle au travail font d'elle une femme économiquement très active. D’ailleurs l’évolution de son fonds de roulement en est une preuve. Depuis trois ans elle n’a jamais manqué ses remboursements. Elle est agée de 25 ans.

loans.use: To buy 20 x 50kg bags of beans and 15 x 50kg bags of voandzou.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi T., 40 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 1998. Her husband passed away 8 years ago from a fatal disease. She was on her own to raise her 2 children. Now, her oldest child is 20 years old and the other one is 17 years old. During difficult time, TYM Fund was a great help to her. Besides being able to borrow money, every time she is ill, she always gets help from the branch and other members. Before, she used the borrowed money on breeding pigs and chickens pretty effectively. Her average income is 150 USD/month. Recently, she has been investing in breeding cows and this activity brings her a higher income. This time she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more cows and she will sell them when the price is high enough.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Thân, 40 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Chồng chị qua đời từ 8 năm trước sau một cơn bệnh hiểm nghèo. Một mình chị bươn chải nuôi 2 con, đến nay cháu đầu 20, cháu sau 17 tuổi. Trong lúc khó khăn, Quỹ Tình thương đã trở thành chỗ dựa cho chị Thân. Không những được vay vốn làm ăn, những lúc ốm đau chị đều được chi nhánh và những chị em trong cụm hỗ trợ. Các vòng vốn trước chị vay vốn chăn nuôi lợn gà mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế tương đối. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Thân là 150USD. Những vòng vốn gần đây chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò và thấy việc này mang lại thu nhập cao. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 950USD để mua bò và sẽ bán khi được giá.

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 54-year-old man who works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. He has 3 children. Ali owns a grocery store. This is the second time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. He wants to buy more merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Titi

texts.en:
Titi, 40, is divorced and has two children (ages 2 and 10). She also takes care of her parents. She runs a charcoal and fish business, which she started a year ago. From this business, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $35.

Titi is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and fish to sell. She belongs to the loan group Juhudi Iwepo, whose members are mutually responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal and fish

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema B., 49, the wife of A. A., 50, lives in Arifwala, Pakistan, where she owns a two room brick house and is the mother of two children. Her husband has been operating a cycle-renting business for the last three years, and she is now seeking a loan for the business to enable him to increase his income and improve the financial condition of his house. She recently successfully completed her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution of Pakistan.

Haleema has been joined in her loan group by four other members: Zubaida B., who wants to buy wheat; Ghafooran B., who wants to buy fruits for her fruit business; Muniran B., who wants to buy items for her electric shop; and Razia B., who wants to expand her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve their financial situation.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela sells food (she makes dishes and sells them in the street for reasonable prices), she has 4 children, and she is the only one who generates income in her family since her husband lost his job not too long ago and has no savings. She and her family live in Irpavi II (in the city of La Paz), but their rent is rather expensive given Angela's income.

This is her first credit with Impro. The amount will go towards purchasing supplies wholesale (rice, noodles, potatoes, meat, and vegetables), which will allow her to reduce her costs considerably and therefore improve her quality of life. Since she is a fighter, she hopes to help her children get ahead. She qualified favorably in our evaluation, which is why it is possible for her to receive this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Angela es vendedora de comida (cocina platos y los vende en la calle por módicos precios), tiene 4 hijos y es la única que genera ingresos en su familia puesto que no hace mucho perdió a su esposo y no tiene nada ahorrado. Ella y su familia viven en la zona de Irpavi II (ciudad de La Paz) pero pagan un alquiler bastante caro, dados los ingresos de Angela.

Este es su primer crédito en Impro, el monto será destinado para la compra de insumos (arroz, fideo, papa, carne y verdura en general) al por mayor, lo que le permitira reducir sus costos considerablemente y por lo tanto, mejorar su calidad de vida. Puesto que es una mujer luchadora, desea sacar a sus hijos adelante y calificó favorablemente en nuestra evaluación, esta en posibilidades de recibir el crédito.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anna's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Anna is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children between the ages of 13 and 27. She also helps take care of one other child who is 27 years old. She became a charcoal seller in 2002. She works from 10am to 7pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $75 from her sales.

Anna hopes this loan can go towards buying more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling clothing and food.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to increase her stock.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. has been selling maize, groundnuts, beans and other food items on the Cape Coast since 2008. Veronica has received no schooling, is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. Veronica is responsible for supporting her husband in providing for their children's education. She will use her loan to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband acquire a piece of land on which they can build a family house.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Inició su negocio como una minipulpería vendiendo cosas pequeñas de alimentos, con créditos que ADIM le ha otorgado ella empezó a vender de todo tipo de productos alimenticios, en un crédito de mayor monto invirtió en ropa menor, tarjetas de teléfono, gas butano para uso domiciliar, etc. Actualmente está consolidando su negocio y quiere ampliarlo con una pequeña soda ubicada en el parque de la misma localidad. 

Ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos pero quienes le apoyan directamente en el negocio son sus dos hijas que estudian y trabajan en el negocio. Ella expresa que con su negocio ella se siente como una pequeña empresaria capaz de realizar el proyecto que tiene en mente y que necesita el financiamiento de ADIM para cumplir sus sueños

loans.use: Compra de Productos

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Pedro P. me dedico a la venta de chicles, confites, frutas, churros, bombones etc, tengo poco tiempo dedicarme a esta actividad,  soy una persona honrrada, honesta y muy responsable con muchos deseos de superarme, antes trabajaba como panadero pero la situacion esta dificil los empleos estan muy escasos por eso decidi poner mi propio negocio ya que en el trabajo que tenia antes me despidieron por reduccion de personal, en estos momentos necesito capital para poder surtir mi negocio que es mi unica fuente de ingresos, por tal razon estoy solicitando un credito para sacar adelante mi negocio y asi mejorar mi calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Pedro P. and I sell gum, candy, fruit, snacks, etc. This is a fairly new business. I am an honorable, honest and very responsible person with great desire to be successful. Previously I worked as a baker but we are in difficult times and the business reduced its personnel and I was let go. Today I need capital to be able to stock my business which is my only source of income, so I am asking for a loan to make my business successful and in this way improve my quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit, snacks, gum, cookies, candy, etc.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es: Carlota tiene 47 años, vive con sus 2 hijos universitarios. Trabaja desde hace 12 años en la venta de artículos de cuero y de cuerina en un stand que alquiló ubicado en el centro de su ciudad, por ser esta, una zona comercial, le garantiza los ingresos para que siga adelante, diariamente con ayuda de sus hijos.  Carlota  se asegura de adquirir carteras y billeteras  con modelos innovadores y también de buena calidad, después de estos 12 años dedicándose a esta  actividad, tiene todos los deseos de seguir adelante para continuar sosteniendo la educación de sus 2 hijos. Para Carlota  hay meses D. año que son difíciles por las ventas disminuidas, así como otros meses, como en navidad,  en los cuales tiene mucho éxito y lo aprovecha al máximo. Es la primera vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, pero se compromete a  ser una persona puntual y responsable con su devolución D. préstamo. Carlota desea invertir en más mercadería, es decir, comprará al por mayor directamente de fábricas, las carteras y billeteras para abastecerse y aprovechar la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Carlota is 47 years old. She lives with her two sons, both of whom are university students. For 12 years, she has sold leather and imitation leather goods in a rented stand located in the center of the city. Because of her stand's location in a commercial district, she is guaranteed the income she needs to advance her business. She works in the stand everyday with the help of her sons. Carlota makes sure to procure purses and wallets with innovative designs that are of high quality. After 12 years in this line of work, she has every desire to keep going and continue financing the education of her two sons. For Carlota, there are some months of the year which are more difficult due to decreased sales. During other months, such as Christmas time, her business is very successful. She makes sure to take full advantage of those months.

This is the first time she is requesting a loan with MFP, but she promises to be punctual and responsible with the repayment. Carlota wants to invest in more merchandise by purchasing products wholesale directly from the factories. This way she can meet the anticipated demand and take full advantage of the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale merchandise directly from the factory

loans.name: Ludia

texts.en:
Ludia S. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Ludia is 20 years old and married. Her husband is a security guard. She has three children, who all attend school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay for her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Joyce J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Joyce M. from Tukuyu. She is a widow with two children, ages 10 and 20. Joyce has made a living selling clothes since 2002. She buys her clothing wholesale and sells it retail to her customers.

She works at her business for eight hours a day, six days a week, earning about $140 a month. She is requesting a loan of $375 to buy additional clothing to sell to her customers. In the future, she plans to open another business selling shoes. Joyce thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya comprend (04) femmes mariées qui vivent dans des familles monogames et ayant en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent dans le village de  Ségou coura Bamanan (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles font généralement comme activité le petit commerce et ont connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers un  autre groupe de femmes d’une l’association qui partenaire de l’institution. Après avoir correctement remboursé les deux premiers prêt, elles sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter 1600 yards de fibres plastiques, 1 rouleau de corde, 5 morceaux de lièges , 40 morceaux d’argile cuite , 2 sacs de riz et 10 pièces de wax. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Ségou et quelque fois en riz dans les magasins de Ségou coura. Les 1600 yards de fibres plastiques sont tissés en filet sur lesquels on fixe les senis et les fon fons ; Ainsi elles disposent de leur propre filet pour pouvoir pêcher avec leur mari ou leurs enfants sur le fleuve Niger. Les poissons  sont vendus en tas au marché de Médine Ségou et à travers le village de Ségou coura. Le riz et les pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest) sont revendus en détail à domicile et au marché de Ségou coura au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Leur bénéfice moyen mensuel escompté est de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et à l’achat des fournitures scolaires des enfants. Leur objectif est l’achat de pirogue et d’animaux pour faire l’élevage de petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of four married women who live in monogamous families. They have an average age of 37 and on average, 3 children. They live in the village of Ségou Coura Bamanan (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They are mostly petty traders and found out about Soro Yiriwaso from another group of women from an association that partners with the micro-finance institution. After having correctly reimbursed their first two loans, they are on their third solidarity loan which will be used to buy 1600 yards of plastic fiber, 1 roll of string, 5 pieces of cork, 40 pieces of fired clay, 2 sacks of rice, and 10 lengths of "wax" (African print cloth). They do their buying at the big open-air market of Ségou and sometimes buy rice in the stores of Ségou Coura. The 1600 yards of plastic fiber will be woven into nets on which "senis" and "fon fons" (floats?) are affixed. Thus they will have their own nets so that they are able to go fishing in the Niger River with their husbands or their children.

The fish are sold by the pile at the market of Médine Ségou and around the village of Ségou Coura. The rice and the African print cloth known as "wax" (cloth that is much esteemed in West Africa) are sold retail from their homes or at the market of Ségou Coura for cash or on credit to a clientele composed of men and women. Their discounted average monthly profit is 30,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and to buy school supplies for their children. Their goal is to be able to buy a pirogue (boat for fishing) and animals so that they can raise sheep and goats.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fishing nets, "wax" African print cloth, and rice

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 48 years old and married with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs and drinks. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N30000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Comite De Sante Cite Niakh Group

texts.fr: Le Comite de Sante Cite Niakh est un groupe de médecins qui a une pharmacie.  Avec ce crédit ils vont acheter des produits pharmaceutiques pour le poste de sante de cité Niakh.  Les médicaments sont vendus à moindre cout pour aider les pauvres.  Ce crédit est le troisième qu’ils ont reçu et ils ont bien rembourse tous les autres.
texts.en:
"Comite de Sante Cite Niakh" is a group of doctors who have a pharmacy. With this loan, they will buy pharmaceutical products for the health station of Cite Niakh. The medicines are sold at low cost in order to help the poor. This loan is the third one they've received, and they've repaid all the other loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Safohucha

texts.ru: Сотрудничество Сафохуча с МикроИнвест продолжается уже несколько лет. Сафохуча и его старшие сыновья занимаются куплей продажей запасных частей для автомобилей и имеют несколько торговых точек. Кроме новых запасных частей они скупают поддержанные и негодные к дальнейшей эксплуатации автомобили и разобрав по частям выносят на продажу. Предпринимательство является основной деятельностью Сафохучи и его сыновей. Самому Сафохуче в этом году исполнилось 60 лет, он женат, имеет 4 детей. На займы полученные в МикроИнвест Сафохуча заметно расширил свой бизнес, и дополнительная торговая точка которую он открыл 2 года назад является заслугой займов МикроИнвест. Недавно он подготовил заявку на новый займ и собирается приобрести новый ассортимент запчастей к автомобилям Опель.
texts.en:
Safohucha has been a Microinvest customer for several years. Safohucha and his older sons buy and sell new and used auto parts at several locations. This is the main business activity for Safohucha and his sons. Safohucha is 60, he is married, and has 4 children. With the help of Microinvest loans, Safohucha noticeably expanded his business and, two years ago, opened an additional sales location. This loan, Safohucha plans to use to purchase Opel auto parts.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare auto parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling spare parts for bikes and more

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma has been a food seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to Tuache uvivu group loan (Group code 2065). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $175. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Mwanajuma is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy items like wheat flour, cooking oil and beans for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.
