Mwanajuma is 32 years old, married, and has five children: ages 14, 9, 8, 4 and 4 months. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, cooking oil and beans for her business

loans.name: Emilce

texts.en:
The client is 24 years old, single, and has been living in Coronel Oviedo for five years. She had to leave Ciudad del Este when she was young in order to find work, and finished the sixth grade while working during the day and studying at night.

She currently lives in Coronel Oviedo, accompanied by her grandmother, who due to her age cannot be very active. Miss Emilce is a natural-born entrepreneur, and knowing that cell phones and their accessories is a good industry, she decided to open a business from the house where she and her grandmother live. The business is currently doing very well, as it is the only cellphone store in the area where she lives.

She applied for this loan to be able to travel to buy more accessories for her business, and in this way advance her life.

loans.use: To purchase cell phone accessories

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui que significa Ojos Negros en quechua.
Teofila es casada, tiene 55 años y tubo 12 hijos de los cuales 6 viven con ella, Teofila vende comida típica en una feria de comidas típicas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos.
Los sueños de Teofila son mejorar su negocio, tener una tienda de abarrotes y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Yana Ñahui Village Bank, which means Black Eyes in the Kechua language. She is 55-years-old, married, and has 12 children, 6 of whom still live with her. She sells traditional food on a daily basis at a traditional food street market. She needs a loan of 900 soles, which she'll use to buy rice, sugar, and pasta. Teofila's dreams include improving her business, having a grocery store, and seeing her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and pasta.

loans.name: Thida

texts.en:
Mrs.Thida R., who is thirty-five years old, and her husband, Mr. Chinda Duk, who is thirty-four, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1991 and have five children - two sons and three daughters. 
 
Thida has been selling flowers and bananas for twelve years. Her husband assists his wife in the business. They buy bananas and flowers from villagers and transport them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. 

Thida is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to build a fence around her house. She hopes that she will have no problem with her loan.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: La señora Maria Estela es originaria de la comunidad de Patzarajmac ella estuvo viviendo varios años en la ciudad de Guatemal y la cual estuvo trabajando en dependiente de Mostrador y hace cinco años empezo su propio negocio en la venta de articulos de consumo diario en su propia comunidad ella visita las Oficinas de ASDIR ya que eschucho por una emisos que se da credito y la cual ell necesita que se le apoye con un credito que le permitira surtir su tienda, manifiesta que comprar por mayor el precio es menos y con los ingreso le permite ingrementar sus ganancias y poder mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Estela is originally from the Patzarajmac community. For several years, she was living in Guatemala City where she worked as a bartender. Five years ago, she started her own business selling daily household products in her community.

Maria Estela visited the offices of ASDIR to explain why a loan should be issued to her. She needs help with restocking the inventory of her store. She plans to buy products wholesale so that she can get the lowest price. The profit will increase her income and improve the standard of living for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Jeruzalem Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario jeruzalem esta integrado por tres personas las cuales se conocen muy bien y son vecinos de la comunidad de san lorenzo,todos se dedican al comercio.
a continuacion se detalla las actividades que ellos hacen:
 
la sra. Maria Emilia B. es comerciante tiene 60 años de edad es madre soltera, depènden de ella tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado viejo de San Lorenzo, vende ropa desde hace 15 años, Maria necesita el prestamo para comprar mas mercaderia para poder vender en la 
feria del pueblo.

el señor Carlos Roberto H. esta casado con la señora Yohana Aguilar, no tienen hijos, los dos se dedican a la venta de chineria (articulos fabricados de vidrio) desde hace 03 años, el necesita el crédito para compra de mas mercaderia para poder venderla en la feria de San Lorenzo,
 
la señora Gladys Esperanza García tiene 63 años de edad,  es soltera no dependen de ella ninguno sus hijos, todos estan casados, Gladys vive sola su casa, su casa es muy bonita y se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 08 años sus ventas las realiza en los barrios y colonias de san lorenzo, la mercaderia se la envia su hijo de los USA. Gladys necesita el prestamo para comprar un fardo de ropa mixto.

todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Jeruzalem Group is made up of three people who know each other well and are residents of San Lorenzo. They are all business people. The details of their activities are as follows: Maria Emilia B. is a merchant. She is 60 years old and a single mother. She has three children who depend on her. She sells clothing in San Lorenzo's old market. She has been selling clothing for 15 years. Maria needs the loan to buy more merchandise to sell at the town fair. Carlos Roberto H. is married to Yohana Aguilar. They do not have children. The two have been selling glassware for 3 years. He needs the credit to buy more merchandise, so he can sell it at the San Lorenzo fair. Gladys Esperanza García is 63 years old. She is single, with no dependent children, as they are all married. Gladys lives alone in her lovely home and has sold used clothing for 8 years. She makes her sales in the neighborhoods and districts of San Lorenzo. Her son sends her the merchandise from the USA. Gladys needs the loan to buy a bundle of mixed clothing. Each of them needs the credit to be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing and glassware (glasses, plates, cups, decorations)

loans.name: Marydel

texts.en:
Marydel P. is from the village of Mialen,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Marydel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marydel owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Marydel has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,400.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marydel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marydel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marydel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to the borrower's house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Salesiano Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal “SALESIANO” Es un  grupo D. 13  personas D. las cuales11 son mujeres y 2 son varones representados por L. señora Luisa que van cursando su primer ciclo dentro D. L. institución, pese a ello han D. mostrado muchas ganas D. salir adelante en las reuniones del grupo. L. mayoría del grupo se dedican al comercio D. diferentes productos como L. venta D. zapatos, frutas, cosméticos, dulces; también se dedican a actividades como L. confección D. prendas D. vestir, elaboración D. pan y como empleados en las empresas. L. competencia dentro D. su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante L. actividad económica a L. que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con L. compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a L. experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios pese a que es su primer ciclo gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a L. Fundación Agrocapital y están dispuestas a sacar adelante a sus pequeños negocios ya que D. ello dependen sus familias.
texts.en:
The community bank “Salesiano” is a group of 13 people, of which 11 are women and two are men, represented by Luisa who is in her first cycle with the institution. Still, they have demonstrated a strong will to succeed in the group meetings. The majority of the group works in businesses such as sales of shoes, fruit, make-up, and sweets. They also work in the manufacture of clothing, bread baking, and others are employed in businesses. Their skill in each area is at a high level, and this shows that they will succeed in whatever business they are in. The loan is designated for the growth of their businesses, the purchase of merchandise, incomes and supplies to improve their earnings, which will permit them to give their families a better quality of life. Though this is their first cycle, the members already have experience with credit in groups thanks to credits from institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are ready to move forward in their small businesses since their families depend on it.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 25 year olds, and is single and lives with his mother in the Santa Margarita neighborhood in the city of Carapeguà. 
Previously, he worked with his father in a leather fabric shop. When his father died, he became the owner. Now he wants to bring opportunitiy of work to help his family. 
He is considering working with someone else. With the loan he wants to buy leather for his shop.

loans.use: to buy leather for his shop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 42 years and lives with four children between the ages of 3 and 9 years.  All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a three- room house where she is staying with seven people. Rose takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  She has a stall selling plastics like cups, basins, plates and bowls.  She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for nine years, servicing her 20th loan.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home. Rose sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. She buys her plastics from factories in Nakawa Industrial area, one of the busiest towns in Uganda, and she incurs transport costs to and from the factory. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season, as she works from an open place. Rose wants to use this loan to buy more plastics. She hopes to see her business grow stronger and start selling only at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for resale

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane S. is a resident of Marcos, Roxas, Isabela. She is 39 years old and operates her business retailing goods in her general store. She has already two years in her business and it is still growing.

Mary Jane is married to a kind and patient, loving husband named Eddie S.. They are gifted with four children and two are taking their studies. One is taking his college level of education and the youngest is presently in elementary school. Jane wants her two children to finish their education because she believes that education is the only wealth that she can give them. 

Mary Jane and her husband will do their best to provide for their children’s needs but even their source of income is really not enough. They will do their best to improve their business to provide greater income for the family.

Mary Jane is asking to borrow PHP 5,000 to improve her business to earn a higher income for her family. She wants to have more stock to be able to gain more profit.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to improve her business

loans.name: Oke

texts.en: Oke makes a living selling crates of eggs to her customers. This is the high season for her business, and she hopes to increase her sales. She is a hard-working woman who is 30 years old, married and has no children. Her husband makes a living selling electrical materials in their home town of Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. Oke has applied for a loan for $350, which she will use to buy more crates of eggs to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future by starting a poultry farm. She extends sincere thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en: With her rice farming business, Wilfreda is able to provide the needs of her family. She is 52 years old and lives in Surallah, South Cotabato. She has four children; the eldest is 19 years old. She wants to continue sending her children to school by providing them with their tuition fees and school supplies. She heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc. offering loans to entrepreneurs like her. On June 2008, she joined and is thankful for the low interest charged. Now she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 viven con ella. Estudió primaria incompleta y se dedica a la venta de sogas.
Elsa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar hilos, lana y nylon.
Su sueño para el futuro es seguir trabajando y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad en las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Elsa has been a member of the “Lupakas” cooperative bank for 2 years, in the Pilcuyo district of the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has 5 children, 4 of whom live with her. She did not complete her primary school education, and dedicates herself to the sale of rope. Elsa tells us that she used her first loan of 500.00 Peruvian soles from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her working capital. She will request a loan of 1,500.00 soles to buy threads, yarn and nylon. Her dreams for the future include continuing to work, and seeing her children become professionals. What she likes most about her cooperative bank is being punctual and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase threads, yarn and nylon.

loans.name: Julio Agustin

texts.es: Julio tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente hace 6 años, tiene un solo hijo. Julio vive en casa de un familiar, El adquirió la mototaxi con ahorros obtenidos de los años dedicados a esta actividad. El tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio que brinda, ya que hace 1 año adquirió una mototaxi nueva. Julio y su cónyuge sueñan con tener su casa propia y así mejorar la calidad vida de su familias. Julio destina todos los ingresos para la educación de su hijo, el cual se encuentra en edad escolar. Julio desea tener mayores ingresos y así brindarle seguridad y bienestar a su hijo, solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento de su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Julio is 33 years old and has been in a common law marriage for the past six years. He has one son and lives at the home of a relative. With his savings, Julio acquired a motorcycle taxi and has been dedicated to providing transportation services. He now has extensive experience since it has been a year since he bought his new vehicle.

Julio and his common law wife dream of owning a home and improving the quality of life for their family. All of his earnings will go toward his son’s education, since he is currently enrolled in school. Julio hopes to improve his income and provide for the security and welfare of his son. He is requesting a loan to pay for maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng C., age 42, is married and lives with her four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. C. is in a business of selling smoked fish. She is able to earn a gross income of USD $30 per day. The family is also assisted by her husband, a skilled fisherman who earns a gross income of USD $16 per day. 

C. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses and reduce their daily expenses. Therefore, C. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner. She wants to use the  loan to buy more smoked fish to sell. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza, D. 60 años, es una madre D. familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Paulino, D. 64 años, y con su hijo Heiler D. 12 años, quienes son el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos.

El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. repuestos D. segunda mano D. automóviles, aunque sabe que es un negocio donD. predominan los varones, se siente muy segura en poder competir  sin prejuicios, es por eso que decidió trabajar muy duro y siente que poco a poco sus esfuerzos van dando los frutos esperados, con los cuales pueda ayudar en su hogar. 
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es vender sus repuestos, tiene 30 años D. experiencia y considera que lo más difícil D. su trabajo es conseguir lo repuestos, ya que tiene que recorrer las calles D. la ciudad D. Juliaca en busca D. ellos.
Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar lo ingresos necesarios para que su hijo pueda culminar sus estudios.

Este es el segundo préstamo D. Lorenza con MFP, por lo cual se siente en la responsabilidad D. pagarlo a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a muchos más; en su banco comunal le tienen mucho cariño. Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en mejorar su negocio y comprar más repuestos para autos y así satisfacer a la gran cantidad D. clientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Lorenza, 60 years old, is the very happy and hard-working mother of a family. She lives in her own house with her husband Paulino, who is 64, and her son Heiler, who is 12. They are the motive for all her efforts. The business to which she is dedicated sells parts for second-hand automobiles. Though she is aware that it is a business in which men predominate, she feels very confident in being able to compete without prejudice. It is for that reason that she decided to work very hard, and feels that little by little, her efforts are providing the fruit that she hoped for, enabling her to help in her home. What she likes most about the work is selling parts. She has 30 years experience and considers the most difficult part to be obtaining the parts, since she has to trek through the streets of the city of Juliaca in search of them. Over time, she hope that her business will grow and offer the necessary income for her son to complete his studies. This is Lorenza's second loan through MFP, and she feels the responsibility to pay on time, since she wants to gain access to many more. The members of her communal bank feel much affection for her. The 2,000 New Sols she solicits will be invested in improving her business and to buy more auto parts, thus satisfying the large quantity of customers she has.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INCREASING HER STOCK OF PARTS FOR USED CARS

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
Las Maravillas así se denomina  el Comité conformado en fecha 17 de marzo de 2008, en la Compañía Jhugua Ñaro de la Ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la Sra. Dionisia B. quien se dedica a la venta de tabacos (cigarros) y actual Directora General, se contacto con la asesora para interiorizarse de como funciona el programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,posteriormente logró conformar su grupo con unas 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto con la Fundación Paraguaya .
Todas las integrantes del comité asisten a las reuniones semanales y trabajan en forma conjunta para el logro de todos los objetivos que tienen en común.
Es un grupo muy activo y solidario que se desempeñan excelentemente como tal,demuestran compañerismo y se ha formado una muy linda amistad con todas las integrantes del Comité.
Todas las mujeres son muy humildes y luchadoras así como la señora Dionisia B. quien se dedica a la fabricación y venta de cigarros, ella realiza esta actividad para ayudar a su marida quien no posee un ingreso fijo ya que es jornalero, pero juntos toda la familia procura y trata de sobresalir de la mejor manera posible.
Se citan las actividades de cada una

Venta de tabacos

texts.en:
Las Maravillas is the name of this committee, established on March 17, 2008 in the Compañía Jhugua Ñaro of the City of Itá, thanks to Ms. Dionisia B., the current general director, who sells tobacco (cigars) for a living. She got in touch with the consultant to obtain information on how the Committee of Enterprising Women program works. Subsequently, she was able to start her own group of 17 women who are working contentedly with Fundación Paraguaya.

All the committee members attend weekly meetings and work in solidarity in order to achieve their common goals.

This is a very active and united group of women who fulfill their duties excellently, demonstrating comradeship. There have been some beautiful friendships formed among the members of the committee.

All of these women are humble and hardworking, like Ms. Dionisia B., who makes and sells cigars in order to help her husband, who does not have a steady job because he is a day laborer. However, the whole family works together to try to get ahead as best as they possibly can. The following are the group members and their businesses: 1 Dionisia B. Tobacco sales 2 Ciriaca A. Tobacco sales 3 Heriberta A. Tobacco sales 4 Felisa Ávalos Tobacco sales 5 Amparo Fernández Book and notions shop 6 Mariana R. General store 7 Epifania A. Tobacco sales 8 Lucia Ávalos Tobacco sales 9 Andrea Ávalos Tobacco sales 10 Laura C. Clothing, bedspread, and CD sales 11 Mirtha B. Tobacco sales 12 Josefina R. Tobacco sales 13 Perla O. Tobacco sales 14 Elisa O. Tobacco sales 15 María A. Tobacco sales 16 Lidia A. Tobacco sales 17 María C. Tobacco sales

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tobacco to make cigars

loans.name: Folrenia

texts.en:
Florenia is a very productive mother and grandmother for her children and grandchildren. Previously, she sold pigs that she fattened and has able to help her children support the education of her grandchildren. Out of her profit she bought another pig to replace the one she sold. Furthermore, Florenia has able to sustain her variety store whose profits have provided her with her daily needs until now.

For a hard working "Lola" (grand mother) and "Nanay" (mother), her dreams would mean nothing if not because of the support of people around the world through Kiva and if not because of their loan entrusted to her through ASHI. With that, Florenia is so thankful for the opportunity extended to her and her family. Since she repaid the whole amount she received from Kiva through a previous loan, now she is requesting a much larger amount, which she will use to purchase another pig/hog for fattening in addition to the one she has. Once it is sold, her profits will doubled, as will the capital. The pigs can either be sold alive or slaughtered to meat vendors or people around their village.

loans.use: To purcahse additional pigs for fattening and their feed until they are ready for sale.

loans.name: Afi Enyonam

texts.en: Afi Enyonam A. is a trained cook. She lives in Lomé, Togo with her husband and two children. She now works selling Fan Milk products, a variety of frozen milk products that are very popular when facing the hot Togolese sun. Mrs. A. began selling these products in 1999 through her business called “Gigovi.” She is now asking for her first loan from WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock of Fan Milk products. This loan will help Mrs. A.’s business grow and keep her customers cool and satisfied.

loans.use: Purchase of Fan Milk Products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of wheat to sell

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
O. Dilorom is a 50-year-old married mother of 3 children who has been running her own business for more than a year now. She has a small salon where she sells and rents traditional wedding dresses. Traditionally families in Tajikistan are large, consequently there are lots of marriages and Dilorom has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family’s income. Today Dilorom requests 3000 USD for which will be used to purchase new wedding dresses. Dilorom would like to assure all deciding to support her that she will pay the loan in time and sincerely thanks you.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new wedding dresses for her shop.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro A. T. desde hace 5 años se dedica al trasporte publico, esta es la manera que el percibe un ingreso para abastecer los gastos de su familia. El camión donde trabaja y traslada al pasajero esta fallando del motor es por ello que el pide el apoyo para comprar un nuevo y no exponer a la gente que traslada a un accidente. Pedro quiere dar un mejor servicio y así poder tener más ingresos para ofrecer a su familia una mejora calidad de vida
texts.en:
For five years, Pedro A. T. has worked in public transportation; this is the way he earns an income to cover his family's expenses. He uses his bus for his work transporting passengers, and the motor is breaking down. For this reason he asks for help to buy a new one and avoid exposing his passengers to the risk of an accident. Pedro wants to offer better service and thus have more income to give his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bus motor

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a young man living in a remote area of Kibaale, Uganda. He is married to a peasant farmer and together they have two children, aged 3 and 1 years. Though he is young, Fred owns a residential house already. He deals in produce (groundnuts, beans, and maize) as his business. He says transport of his purchases is his major hardship and he hopes to address it one day by buying his own motorcycle. 

At 30 years of age, he says he can achieve that feat over time through hard work in selling dry foods. This is his first loan from HOFOKAM and he is to use the loan funds to buy groundnuts, beans, maize for resale.

loans.use: buying groundnuts (peanuts), beans, maize for resale

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose C. T.  es un señor de 54 años de edad el  cual vive  con su esposa en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico,  ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; reconocida como una comunidad amiga de la tranquilidad  y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería  y turismo. 

Don José  se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de Hortalizas como Banano, plátano pero sobretodo ñampi. Dice que el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a la venta de sus productos  sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.
En estos momentos Don José desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢300,000 (trescientos  mil colones), para comprar el abono que necesita para su terreno. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha de ñampi, ya que asegura que la próxima cosecha será para exportación.
José forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido ya  dos microcréditos con los que ha podido desarrollarse como empresario de una manera exitosa
texts.en:
Jose C. T. is a 54-year-old man who lives with his wife in a rural Costa Rican community called Abanico, located in San Isidro de Penas Blancas, San Ramon, in the province of Alajuela. It is known as a friendly, peaceful community dedicated to productive activities such as agriculture, livestock and tourism. Jose is in agriculture, specifically the planting of foods such as bananas and plantains, but mostly ñampi [a vegetable in the sweet potato family]. He says that the market for this produce is very good. He comments that thanks to the sales of his products his living conditions have improved considerably and he has grown as a person and acquired much knowledge. Now Jose wants to obtain a microloan of 300,000 colones to buy the fertilizer that he needs for his land. With this investment he hopes to achieve a good ñampi harvest, as the next harvest will be exported. Jose is part of the Credito Communal de Abanico Group, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. As such he has already recieved two microloans with which he has been able to develop successfully as a businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is married with six children and all her children go school. She also takes care of additional family members.  Recently Hadjah changed her business from frying eatables like samosas, chapatti and donuts to selling charcoal. She has been in this charcoal business for a few months.  She sells charcoal in Kawempe market, both retail and wholesale, to all categories of people.  She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys bags of charcoal from the very market where she works. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal.

Hadjah works six days a week and her business challenges include thieves and the rainy season because she works in an open place.  She hopes to see her business grow bigger, wants to start going to villages for charcoal, and also wants to build a house.  Hadjah joined MCDT because of the low interest rates charged compared to other finance institutions.  Hadjah rents and resides in a four-room house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, market dues, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Omunaku Kaghama Jinja Womens Group

texts.en:
If one is to cast their mind back to the Ugandan days of old, they will be brought to terms with the fact that most people earned their livelihood through subsistence farming.  61-year-old N. Rose is old enough to call to mind those days. Sixteen years ago she was more inclined to subsistence farming until she realized the old status quo had changed, as many farmers today are commercially oriented, planting cash crops that bring them return value profits at the end of every harvest season. 

She decided then that she had to start a tailoring business where she mostly sold the clothes she had sewn in Buwenda-Jinja. Being a widow, she knew she had her responsibility cut out for her. With six children to take care of, she knew only hard work would be her saving grace. And her saving grace it truly has been, as she is seeing the dividends. In a week, profits from her business average up to $27. She also has a poultry business. With this loan, she wants to buy an electric sewing machine that will make her work much faster and more improved.

loans.use: To purchase of an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz, de 33 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Kyo de 3 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio al que Mariluz se dedica es la venta de productos naturales, los cuales vende en la ciudad de Lima, es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre consigue vender todos sus productos, ya que si no lo hace siente que la venta del día no fue fructífera y que al siguiente día tendrá que trabajar el doble. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre los remedios que necesitan, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de ventas, es por eso que anhela tener con el tiempo una tienda donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad y comodidad. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y solidaria. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos naturales, para ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Mariluz, who is 33, is a very loving and hardworking mother. She lives in her own house with her beloved son Kyo, who is 3 years old, and to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. The business in which Mariluz works is the sale of natural products, which she sells in the city of Lima. She is a very persuasive salesperson and always succeeds in selling all her products, since if she doesn't, she feels that the day's sales weren't fruitful and that she will have to work twice as hard the next day. What she likes most about her work is advising her customers about the remedies that they need. She has had this business for 12 years, and for her, the most difficult part is having to remain all day at her market stall. For this reason, she dreams of having, in the course of time, a shop where she can sell with more peace and comfort. This is Mariluz's second loan with MFP, and she expects to be very punctual in her payments. In her community bank, she is a very responsible and community-minded member. With the 700 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy more natural products, in order to offer her customers a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more natural products to offer her customers.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites T., age 48, owns and operates a specialized retail store in the village of San Jose, Enrile, Cagayan, where she sells second-hand clothes to local community members. Marites has been engaged in her business for over a year now and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. She is now requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. Marites is widowed and has three school-aged children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El Sr. Santos M. es originario del municipio de El Sauce se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene un año de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de comprar zinc para mejorar el techo de su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Santos M. is a native of the municipality of Sauce. He works as a security guard in the town hall of El Sauce where he has been working for a year. This is the first loan that he has requested with CEPRODEL and he plans to use it to purchase zinc to improve the roof of the house where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase zinc

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has a mixed farm in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya. He has been farming for 30 years and has employed one farmhand. His farm produces arrowroot, yams, sweet potatoes, maize and fruits, which he sells at a local market. He also practices small-scale farming of coffee and tea, which he sells through the coffee factory and the Kenya Tea Development Authority respectively. He also depends on the income from his pension, a home-based museum and a quarry to cater for the needs of his family.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 Kenyan shilings from Juhudi Kilimo to venture into fish farming and poultry farming. He says that these projects will increase his sources of income and will enable him to pay school fees for his children and expand other projects on his farm. He faces the challenges of diseases and a lack of financing and markets for his products. In the future, he plans to expand his fish ponds so that he can be able to harvest fish in tonnes. He further comments that Juhudi is giving financial assistance to the farmers who have been neglected before and that Juhudi staff live up to their promises.

Samson is 61 years old. He is married with four children, ages 22, 19, 16 and 14. Two of the children attend school.

loans.use: To venture into fish farming and poultry farming

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 50-year-old humble and respectful man.  He does dairy farming to earn a living.  In addition, he runs a cafeteria.  He has been running the business for ten years with two employees.  He hopes that someday, he will improve his living standards. Joseph is a registered member of Faulu Kenya under Gathaithi Tuinuane group.  Since he joined the group, his financial status has improved.  He had previously serviced one loan and he has requested  another loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rahmonberdi

texts.en:
H. Rahmonberdi is a very loving father devoted to the needs of his children, whom he adores. Rahmonberdi works raising cattle and sheep and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals but in order to do this he would need to purchase a better breed of livestock and these animals are very costly. 

Rahmonberdi is requesting this loan  as he needs an additional operating capital of 6500 Somoni.  Rahmonberdi hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Scarlet Martha

texts.es:
Scarlet E. C. es madre soltera de dos niños y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
Ha trabajado 2 préstamos con la institución y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: PIEDRA, ARENA Y HIERRO PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN BAÑO PARA SU casa de habitación.
Scarlet dice que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Scarlet E. C. is a single mother of two school-aged children. She has taken out two loans through CEPRODEL which have been to make improvements to her house.

The loan requested is for the purchase of construction materials such as stone, sand and iron sheets to build a bathroom for her house. Scarlet says that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL, she has been able to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy stone, sand and iron sheets to build a bathroom for her house.

loans.name: Alain

texts.fr:
La vente des tissus  au marché est son commerce, il s’approvisionne dans les marchés de la place qui vendent des rouleaux de tissus en gros : le prêt passé a été bénéfique, il reçu beaucoup plus dans sa façon de gérer ses affaires.

Il avait renforcé son commerce avec le prêt passé, avec l’actuel  il veut  diversifier les types de tissus en misant plus sur  les tissus des uniformes scolaires.
Ses revenus ont connus aussi  une nette amélioration, de 50000f par jour, il est à 75000f  jour.
Pour ses enfants , il s’arrange avec son gagne pain de les nourrir, les vêtir et les soutenir dans leurs études.
texts.en:
His business is selling fabric at the market. He gets his supplies at the neighboring markets where they sell bolts of fabric wholesale. His previous loan was beneficial, he received much more with this new way of managing his activity.

He strengthened his business with his previous loan, with the current one he wants to diversify the kind of fabric he sells by betting on fabric for school uniforms.

His income has seen a clear improvement from 50,000 francs to 75,000 francs a day. He manages, with his livelihood, to feed, clothe, and provide for the schooling fees of his children.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of linen, virgin wool, quilted cotton and satin

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara tiene 43 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, juntos viven en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 12 años se dedica a la venta de verduras en un pequeño mercado de su localidad. Desde entonces, todas la mañanas hasta el medio día realiza sus ventas, pero su jornada de trabajo siempre comienza en las madrugadas, porque debe abastecerse diariamente de  verduras frescas, que le son traídas los mayorista que a esa hora están distribuyendo a los menorista. Este producto tiene fácil venta, ya que siempre el cliente requiere de las verduras para la preparación de sus alimentos, por ello éste negocio le es rentable, logrando así administrar los ingresos que utilizará para el sostenimiento de su familia, así como para invertir nuevamente en su trabajo. Por esta razón que continuará trabajando en su puesto de mercado con la mentalidad de crecer más. Es el crédito número 18 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar más verduras y tubérculos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Clara is 43 years old.  She shares her life with her husband and her four children.  They live together in their own home.  Clara has been selling vegetables in a small market in her town for more than 12 years.  She makes her sales every morning up until midday.  However, her day's work always begins early in the morning because she has to stock up with fresh vegetables early every day when the wholesalers are distributing to retailers.  Clara's products sell easily because customers always require vegetables to prepare their meals.  For this reason, her business is profitable.  She manages to make enough money to support her family and re-invest in her work.  For this reason, she will continue working on her market stall and hopes to expand her business even further.

This is Clara's 18th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to the people who will fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying more greens and root vegetables to stock her business.

loans.use: To buy more greens and root vegetables to stock her business

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
El Sr. Benigno P. de 45 años de edad, es soltero, no conoce aun la dicha de tener hijos.
   Don Benigno se dedica a la carpintería hace más de 28 años, aproximadamente desde el año 1.982; el comenzó de ayudante, luego fue ascendiendo por la experiencia que ya adquiría en ese momento, como también su ingreso, y ya le sobraba para poder ahorrar, y así lo hizo hasta que juntó capital como para comprar sus maquinarias y un poco de madera para comenzar a trabajar en forma independiente, después de tantos años de sacrificio, en la actualidad le provee en forma semanal a varios comerciales  de la zona. 
   El utilizaría este crédito en comprar más madera, para satisfacer a aquellos a quienes provee sus mercaderías.
 Desea un país con más oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Benigno P. is 45 years old.  He is single and still hasn't known the joy of having children.

Benigno has been working as a carpenter for 28 years, since approximately 1982.  He started out as an assistant then started to gain experience and more income.  Eventually he had enough income to make some savings and he saved until he had enough capital to buy some machinery and some wood so that he could start his own business.  After many years of hard work, he currently supplies several salespeople in the area with his products every week.

Benigno will use this loan to buy more wood so that he can satisfy those who he provides his products to.  Benigno would like a country with more work opportunities.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: 4- Tan Son 1 -  Nam Ngan Group

texts.en: Lien N. T. (14) is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Lien is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 4 - Tan Som 1 - Nam Ngan (02.10.1.4 Nam Ngan). Lien is married and has three adult -aged children. To make a living, Lien makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Lien has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.000.000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from these activities. In 2010, Lien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lien is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women of 5.787.900 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. T. T. Ha (15) is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 2. T. T. Sam (16) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her business of selling home products. 3. N. T. H. Ha (17) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her clothing business. 4. H. T. Huong (18) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her food stall. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Lien N. T. (14) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Lien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 4 Tan Son 1- Nam Ngan (02.10.1.4 Nam Ngan). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thực phẩm chiên trong cộng đồng địa phương. Lien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Lien kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2010, Lien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Lien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. T. T. Ha (15) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 2. T. T. Sam (16) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. 3. N. T. H. Ha (17) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 4. H. T. Huong (18) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a widow and has four children. She processes palm oil and palm kernel oil. Her customers are requesting palm kernel oil in larger quantities. Therefore, Esi wants to use the loan to expand her business. She uses the income from her sales to see to the well-being of her family.  She plans to educate her children with the additional income.

loans.use: To expand her palm kernel oil business

loans.name: Misael Alberto

texts.es:
Don Misael Alberto B. G., es trabajador de una Empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillados, desempeñando el cargo de Técnico Catastral, desde hace 5 años.

Es acompañado, de 29 años de edad, licenciado en administración de empresas, tiene dos personas que dependen de él una de ellas es menor de edad. Vive en la ciudad de Carazo en el Municipio de Diriamba.

Este es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL lo solicita para Mejorar su vivienda como es ponerle piso y construir un cuarto, que le permita vivir de forma placentera él y su familia.
texts.en:
Misael Alberto B. G. has worked for five years as property technician for an aqueduct and sewage company.

He is 29 years old, and he is in a relationship.  He has a degree in business administration.  He has two people who are dependent upon him, and one of them is a minor.

He lives in the city of Carazo in the Diriamba municipality.

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL.  He is requesting the loan to improve his house.  He will put down a floor and build a room.  This will allow him and his family to live in a pleasant way.

loans.use: To make improvements to his home, to lay down a floor and build a room

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian S. and his family own Wing Shack, a family restaurant providing chicken wings, burgers, salads and more.  Born and raised in El Paso, Texas, Adrian has worked in restaurants since he was 14 years old.  When he decided to start a business, it made sense he start in an industry he already knew.  Adrian and his brother manage Wing Shack, with Adrian running restaurant operations and his brother in charge of finances.

Adrian and his brother have had a hand in every aspect of Wing Shack from the beginning.  Wing Shack’s menu is their own creation with their own recipes.  They bought an existing building and renovated it to fit the restaurant’s needs.  They personally painted and remodeled the inside, and actually built the restaurant bar themselves.  

Adrian heard of ACCION Texas-Louisiana through the local Hispanic Chamber of Commerce, after his bank denied him a loan.  Adrian’s primary objective with this loan is to build credit.  This is the first loan Adrian has received for Wing Shack, having to this point relied on his own capital and loans from friends.  By building credit through this loan, Adrian will be able to qualify for greater financing in the future, if and when the need arises.  

Since Wing Shack opened in March, 2010, it has consistently had strong sales.  The problem is that expenses sometimes have the money going out as quickly as it comes in.  When bills come in at once, it temporarily puts stress on cash flow.  The additional cushion this loan provides will ensure they have enough money to meet monthly operating costs.

Adrian says, right now, his life is the business.  Down the road, Adrian would like to open a second Wing Shack in El Paso’s western half, and possibly someday make it a franchise.  Adrian warns other business owners not to cut corners, and to properly insure their business.  Recently, there was an ice storm in El Paso that forced Wing Shack to close for three days.  Thankfully, the losses Wing Shack incurred are covered in its insurance policy.

loans.use: Building credit and meeting general operational expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Paz Y Fe 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ana is one of the members of her group Paz y Fe 1, 3 & 4 (peace and faith.) Her story is representative of both the members of her group and Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients. 

Her group is based in the Samana peninsula in the east of the Dominican Republic, where running water and electricity are unavailable. Here she makes her home with her husband and three children in a simple structure comprised of wooden walls and a tin roof.

Ana originally came to Esperanza over six loans ago for the purpose of improving her business and she has proved herself very successful as an associate of Esperanza, repaying on time every time. She will use this new loan to invest in her coconut sales by buying some coconut trees (This is the best deal for the people selling coconuts. They buy the tree ready to harvest.) She plans to use the profits to purchase as many things as she can supply for her family and to continue to improve her home. Additionally, in the long term, she would like to save money for a vehicle to move her products and to continue to increase her savings. She would like to thank you all for your support.

There are two photos because we want to show as many faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy coconuts

loans.name: Ismatillokhuja

texts.en:
Ismatillokhuja is a 40-year-old man who lives in Isfara, Tajikistan with his wife and four children. He has worked in transportation since 2007. He provides transportation services in the area of Isfara and Kanibadam and also engages in cattle breeding. 

Ismatillokhuja acquires cattle in Kanibadam and sells them in Isfara. He would like to get a loan 5000 Somoni to purchase more cattle. Ismatillokhuja also hopes to provide happiness and good health to his wife and children.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Solidario Betzabe Group

texts.es:
Solidario Betzabe: este grupo esta formado por tres señoras las cuales son, Maria Guadalupe D. 19 años casada y tiene un hijo ella se dedica a su tienda desD. hace tres años ella venD. productos comestibles D. primera nececidad, ella noscuenta que nececita este credito para la compra D. mercaderia en productos comestibles D. primera nececidad  para su tienda ya que tiene mucha demanda D. sus clientes y nececita capital para trabajar y aumentar su ganancia.

Marta B., D. 24 años tiene un hijo y se dedica a la venta D. granizadas y frutas tambien venD. tamales en el merado D. su comunidad desD. hace 4 años,ella solicita el credito para la compra D. especies para elavorar tamales ya que por lo mismo nececita capital para trabajar ya que en los ultimos dias a tenido mucha demanda D. sus clientes.

Margarita C. S., D. 42 años ella tiene 6 hijos y es casada se dedica a la siembra D. tomate y chile pimiento junta mente con su esposo desD. hace mas D. 20 años nos cuenta que nececita mucho cuidado con la siembra y el abono ella ayuda a su esposo con la siembra y cuando hay cosecha ella venD. el tomate y el chle por cajas en el mercado nos cuenta que nececita este credito porque nececita comprar mas semillas para almacenar porque a veses se escasea y es cuando no pueden sembrar y tambien para comprar abono para abonar la siembra para que desarrolle bien.
texts.en:
Betzabe Solidarity Group

This group consists of the following three women:

Maria Guadalupe is 19 years old, married, and has one child.  For the past three years, she has been managing a store where she sells basic food products.  She says that she needs a loan to buy merchandise for her store because there is great demand from her customers.  Maria needs capital in order to work and increase her earnings.  

Marta B. is 24 years old and has one child.  She sells snow cones and fruits, but she also has been offering tamales at the market in her community for four years.  Marta is requesting a loan to buy spices for flavoring the tamales.  She is also in need of operating capital because she has recently experienced more demand from her customers.

Margarita C. S. is 42 years old, married, and has six children.  She and her husband have been growing tomatoes and chili peppers for more than 20 years.  Margarita says that these crops require a great amount of attention and compost.  She helps her husband with growing these crops.  Once the tomatoes and chili peppers are harvested, she sells them by the case at the market.  She says she needs this loan to buy more seeds to store for moments when seeds are scarce and she is not able to buy them.  Margarita will also buy compost to fertilize her crops so that they will develop well.

loans.use: To purchase food products and spices for tamales.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem belongs to Mian Channu which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a single room brick house with her family for the past 20 years.  She is 46 years old, married to B. and has a son and two daughters. Her son sells animals to butchers. Her daughters stay at home and help Naseem in her daily household work. 

Her husband operates an agriculture business. He has a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops. He is very active and works very hard to afford the living expenses of his family. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further improve her husband’s business by purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides etc. in larger quantity.  Her husband has been operating this business for the past six years and Naseem is very hopeful that an investment will improve the financial condition of his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosenda works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fishing.  Rosenda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy bamboo for her dried fish business.

Rosenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for her sun-dried fish business.

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en: Sareoun, age 41, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Sareoun is a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Sareoun has had this business. Sareoun is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase wood to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Topister

texts.en:
Topister is a resident of Kitale town in Western Kenya and has been in mixed farming for thee years, selling her produce to the local hotels. She is married with 3 children aged between 8 and 3 years. She gets additional income from lumbering and charcoal selling.

Topister has made a loan request amounting to 70,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry business by buying more birds and expanding their housing structure. She plans to venture into dairy farming in future.

Topister says airborne diseases are the greatest challenge in the poultry business.She is glad Juhudi Kilimo loans are improving small farmers businesses.

loans.use: to pay for more poultry birds

loans.name: Liwaa

texts.en:
Liwaa is a 37-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has worked at laying tile for 13 years. His business is going along fine and he deals with good contractors who appreciate his work.

He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy necessary tiles requested to do a new project he is going to start.

Liwaa hopes to stay healthy and keep on working in an exciting way.

loans.use: To buy necessary tiles requested.

loans.name: Anjilino

texts.en: Anjilino is 37 years old. She is a widow. She has 5 children, 3 of them are in school. To expand her business, she needs money.

loans.use: with her small business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a single woman with three children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 58 years old and married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Denia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Denia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and to pay for labor.

Denia has been in this business for 20 years. Denia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and to pay for labor

loans.name: Daylen

texts.en: Daylen is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has two children and has for the last five years made a living by running a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and breads. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Daylen is a new member of HSPFI and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 51 years old. For the past six years, this persevering lady has been working very hard raising and selling cattle. She uses the income she generates to provide a better quality of life for her husband.

Kamala has requested a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy more young cattle that she will sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, she will be able to increase her earnings substantially and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena, a 68-year-old widowed mother with a 25-year-old son, has been a farmer for the past 20 years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family. Having repaid her previous loan, Philomena is requesting her second loan with KADET LTD to buy fertilizer and seedlings. Her hopes and dreams are to buy land for farming and educate her son up to university level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin  is a hardworking person and he makes an effort to give his family the best. He is married and a dedicated father of three children. Despite the fact that Elvin is only 25, Elvin is the sole breadwinner for his family, and his only income comes from raising and selling sheep and large livestock at the local market. Every six months he buys young heifers and sheep from farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his sons and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. 

Elvin is thinking about expanding his business because the income from his present herd is not sufficient to provide for his family. He plans to purchase more young cattle. To do so, he needs to invest an additional 800 AZN in his business.

loans.use: to purchase two baby calves.

loans.name: Salon

texts.en:
Salon is 29 years old and is a masseuse. She earns $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $5 per day. They have three children, two are studying and one is too young for school. 

Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $3 on electricity, $7 on school fee, $15 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike to travel to work. Her husband wants to extend his career and will buy more construction material when they have enough money. She wants to support her children to study so they can at least finish high school.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to travel to work

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is a 52-year-old married woman with a son. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Van and her husband earn an income to support their family by running a food stall in front of their house. They have been running their business for the past 15 years.

Van would like to receive a loan to purchase furniture, bowls, plates and chopsticks, as well as more food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and set aside some savings for family emergencies.

loans.use: buy furniture, bowls, plates, chopsticks, and food

loans.name: Association "dental 4" Group

texts.fr: Les quatres femmes membres de l'association "Dental 4" s'activent toutes dans le commerce de produits de parfumerie.Elles achètent en gros des parfums , de l'encens et des produits divers qu'elles revendent en détail sur des tables installées au  marché situé non loin de leurs domiciles.Ce commerce leur rapporte des revenus qui sont utilisés dans la prise en charge de leurs besoins personnels et ceux d'entretien de leurs familles respectives.Le chef du groupe (main lévée) est mariée et mère de quatres enfants.Elle aide son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'alimentation et des frais de scolarité de leurs enfants. Le groupe sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des parfums, de l'encens et des produits divers.Elles ambitionnent d'élargir leurs activités en implantant des cantines au marché central de leur localité.
texts.en:
The four women of Association "Dental 4" all sell perfumery products. They buy perfumes, incense, and various other products wholesale, and retail them on stalls at a market not far from their homes.

The income they make from their businesses is used to provide for themselves and their respective families.

The group's leader (raising her hand in the photograph) is married and the mother of four children. She helps her husband pay their children's school expenses.

The groups is seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 to buy perfumes, incense, and various other products. They ambition to expand their businesses by setting up "cantines" (small shops) at the central market in their village.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense, and various other products

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a hardworking business man aged 28. He is married and blessed with one child who is in school. He has been supplying eggs to support his family. He also sells grocery to increase his income. In the next five years, he wants to succeed in his business. 

Since David joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy more trays of eggs, fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To buy trays of eggs, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Yim, 53, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Yim and her husband rent microphones and speakers for any ceremony in her village. Yim is requesting a loan of $800 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren, 27, resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Ren is a teacher. Ren is requesting a loan of USD 350 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, his family will be able to reduce the money they spend on public transportation. 

In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to school.

loans.name: Genny

texts.en:
Genny is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Genny is buying and peddling clothing like towels, shirts and blouses. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Genny has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genny hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict, aged 29 years-old is an unmarried man who sells milk by use of a bicycle. He has been doing that for five years.The business earns him a monthly income of Kshs.14,000.

This is his second loan with Kiva partner KADET Ltd. and he has successfully repaid the previous loan.  He will use the funds in order to buy milk and a new bicycle for his milk supply business  .Benedict hopes to buy a pickup for supplying milk in the future.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna lives with her husband and two children. She trades in meat from a rented booth in the city market. To meet her clients' demands for different kinds of meat during the New Year's season, Susanna plans to increase her variety of products. Increasing the sales will help Susanna to make savings and invest in the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: Rosa Isabel de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en la zona costera del país; ella se dedica al cultivo de  maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas; el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su residencia, comercia en todos los alrededores y ya tiene clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque posee producto de calidad y aprecios accesibles además el servicio es excelente adicional a esto ella vende ropa de forma ambulante para complementar las ganancias para su hogar; Rosa Isabel es una mujer dedicada a su labor, visionaria y con muchos sueños por alcanzar, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que se le presenten para llegar al éxito, uno de sus más grandes sueños  es hacer crecer el negocio quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital para invertir en suficientes insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizantes herramienta, etc. Rosa Isabel tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura poder pagar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una vida mejor.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, fertilizantes herramienta

loans.name: Hema

texts.en:
Hema is a mother with one daughter. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She is living with her husband. Her husband is always ill and but sometimes he helps Hema in her business. Her daughter got admission in school. She joined a group this year to get training from People's Forum and to get a loan also. Hema operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. With her loan of 35,000 INR, she wants to purchase vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for her business. She faces the challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing and expanding a vegetable vending business in the future.

Hema is thankful to kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: ANA LUISA: Es una señora luchadora de 37 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos en edad escolar. Desde hace 10 años habita en una vivienda de tambo y madera, la cual necesita reparación. Solicita financiamiento para cambiar la madera de su vivienda, ya que con su salario como docente de educación primaria, no le alcanza para asumir los costos de la mejora de su vivienda.
