Con el préstamo comprara: madera, clavos, zinc y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento), para brindarle mayor seguridad y calidad de vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: para cambiar la madera de su vivienda

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.en:
Reyna is 47 years old, she is an intelligent, capable and so creative person, she always says that has an excellent ability as a sales person. She wanted to built her own house because loves so much to her family, for that reason, she always thinks about the future. Her husband is a mechanic since 10 years ago, with the lowest salary, Reyna knows that is so difficult to cover all the family expenses, so, she started a business. In 1997 in her house, she sold handmade products like dolls and adornments. To day, she wants to built her business in her house’s porch. She hopes to have her business bigger than before and increase the sales, she wants to surpass like woman, loves the life and wants the better for her family.

Reyna is requesting a loan of $475 DLLS to purchases of materials and increase the production, she is waiting for an excellent sales this season. She hopes your help to improve her business and supports her family.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Reyna tiene 47 años, se considera una persona con mucha creatividad, emprendedora y muy buena para las ventas, reside en Tampico Tamaulipas. Casada con un mecánico con 10 años de experiencia, Reyna quiere construir una casa para su familia debido a que su esposo no gana lo suficiente para los gastos esenciales del hogar, por lo que se vio motivada ayudar a su esposo y sacar adelante a su familia. En Julio de 1997 comenzó su negocio en la elaboración de manualidades y muñecos de peluche, los cuales son de gran valor artesanal y de mano de obra.

Reyna requiere de $475 DLLS para comprar la materia prima de su negocio y poder seguir produciendo sus manualidades y monos de peluche que son muy demandados por muchas personas, además dice que la demanda esta aumentando debido a estas fechas navideñas y por lo que necesita el dinero para aumentar su capacidad de producción y ventas.

loans.use: Purchases of materials

loans.name: Mere

texts.en: Mrs. Mere V. talent is, ELEI.  She’s thirty-one years of age and married to Mr. V. from the village of Levi.  Mere elei's more than ten materials a day.  She elei's, print names design pictures on ielavalava and shirts.  During my project check Mere is very happy at what she’s doing.  She’s thankful to God for the gift that he gave to her to help fulfill the needs of her family.  Her business project has improved in many ways, x-rays papers provide by her friends, toothbrush, sponge,  paints and most of all her family support.  Mere believes that her business is doing fine because of the growth of the number of her customers.  She sells some of her stuff at her home, she also delivers some to the shops around the island.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, paints, stencils and other materials for the business

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
J. Saleh Pirverdi Ogli lives in Imishli region, Yalavaj village. He is the father of 3 children. He is the only breadwinner in his family.

His financial situation caused him to start his trading business in 2004. For the present time, Saleh runs his own shop. According to him, he enjoys his business and is always glad to serve clients. However, recently he has faced some hardships in his trading business. He needs 1200 USD that will be used to as follows: $350 he will use to pay the rent , $300 to buy shop windows and $550 to buy a new consignment of goods.

loans.use: Pay rent, buy windows and inventory

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina is 38 years old and is married to Andrés who is 44 years old. They have 2 children, a girl of 12 and a boy of 7 who both study in the national school of the area. Her husband sells wallets, handbags and belts and they all live together in their own house. She has a business selling underwear, socks and other similar items. She has been doing this in the central market of their city for 10 years. Her main clients are tourists from the border city of Posadas in Argentina as these products are cheap for them. As there is a lot of competition in this area and it is hard to raise ones prices to earn more, she would like to buy the cheapest products and for this is would like a loan to buy underwear in bulk so that she can obtain important discounts which will give her higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Evangelina es una señora D. 38 años está casada con el Sr. Andrés D. 44 años, tienen dos hijos, una nena D. 12 y un varón D. 7 años, quienes estudian en un colegio nacional D. la zona, su marido se dedica a la venta ambulante D. carteras, billeteras y cintos, ellos viven todos juntos en una casa propia. Ella posee un negocio D. ventas D. ropas interiores, remeras, calzas, buzos y otros artículos similares, con más D. 10 años D. antigüedad en el mercado municipal del a ciudad. Sus principales clientes son turistas D. la ciudad fronteriza D. Posadas (Argentina), para quienes los productos ofertados poseen precios muy atractivos. Considerando, que la competencia en la zona es bastante intensa y dificulta subir los precios para aumentar las ganancias, ella debe comprar sus productos al menor precio D. plaza; para ello solicita un crédito que lo invertirá a la compra al por mayor D. ropa interior, medias, calzas, remeras, buzos, camperas; con esto ella obtendrá descuentos importantes que le darán mayor margen D. ganancias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: underwear etc/ Compra de mercaderías: ropa interior, medias, calzas y remeras.

loans.name: Sonia Zauria

texts.pt:
Sonia is married and mother of 3 children. Her oldest child is 5 years old, the middle one 3, and the youngest is 1 year old. Sonia’s husband is a miner, and works in a neighboring country.

She is requesting a loan for the first time. She wants to invest this money on buying chicken feed and more chickens. Sonia also wants to increase the space of the chicken coop, buy medicines and water bowls for the chickens. Sonia’s husband is usually away working in 12 month contracts, so Sonia takes care of the home and the children. Sonia relies on her chicken business for everyday expenses and savings for the periods her husband is away.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia e casada e mae de 3 filhos. Todos ainda sao menores o mais velho tem 5 anos o do meio 3 anose o mais pequeno tem 1 ano. O marido trabalha num pais vizinho porque e mineiro.Esta a tomar emprestimo pela primeira vez. Ela quer aplicar este dinheiro na compra de racao para os frangos enquanto nao sao compradose adquirir mais pintos. Quer aumentar tambem o espaco onde ela cria os pintos enquanto pequenos, e comprar bebedouros, comedouros e mais vacinas. Porque o marido trabalha fora do pais ele tem estado foraa por 12 meses pois que o contrato dele e anual. Assim ela e que cuida da casa e dos filhos. por isso ela deve ter o seu proprio negocio para as despesas urgentes e inadiaveis enquanto o marido nao regressa.

loans.use: Sonia is requesting a loan in order to buy more chickens, chicken feed, expand her chicken coop, and to purchase vaccines for her business.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith I. lives in Benin City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five children. She sells fresh tomatoes, which she buys in the northern part of Nigeria to sell in Benin City. She started her business in 1991 after learning the business from her mother; she has been with LAPO for two years. She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her buy more fresh tomatoes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more fresh tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu K. is 27 years old and runs her business in the outskirts of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone. She has a small kiosk selling general items in her home.  She does this to supplement her husband’s meager income.  Isatu’s husband works as a driver but his income is insufficient to meet family expenses.  She sells onions, cigarettes, and other items to earn income for her two children’s school requirements.  As she will complete her current loan repayments in December, Isatu is requesting another loan so as to increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her stock so that she can expand her turnover this year

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Reth S. is a 34 years old, married, and has two children. She works by selling various grocery products to her community, and makes on average a total of $10 or $12 a day. Her husband is a blacksmith who makes about $10 a day in revenue. She has two children, one who is a student and another one who is currently too young to attend school. She would like a loan of $1000 to purchase more blacksmithing tools and resources for her husband’s business, and better support her family.

loans.use: Purchasing blacksmith tools and materials

loans.name: Leo Group

texts.es:
Leo: This word can be interpreted in many different ways, such as lions – or in this case, lionesses. It can also be thought of as a sign of the zodiac, the strongest sign, as well as in many other ways. But according to these businesswomen, these two concepts showcase each of their personalities. Sixteen women make of this group, and for more than six years, they have been each other’s constant and most important companions.

Most of the members devote themselves to preparing fast food, while others prepare more sophisticated dishes in the national tastes, while still others dedicate themselves to making lunches in hotels and restaurants in the area.

Their main concern is the demand that will exist during the folkloric events that will go on during the parties of Carnaval, given that the attendance at these events is massive and they generally consume throughout the entire event. For this reason, they need cash to be able to purchase the needed ingredients for the preparation of their dishes; this way, they can compete in variety and quality with the many other food vendors that will be at these events.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Leo; esta palabra puede ser interpretada bajo muchos conceptos, como leones, o en este caso leonas, también es conocido como un signo zodiacal, el mas fuerte del zodiaco, y muchos otros significados mas, pero según las socias, estos dos conceptos encajan en la personalidad de cada una de ellas. 16 mujeres integran esta sociedad, desde hace mas de 6 años, siendo una de las asociaciones destacadas y constantes.

En su mayoría sus integrantes están dedicadas a la preparación y venta de comida en distintas modalidades, algunas se dedican a la preparación de comida rápida, otras a la preparación de platos mas sofisticados de la gastronomía nacional, y otros se dedican a la atención de almuerzos en pensiones y restaurantes de la zona.

Su principal preocupación es la demanda que existirá en aquellas entradas folklóricas a realizarse en las fiestas de carnaval, puesto que la afluencia de gente a estos eventos es masivo y generalmente son consumidores potenciales por la duración misma de los eventos. Por tal motivo ellas precisan de capital para poder realizar la compra de sus insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus puestos, de esta manera poder competir con variedad y calidad ante los muchos otros negocios de comida que existirán para esas fechas.

loans.use: Purchase of needed ingredients to compete for food sales at upcoming holiday events

loans.name: Belen Cerro De Oro (Group 2)

texts.en:
The road into Cerro de Oro cuts through lush forests, passing by men with machetes chopping away, others carrying their day’s gatherings on their backs to be sold as firewood in town. Along the forests are thousands of rocks, several serving as billboards for political slogans, too many others as memorials. The road opens up to an emerging little town, with a school on the right, and an avocado tree on the left. Underneath the avocado tree sit 28 women, vying for the relief its branches offer from the unforgiving sun. They have gathered here once a month for the past seven years. The women of the Belen communal bank have overcome insurmountable odds, one loan at a time.

The women of Belen come from a region rich in weaving, and many grew up learning the intricate art from their parents. From the time they were young, they were working for meager wages in weaving factories, earning barely enough to survive, with no way to get ahead. After joining Friendship Bridge, they were given the initial push they needed to escape their poverty. Today, seven years later, every single woman has her own weaving business, earning a fair income that supports their families and even enough to send all their children to school. They wear this success with a humble pride, supporting each other in their victories and obstacles.

Ten of the 28 women are asking for a loan of 28,000 quetzales ($3,675), ranging from $300 to $400 per person. Nine of the women will invest this money in their weaving businesses, purchasing thread to weave intricate huipiles (traditional blouses like the ones in the picture), skirts, scarves, and blankets. A single huipil can take up to a month to make, and after an initial investment of about 200 quetzales ($25), it can be sold for around 500 quetzales ($65). All the supplies are purchased in the nearby town of Santiago de Atitlán. A few of the women also employ as many as five other women, and part of the loan will go towards paying their salaries. Having the extra help greatly increases production (which is essential when a single product takes a month to make), and therefore adds significantly to the potential income. One woman also runs a small store, selling snacks, soft drinks and daily necessities such as soap and toilet paper. She plans to restock her store and add new varieties of snacks to keep her customers interested.

The women of Belen have come very far over the past seven years and they don’t plan on stopping. They want to expand their businesses; the ones who currently work alone would like to someday hire help. They would also like to expand to other nearby markets, bringing in new customers. Everything they do is for the future of their children, and their dreams revolve around educating their children, with the hope that they can learn to read and write, and someday become professionals, free of the hardships of their parents.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving and inventory for store

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is thirty six years old and has one child, who is currently in school. She has been selling home products--like tomatoes, vegetable oils, eggs, garden eggs, tin fish, pastas, spices, okra, and onions--in a very busy market in Obuasi. She has very good customer care and therefore many customers buy her products. She thanks Sinapi for training her.

Vida wants to use this loan to buy more products and a greater variety because customers are always demanding them.

She is a member of the group called David. The group exerts peer pressure on members to re-pay the loan.

Vida is pictured above busy in the market.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of products like tin fish, pastas, and spices

loans.name: Tita Regina

texts.en:
Born in 1966, Regina A. is an unemployed widow with six children. Although she attributes her unemployment to her lack of education, she is appreciative of the fact that she is alive. Her desire is to give her children love and education. She states that she feels better each time she provides something small for her kids. Her inability to get investment capital to generate income motivated her to seek a loan from GHAPE. Using her previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community a source of food, meat, and manure.

Given a loan, she plans to buy piglets, pig feed, and seedlings and to pay for labor to clear farm land and help with hoeing. This investment will increase food supply in the community and provide income to her family. She is planning to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school and to meet the basic needs of her family.

She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment is due on the fourth month from the date of loan disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets, feed, and seedlings; labor for clearing land

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida is a hardworking mother who saw the need to open up a small, basic foodstuff general store for the benefit of both her beloved family and the community. She has been in business for almost 5 years now, and would like to improve her business space even more since her good service and her care for the needs of her friends have contributed to her popularity.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Zenaida, es una trabajadora madre que ha visto en la instalación de una pequeña bodeguita de abastecimiento de productos de primera necesidad en beneficio de su amada familia y de su comunidad.Ya ha cumplido cerca de cinco años de trabajo y desea mejorar aún más su espacio de ventas ya que la buena atención y preocupación que demuestra por las necesidades de sus amigos han contribuido ha mantener su preferencia.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand business space

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario is a member of the Maria Gracia community bank; she lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Moyobamba.  Her business is located on 430 Jr. Iquitos.  She has a general store.  Thanks to the support from her husband, children and her own efforts, the business has grown significantly, considering that she started selling items on a small table and now she has display counters and shelves.

The $600 USD (S/.1,700) loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, will be used to purchase different types and brands of packaged pasta, boxes of preserved food, sacks of rice and sugar, oil in liter bottles, cases of eggs, boxes of milk, cleaning and personal hygiene products; all highly demanded by her clients.

She is 45 years old, lives with her husband and one of her children, who is the reason for the effort and constant dedication put into her daily activities. She considers herself independent to make decisions and manage the business. Her charisma attracts clients that receive good service and a well supplied store.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosario es socia del Banco Comunal “MARIA GRACIA “ vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Moyobamba, distrito de Moyobamba, su negocio esta ubicado en el jr. Iquitos 430 se dedica a la venta de abarrotas en general . Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos ya su propio esfuerzo, ha logrado que el negocio crezca considerablemente, ya que cuando se inicio comenzó vendiendo sobre una pequeña mesa y actualmente su negocio es muy variado y, lo exhibe en sus vitrinas y andamios.

El préstamo recibido de S/. 1,700.00 que será devuelto en 6 meses, con dicho capital compró fideos de distintas variedades y marcas en paquetes, conservas en cajas, arroz y azúcar en sacos, aceite en botellas de litro, huevos en javas, Leche en cajas , productos de Limpieza y aseo personal y detergentes debido a que estos artículos son muy requeridos por sus clientes .

Tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y 1 de sus hijos, motivo de su lucha y dedicación constante a sus actividades diarias de su negocio. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio. Por su carisma atrae a sus clientes además de atenderlas con amabilidad y tener un negocio surtido.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale products.

loans.name: Mkomboli Group

texts.en:
Salome has owned a beauty salon in Arusha since 1994. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children, ages 18 and 10. Working from 8:00am to 10:00pm daily, Salome is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $150.

Salome is hoping to take out a loan to purchase a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She will be sharing the loan with her four other group members who each own shops in Arusha, as well.

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer for her salon.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is a member of “Banco Comunal Kusikuy”. “Kusikuy” means “be happy” in Quechua. Norma is married, she is 32 years old and has 2 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Cuchipampa located at the foot of the Picota hill. Norma travels to the regional markets to buy animals and cereals; the animals are slaughtered and sold from door to door while the cereals are sold to merchants at the markets of the town of Ayacucho.

Norma needs a loan of 1050 soles ($375) to be invested in the purchase of goats and cereals. It is Norma’s dream to improve her house using better building materials and that her children get more ahead in life than she did.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua. Norma es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, vive en el barrio de Cuchipampa que se encuentra en las faldas del cerro la Picota. Norma viaja a las ferias de la región donde compra animales y cereales; los animales los beneficia para luego vender de casa en casa, mientras que los cereales los vende a los comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Norma necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado caprino y cereales. Los sueños de Norma son mejorar su casa, construir a material noble, y que sus hijos sean mejores que ella.

loans.use: Purchase of goats and cereals to increase sales.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia inició el negocio por deseos de salir adelante, de ser una mujer independiente y poder tomar sus propias decisiones y porque le gustan mucho las ventas, además de que puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó en el mes de Marzo de 2004, platico con su esposo acerca de la necesidad de otro ingreso y de lo mucho que le gustaban las ventas y fue cuando el le sugirió que vendiera las verduras y las salsas para mariscos, ya que de esta manera se complementaría con la actividad de él que es la compra-venta de pescados y mariscos, y ella ofrecería las verduras y las salsas para prepararlas y desde entonces se dedico a esta actividad. Con su anterior crédito KIVA pudo surtir mejor su negocio y aunque este año ha sido un poco difícil por las intensas lluvias que han azotado la región he podido mantenerse y salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas productos a precio de mayoreo y tener un mayor surtido para mis clientes que acuden a comprar ingredientes para preparar sus mariscos
texts.en:
Virginia started the business because of her desire to get ahead, to be an independent woman, to be able to make her own decisions and because she likes sales a lot. Besides that, she can help her husband with the household expenses. She began in March of 2004. She spoke with her husband about the need for an additional income and how much she liked sales and that's when he suggested that she sell vegetables and sauces for seafood because that way it would compliment his business which is purchasing and selling fish and seafood. She started offering the vegetables and sauces and ever since she has dedicated her time to this activity.

With her previous Kiva loan she was able to offer more products and, even though this year has been a little difficult due to the intense rains that they have experienced in the region, she has been able to maintain the business and get ahead.

She needs a loan for US$750, which she will repay in six months, to purchase more products at wholesale prices and have a better offering for her clients that go to her to buy the ingredients needed to prepare their seafood.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products at wholesale prices

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora Emperatriz O. S. tiene 25 años pertenece al Banco Comunal  Mujeres al Progreso y vive en la Mz 2 lote sin número del sector de Víctor Raúl distrito del Porvenir provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió la primaria completa pero no continuó estudiando debido a la falta de medios económicos.
Se casó con Luis Ramos Salazar, con quien tiene 2 hijos pequeños.
Siempre trabajó en calzado, recuerda que primero alistaba calzado, eso quiere decir que pegaba plantillas, etiquetas, limpiaba el pegamento y colocaba los pares en las cajas. Ahora tiene una sociedad con su hermana, donde ella confecciona el calzado y lo entrega listo para ser etiquetado.
Su negocio se ubica en Víctor Raúl pero en la Avenida Jorge Basadre Mz 11 lote 14.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles cancelados en 4 cuotas, compró neolid, tacos, cuero y badana.
Con este crédito de 700 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará ormas para armar zapato y pegamento.
Emperatriz sueña con tener un gran taller donde pueda dar empleo a más personas.
texts.en:
Emperatriz O. S. is 25 years old and belong to the "Mujeres al Progreso" communal bank. She lives in the Víctor Raúl section of the Porvenir district, in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru. She completed her primary school studies but could not continue due to lack of financial resources. She is married to Luis Ramos Salazar and they have 2 small children. She has always work as a cobbler and remembers that her first job was to prepare the shoe, meaning that she attached the insoles and labels, cleaned them of any glue and packed them in their boxes. Now she has a partnership with her sister where she makes the shoe and delivers it ready to be labeled. Her business is located in Víctor Raúl on Jorge Basadre Avenue. With her first loan for 300 soles, which was repaid in 4 installments, she bought heels, leather and other materials. With this loan for 700 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy materials for putting together the shoes and glue. Emperatriz dreams of having a bigger workshop where she can hire more people.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fuel

loans.name: Zarifjon

texts.en:
Zarifjon is 38 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children. Recently he has gotten involved in agriculture, as his parents were farmers in their area and now he wishes to follow in their footsteps. For this reason he is giving his all to his land, where he is busy all day long. The harvest is what gives him the most pleasure from his work, since he can pick the products that cost him so much work in cultivating and caring. Nevertheless, the most difficult thing is acquiring the fertilizers necessary for his plots, since they are very expensive and raise the level of investment required in production. Zarifjon draws strength from his 2 children, whom he supports so that they may become professionals. He wishes to invest in the various fertilizers he needs for his crops, so that he can increase his production and his profits.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Derling Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Darling Mercedes G. se dedica a su negocio de venta de agua y gaseosas en la ciudad de León específicamente en el mercado La Terminal donde ha laborado desde hace cuatro años.

La razón por la cual la señora Darling ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de las gaseosas, los jugos y el agua y por este motivo ella espera en Ceprodel para continuar con su actividad y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Darling Mercedes Garcia has a business selling water and soda in the city of Leon, specifically in the “La Terminal” market where she has worked the last four years. The reason that Darling has gone to Ceprodel is to get a loan that will allow her to buy soda, juice, and water and she hopes that through Ceprodel she can continue this activity and succeed in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soda and water

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene A. sells gift items and drinks. She travels to Lagos and Onitsha to purchase her goods to sell in Benin City. She is 43 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband sells building materials. She needs the loan to purchase more gift items and drinks to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gift items and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị Huế  năm nay 31  tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 người con  trong đó có 1 con đang tuổi đến trường.  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ đầu năm 2008. Hiện tại chị buôn bán thịt lợn ở chợ còn chồng chị làm thợ cơ khí với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ  một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua thêm nguyên liệu ( sắt) phục vụ cho công việc hàn xì của chồng, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để đầu tư thêm vốn cho công việc buôn bán thịt lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Huế, 31 years old, has two children, one of whom is old enough to go to school. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2008. Currently, she earns money selling pork at the market and her husband works as a mechanic, with a total income of 4,000,000 VND (233 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD). She will use part of the loan to buy materials (iron) for her husband’s welding work, and the remainder she will invest in her pork-selling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Welding supplies, pork selling

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru: Муяссар 26 лет, она замужем, имеет 2 детей. Работает в местном колхозе. Муж подрабатывает на разных работах. В дополнение к своей заработной плате Муяссар содержит дома домашний скот. В этом ей помогает ее свекровь (на фото). Каждую весну она получает от своих коров приплод, который и является ее доходом от животноводства. Чтобы увеличить количество скота она решила обратиться в Микроинвест. На полученный займ собирается купить корову.
texts.en:
Muyassar is 26, married, and has two children. She works at the local collective farm. Her husband takes on odd jobs to supplement the family income. Muyassar supplements her income by raising domestic cattle at home. Her mother-in-law (in the photo) helps her out. Every spring, she gets cows and makes money from raising their offspring. To increase the number of cattle, she decided to get a loan from Microinvest to buy a cow.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Mrs. Lucille C. is 26 years old and married. Her husband is a fisherman. They are blessed with two children and live in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

She became a member of PDP-LP's microfinance program in 2007 and she already borrowed and repaid three regular loans for her projects. Her loans were used to supply their fishing business. Their project is doing well and continues to progress and it's a big help to them with their day-to-day needs.

She hopes that through the help of Paglaum and Kiva, all of their children can finish their studies. They hope to live a comfortable life with the savings from their business.

loans.use: To purchase new fishing net and repair their fishing boat

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica es esposa y madre, tiene dos hijos quienes son la prioridad en su vida y trata de  satisfacer sus necesidades, junto a su esposo, esperan tener pronto una casa propia donde vivir,  ya que por el momento se encuentra en la casa de sus padres. En el tiempo que lleva viviendo con su pareja ha tratado de apoyarlo para aminorar el gasto de mantener el hogar, hace 3 años viene trabajando como promotora de belleza de diversas líneas cosméticas que le brindan las herramientas necesarias para su trabajo, pues mensualmente tiene que buscar clientas quienes realicen sus pedidos en base a catálogos. Su trabajo es muy cansado, pues tiene que caminar largas horas por las calles con el fin de incrementar sus pedidos y obtener un buen porcentaje por la compra de cada producto. Por ello, trata de aprovechar las ofertas, para adquirir los productos en grandes cantidades y venderlos luego a sus clientes a precio normal, aumentando así sus ganancias de manera rápida. Jessica ha llegado a amar su trabajo y desea involucrarse aun más, hasta llegar a ser una empresaria de líneas de cosméticos. También es socia fundadora de su grupo que conformó en MFP, este es su octavo crédito, y todos estos años se ha dado cuenta que el trabajo que realizan la llevo a madurar y asumir retos en los negocios. Los 2500 soles solicitados los usará para adquirir grandes cantidades de productos, pues las ofertas por el día de la madre han aminorado los precios de los productos.
texts.en:
Jessica is a wife and mother. She has two children who are her priority in life and she tries to satisfy their needs. She and her husband hope to have their own house to live in soon. Right now they live in her parents' house. In the time she has lived with her husband, she has tried to support him with their home's expenses. She has worked for three years selling cosmetics. Every month she has to look for customers who will order from her catalogs. Her job is tiring. She has to walk for long hours on the streets with the goal of increasing her orders and obtaining a good percentage of the purchase of each product. Because of this, she tries to make the most of sales and acquire products in large quantities and sell them to her customers at the normal price so she can increase her profits quickly. Jessica has come to love her job and hopes to get involved in it even more, until she can hire other people to sell one of the lines of cosmetics. She is also the social chair of her group that works with Microfinanzas Prisma. This is her eighth credit, and in all of these years, she has noticed that the work they do has made her mature and take on challenges in her business. The 2,500 PEN that she is requesting will be used to acquire large quantities of products since the Mother's Day sales have lowered their prices.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Happyness

texts.en:
Happyness has owned a small cafe in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 6 years. She belongs to the Jipe moyo loan group (group code 2088). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $175. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Happyness is 33 years old, divorced, and has two children, ages 11 and 8.

loans.use: To buy more food for her cafe

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Mrs. Irene A. is separated and lives at Casusan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She and her husband separated because they were incompatible. She has no children.

Irene has had to strive hard on her own; that’s why she ventured into selling dried fish and vegetables. She received additional working capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in July 2008. Today, she is applying for php 14,900 to buy additional dried fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: Buy additional dried fish and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Blaise

texts.fr:
Z. Blaise est né le 29 Avril 1981 à Porto Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Blaise est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants tous scolarisés. Blaise réside avec sa famille dans Commune de Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. 

Blaise a comme activité principale la coiffure.  Afin de se faire plus de revenus Blaise a comme activité secondaire la vente de produits lubrifiants. Pour acheter le matériel nécessaire dans son salon de coiffure Blaise a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’il n’en possède. C’est la raison pour laquelle Blaise se tourne vers ALIDé pour avoir de prêt afin d’équiper son salon de coiffure en vue d'une meilleure prestation pour sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Z. Blaise was born on April 29, 1981 in Porto Novo, administrative and political capital of Benin. Blaise is married and the father of 2 children, both enrolled in school. He lives with his family in the Township of Akpro Missérété in the Department of the Ouémé.

Blaise's main work is hairdressing. So as to make more income, Blaise also sells lubricants. In order to buy the necessary equipment for his salon, Blaise needs financial means that he does not possess. This is the reason why Blaise has come to ALIDé to take out a loan to equip his hairdressing salon so he can better serve his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of equipment and hairdressing products

loans.name: Abdukhalil

texts.en: T. Abdukhalil is 50 years old and lives in Shahristan, Tajikistan, with his wife who helps him with household expenses. They have three children: two help with the agricultural work, and one is studying. For his family’s sake he hopes to make improvements to his house that is too old. For the past five years, Abdukhalil has worked as a farmer; he began working as a farmer with the support of his parents. The biggest difficulty that he faces is a lack of financing and the pests that affect his crop. His future plan for his crops is to be able to make irrigation channels. With the loan Abdukhalil will purchase fertilizers and supplies to apply to his crop to be able to harvest a good crop to sell for better prices in the market. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Michel Joaquin

texts.es: El señor Michel E. de 24 años de edad, soltero, habitante de la comarca  Monte Fresco, Municipio de Villa del Carmen del departamento de Managua, le ayuda a su madre en los gastos de su casa. Como planes que tiene es mejorar su vivienda para ofrecerle una mayor comodidad a su madre. Se desempeña como auxiliar de bodega en la alcaldía de Villa del Carmen desde hace seis meses anteriormente trabajaba en Managua como obrero de construcción, lo que significa que tiene suficiente conocimiento en lo que es construcción. Gracias a Afodenic lograra comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque y zinc para construir una pared y poder estar terne una casa segura y digna.
texts.en:
Sr. Michel E. is 24 years old and single. He lives in the region of Monte Fresco in the city of Villa del Carmen, district of Managua. He helps his mother with the household expenses. He plans to make improvements to his house so that his mother can live more comfortably. Previously, he worked as an assistant at a grocery store in Villa del Carmen. He now works as a construction worker in Managua, which he has been doing for 6 months. His current job has given him enough knowledge to do his own home projects.

Thanks to AFODENIC, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, blocks, and zinc to build a wall that will give him a secure and decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a security wall

loans.name: Las Rositas Group

texts.es: El grupo “las Rositas” esta representada por la señora Maria Lourdes y conformada para 13 socios D. los cuales 4 son varones. Los miembros del grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades como ser la ventad D. empanadas, abarrotes, lácteos, fiambres, comida y entre los varones se dedican a actividades como al servicio D. transporte público y a la carpintería. En cuanto a la competencia los socios se organizan D. modo que no les afecta ya que van acorD. a las necesidades y exigencias del mercado. El crédito otorgado tiene como destino aumentar el capital D. trabajo para el crecimiento D. sus negocios, teniendo en lo futuro mayores ventas e ingresos para ellos. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia el grupo va cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando ganas D. trabajar y puntualidad en los pagos, por lo cual requieren nuevamente del apoyo económico brindado para mejorar aun mas sus ventas y por enD. mejorar los ingresos que son el sustento D. sus familias y sus ganas D. luchar día a día en el mercado competitivo.
texts.en:
The group “Las Rositas” is led by Sra. Maria Lourdes and is comprised of 13 members (9 women and 4 men). Most of the members are engaged in different retail businesses selling empanadas, groceries, dairy products, cold cuts, and prepared foods. The men are involved in business activities such as public transportation and carpentry. The members are not concerned about the competition because they go about focusing on meeting the needs and demands of their customers.

Their loans will increase their operating capital so that they can grow their businesses, increase their future sales, and earn better incomes. The group started its second loan cycle and the members fulfilled the necessary requirements to receive additional financial support by demonstrating their ability to work and make their payments on schedule. With their increased earnings, they will be able to maintain their households and keep fighting every day in the competitive marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Mrs. Jona M. is 38 years old, married, and has seven children ages 3 to 17. She is a resident of Hacienda Dama, Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental.

Jona became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon on October 4, 2004. She remembers that date because it was a turning point in her life. As she tells it, it was through NWTF-Project Dungganon that she was able to build a viable business, repair their house, add a comfort room, and have enough income to send her children to school.

Today, Jona sells ice cream and "barquillos" or rolled wafer sticks, owns a "sari-sari" or general store, and breeds pigs for sale. Jona is very optimistic about the future of her children because she knows that she has financial backing with NWTF as long as she remains a good member and works hard to reach her goals.

For her 11th loan, Jona is asking to borrow PHP 15,000 to add to her capital for her many business ventures. She intends to use the profits for her family's daily needs and to set aside a certain amount for the future security of her family.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her diversified business ventures

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Cirila es casada, tiene 55 años y 5 hijos, Cirila tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. repuestos D. carros actividad que realiza todos los días, mientras que su esposo tiene un taller mecánico. Además Cirila tiene un puesto en el mercado Jesús nazareno en donD. venD. jugos.
Cirila necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. repuestos.
Los sueños D. Cirila son construir el segundo piso D. su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Alianza Microfinance Institute.

Cirila is a 55-year-old married mother with 5 children. She has a shop in her home in which she sells auto parts every day, while her husband works at an auto repair shop. Additionally, Cirila has a stand at the Jesús Nazareno Market, where she sells fruit juices.

Cirila needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing spare parts.

She dreams of building a second floor in her house and of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase auto parts

loans.name: Noel Agustin

texts.es: Noel Agustín Hernández tiene 33 años, su actividad económica es la pesca artesanal. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio, inicio este negocio por medio de su hermano, ya que le había  prestado el dinero necesario para iniciara su propio negocio, fue así que Noel logro realizar su propio negocio, el tenia que luchar ya que tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Noel ha enfrentado muchos desafíos como fue el no tener le capital suficiente, y no tenia personas que le brindaran el apoyo para salir adelante, por lo que los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de combustible, trasmayo y equipos de pesca. Su deseo es mejorar sus ventas y proporcionarle a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Noel Agustín Hernández is 33 years old and his economic activity is artisan fishing. He has engaged in this profession for more than 17 years, having started the business with help from his brother, who loaned him the money needed to start his own business. This is how Noel came to own his own business; he had to struggle since he has two children to care for. Noel has faced many challenges such as not having enough capital and not having people to support his progress; for this reason, financing has been of great help to his business. Now he is seeking this loan as working capital for the purchase of fuel, nets, and fishing equipment. His wish is to improve his sales and provide his family with what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Annabel Natividad

texts.es:
Annbel Sánchez es socia del Banco Comunal Everes, situado en la comunidad de Quemado  en la provincia de Manabí un lugar tranquilo donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura.

Annabel está casada con Jacinto un maestro en la construcción de casas, tiene 28 años ya es mamá de tres niños de 8 y 6 años y  un bebe de diez  meses al que   no lo puede dejar con nadie y siempre lo lleva donde va.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta informal de prendas de vestir como pantalones, blusas, interiores y bisutería,  recorre toda su comunidad visitando a sus clientes en su mayoría mujeres.

Annabel lleva un par de años en esta actividad  y asegura que este negocio es muy bueno y lo disfruta mucho, para proveerse de la mercadería hace  los pedidos a los distribuidores  para obtener mayores ganancias.

En esta ocasión el préstamo que esta solicitando estará destinado a la compra de mercadería para cumplir con algunos pedidos de ropa pendientes por entregar y aprovechará para abastecerse para  la época navideña con un stock surtido de ropa y cosméticos.

Annabel ya hizo realidad uno de sus sueños que era tener su propia casa y empezará a ahorrar para decorarla,  es lo único que le falta para completar su sueño.
texts.en:
Annbel Sánchez is a member of the Everes Communal Bank, located in the community of Quemado in the province of Manabí. It is a peaceful agricultural community.

Annabel is married to Jacinto, a master house builder. She is 28 years old and has 3 children aged 8 years, 6 years, and a baby of 10 months. She takes the baby with her wherever she goes.

Annabel’s business is selling clothes, such as pants, blouses, underwear and costume jewelry. She travels around the community visiting her clients, who are mostly women. She has been in business for about two years. Business has been good and she enjoys it a lot. She orders her merchandise from distributors in order to make a better profit. This loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise to fill some pending orders, and to stock up on clothing and cosmetics for the Christmas season.

Annabel has already realized one of her dreams – to have her own house. She is beginning to save to decorate the house, which is the only thing she lacks to complete her dream.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fill pending orders and buy merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Erastus Makokha

texts.en:
Erastus E. is 35 years old, married and blessed with two children. He makes a living by farming and by transporting people and goods on his motorcycle. He was introduced to KADET by the chairperson of his current loan group, and is applying for this loan to repair his vehicle. Erastus has two goals: improve his transportation business, and grow enough crops on his farm to feed his family and have extra produce to sell.

About KADET:  
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. More information on KADET is available on this website: http://www.kadet.co.ke/

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is excited to take his first loan with Kiva and believes that the loan will help him increase his capital. He sells yams and has been in this trade for five years. From this trade, he struggles to care for his immediate family.  Emmanuel needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase yam in bulk at a discount rate and be able to meet customers' demands while his capital and profit also increase. He is 32 years old, married with two children and resides in Delta state, Nigeria. He says thanks to KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase yams to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, 43 years old, is involved in rice farming. She is married and has two children. Her oldest child is now 21. She tills her rice field with patience. She makes sure to be strong and healthy to do the work required on her farm. She wants to earn more to improve her family’s living condition.

Regina used to borrow money from individuals who charge high interest. This brought difficulty in maintaining her farm and providing for the family. When she heard of CEVI, she immediately joined and was fortunate to qualify as a member. She used her previous loan to finance her farm. Out of her income from the farm, she was able to pay her obligations and provide for her family’s growing needs. She is now requesting a loan of PHP9,000. She will use this loan to purchase farm inputs needed at her farm. This loan will help Regina maintain her farm’s good condition.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Kuña Kyre´y Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Kyre´y se encuentra actualmente en su 2º ciclo cuenta con 18 integrantes.
Las integrantes se dedican a actividades varias entre las que se destaca la venta de comestibles, bebidas, despensa, peluquería, además de venta de ropas ,   entre otras cosas el destino de los fondos va para la compra de materiales como telas, ropas, hilos, carne, aceite, verduras, kiosko  entre otras cosas.
El comité presenta buena relación interna y respeto entre sus integrantes. Destacamos que es un comité nuevo pero no obstante mediante el esfuerzo de sus integrantes están consiguiendo buenos resultados.
Entre sus metas inmediatas resaltan la necesidad de que sus hijos se formen academicamente y puedan optar por un buen empleo,es por eso que redoblan esfuerzos para poder darles los materiales que puedan posibilitar lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Kyre'y community bank is currently in its second round of loans and has 18 members. Its members conduct various activities the most important of which include the sale of prepared food, drinks, a grocery and a hair salon, as well as clothes. Among other things, the loans go to purchase materials such as fabric, clothing, thread, meat, oil and vegetables.

The group members show the good relations and respect they have for each other. We point out that this is a new group, but they are nevertheless achieving good results through the efforts of its members.

The need for their children to get an education and be able to choose a good job stands out among the group's most important objectives. This is why they are renewing their efforts to give them the things they need that will enable them to meet their goals.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The women will put the loan to use purchasing ingredientes such as oil, vegetables, rice and flour for those with retail shops; as well as fruit, soft drinks, sugar, plastic containers and spoons for those who sell fruit salads; and clothes and seasonal items such as caps, gloves, underwear, jeans and shirts for quick sale during the season.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun V., age 37, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter.  Her husband passed away recently. 

Silk weaving is her main business for supporting her family. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials

loans.name: Phourng

texts.en:
Phourng P., 45, is married and lives with his four children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. P. is in a business as a real estate agent. He provides services to people who want to buy or sell their land in the province. He is able to earn an income of USD 12 per day. His wife grows morning glories as food for sale, earning an income of USD 7 per day.

P. and his family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to cope with their daily necessary expenses. Therefore, P. is requesting a loan of US$ 800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. He wants to use the expected loan to buy more morning glory seeds to produce more output. This is his first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: buy morning glories seeds to grow more vegetables

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 27 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a bénéficié de 4 près qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus, de jus de fruits naturels et de bouillie de mil. son objectif est d'assurer la prise en charge de sa famille et d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 27-year-old woman, married and mother of five children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group for two years, and was granted four loans, which she managed well and repaid in full. She is starting up a small store dealing in fabrics, natural fruit juices and millet porridge. Her objective is to take care of her family’s needs and to increase her savings.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Diéye

texts.en: Diéye N. is 49 years old and lives in a small village in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and the mother of eight children. She has been a member of the Village Bank "MBarry Gouytane" for eight years. She raises cattle and sells them on the market. This loan will allow her to buy more cattle and thereby increase her revenues.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
60-year-old Esther hails from Benin in Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with four children.

Esther is into pig farming - she rears and sells pigs to make a living. She has been in this business for some years and with the proceeds from the pig’s farm she is able to take care of her family’s needs and reinvest in her farming business.

Esther hopes to expand her pig farm; she wants to purchase more pigs and other farm inputs. She is requesting the loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more pigs to raise. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs for her farm

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 57 years old. Her husband is in commerce and they have four children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy.

Esther sells foodstuffs, drinks and groceries to earn a living in Benin City, Edo State. She has a good relationship with LAPO and needs a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva Celosa dreams of escaping the spiral of poverty. In 1995, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Her hope was to gain access to capital in order to start a business. She and her husband started a business making kaing (small baskets). Since then, over the course of nine loans, her business has continued to grow and provide good income for her family. However, the income from the business is not enough to sustain everyday needs. Therefore, the couple is now requesting Minerva's tenth loan in the amount of 35,000 pesos to use as working capital to start a fishing business as supplementary income. The loan will be used to pay for fish netting and a motor boat, and the remaining funds will be used to support the raw materials needed for her kaing business.

Minerva is looking forward to increased demand for fish on the island and expects her secondary business to grow and generate enough income for her family. She dreams of sending her grandchildren to school all the way through college and for them to find stable livelihoods. Through her business success, she also dreams of building a home made of concrete for more comfortable living.

Minerva C. is happily living with her five children and her 62-year-old husband Marcial, who is a fisherman and kaing maker in the province of Rizal.

loans.use: To pay for fish netting and a motor boat for a fishing business, and the remaining funds will be used to buy the raw materials needed for her basketmaking business.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha C. is a villager in Veal Thom village and she was born in 1952. She is a housewife and her husband is a government worker and aside from this, he is a fisherman who can earn only a little income. Her husband’s fishing business has a problem because he does not have enough fishing gear. Thus, Mrs. Sokha C. decided to ask for a loan to buy some fishing gear. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another one is a policeman, and the third is attending local public school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy some fishing gear

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén tiene 35años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su padre en el distrito de Paiján, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar ofreciendo servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en un vehículo motorizado llamado mototaxi, el se vale de esta labor para ganarse la vida, por lo que diariamente se esfuerza por sacar adelante su negocio, usualmente transporta pasajeros dentro del mismo distrito de Paiján y sus anexos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su padre con la economía del hogar.

El continuo uso brindado a su vehículo y el estado accidentado de la mayoría de caminos de la zona han hecho que su unidad movil empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamento, para realizar esta acción el se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 muevos soles.

Rubén es un hombre honrado y trabajador, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su padre una mejor calidad de vida, sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo le tienen mucha estima y le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Rubén is 35 years old, is single, and lives with his father in the district of Paiján, an area that belongs to the province of Ascope, in the region of La Libertad, which is located half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the region of Lambayeque. He works transporting cargo and passengers in a motorized vehicle known as mototaxi. He earns a living through this work so he makes an effort to keep his business going. He usually carries passangers within the district of Paiján and its surroundings. The earnings he makes are used to fund his personal expenses and help his father with the household finances. The continuous use of his vehicle and the state of the roads in the area have caused his vehicle urgent mechanical problems. In order to repair his vehicle, he is asking Edpyme Alternativa a loan for 1000 PEN. Rubén is an honest and hardworking man. His greatest wish is to be able to give his father a better life. His neighbors and colleagues have a deep appreciation for him and consider him trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair costs of vehicle

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 52 años, es casada y tuvo 2 hijos que ya tienen familia, Isabel viven la comunidad D. Huarcas, Provincia D. Vilcashuaman, se ubica a 5 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Isabel junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en donD. venden abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Ayacucho a donD. viaja cada 15 días. Además Isabel se dedica a la crianza D. animales como cuy, gallina, conejo, los cuales los comercializa en la misma comunidad.
Isabel necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Isabel is 52 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She lives in Huarcas, Vilcashuaman Province, which is five hours from the city of Ayacucho. Isabel and her husband have a store, where they sell a variety of goods, including vegetables and meat. They get their products by traveling to Ayacucho every two weeks. In addition, Isabel raises animals, such as guinea pigs, hens, and rabbits, which she sells locally. Isabel needs a loan of 1500 soles ($525) to buy rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante H., age 32, is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He and his wife have a school-aged child. To make a living, Renante provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. Renante has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Renante joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Renante is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Renante from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide transportation service

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon U. is 56 years old and lives in Ta Preah village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectares (5 acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice. She is also raises ducks for duck eggs and is able to earn a small income to support her family.

In order to support her duck breeding, Mrs. Phon U. decided to ask for a loan to bU. 2T (metric tons) of duck food.

Mrs. Phon U. is the mother of two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other is a duck breeder who supports his mother, too.

loans.use: To buy 2T of duck food to support her duck breeding business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 53-year-old married man living with his wife and eight children in Rshaf, a small country area in Southern Lebanon near Bint Jbeil.

Ahmad has owned private school buses since 2007, with nine years of experience in this business. Since his work is the only income source for him and his family, he is requesting a Loan from Al Majmoua in order to do the necessary maintenance for his buses at this time, since most schools are closed for the summer.

Ahmad’s clients are his neighbors and people from neighboring areas. At the beginning, he had financial problems starting his own business. His dream is to buy new buses and expand his business area.

loans.use: To do the necessary maintenance for his school buses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon A., who lives in Thmei village in Takeo province, was born in 1953. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is married, while the younger one is nineteen years old and is a seamstress in a garment factory. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. 

Her son-in-law is a motorcycle taxi driver, but his motorcycle is too old to use.  So to solve this problem, Mrs. Phon A. is seeking a loan to buy a new motorcycle for her son-in-law.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Candelario José

texts.es: El Sr. Candelario T. es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene cinco años de laborar para dicha Institución. En Ceprodel se le han otorgado cinco créditos para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para consumo para resolver necesidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Candelario T. is from the town of El Sauce. He has been employed for the past five years as a Municipal Security Guard. Ceprodel has granted him five loans for personal expenses. This loan will be to meet household needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for household expenses.

loans.name: Komi Mawuena

texts.fr: Mr A. Komi Mawuena est un jeune homme né le 24 Mars 1973. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Très dynamique, il essaie de joindre les deux bouts grâce à son petit commerce de vente de produits nutritionnels et de médicaments chinois. Ces produits sont beaucoup appréciés et consommés par les populations. Il sollicite un crédit afin de s’approvisionner suffisamment en produits et satisfaire en grande partie sa clientèle. Les profits générés lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions d’existence de sa famille et d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr A. Komi Mawuena est un jeune homme né le 24 Mars 1973. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Très dynamique, il essaie de joindre les deux bouts grâce à son petit commerce de vente de produits nutritionnels et de médicaments chinois. Ces produits sont beaucoup appréciés et consommés par les populations. Il sollicite un crédit afin de s’approvisionner suffisamment en produits et satisfaire en grande partie sa clientèle. Les profits générés lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions d’existence de sa famille et d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.

loans.use: vente de produits nutritionnels et de médicaments chinois

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mr. Chenda N., is 39 years old and lives with his widowed mother in a village along National Road Number Two, approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has been a solder since 1988.

The motorbike pictured with Chenda is old and breaks down very often, is costly to repair and uses more gasoline than newer motorbikes. Hence Chenda is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a new one.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en: Spartak has graduated from Economics school.In 2005 he sold his summer house and invested in setting up his own business to be financially independent and have a stable income.  Hesells women’s clothing and cosmetics.  The large variety of quality goods that he has available attracts a large women clientele. Recently the demand for his goods has increased, and Spartak must bring in more variety. He has applied to SEF for a loan to purchase new inventory stock.

loans.use: purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Claudia Gisel

texts.es:
La Sra. Claudia Gisel T. se dedica a hacer fritanga por las tardes en su casa de habitación, es una señora con una amplia experiencia en la fritanga además de trabajar en la Alcaldía de Chinandega por las mañanas ya que es operaria de limpieza.

Esta señora ha tenido un buen record con la institución ya que tiene créditos con CEPRODEL desde el año 2005 y ha sido una excelentísima cliente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Gisel T. makes fast food in the afternoons at home.  She has a lot of experience making fast food and also works for the City of Chinandega during the morning as Cleaning lady.

She has had a very good record with the institution in that she has had three loans with CEPRODEL since 2005 and she’s been an extremely excellent client.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make Tajadas (typical Nicaraguan fast food): bananas, cooking oil, manioc, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, D. 48 años, está casada con Guillermo, D. 52 años, ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 D. ellos en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad D. Kivinaki (selva central peruana). El trabajo que desempeña, Raquel. Es la agricultura, hace ya 20 años que se dedica a la siembra D. plátano, maíz y cítricos. Con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos; todos los días se dedica al cuidado D. sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta, es ver cristalizado sus esfuerzos, ya que en cada cosecha, comercializa, sus productos a buen precio. Con las temporadas agrícolas, y la ayuda D. su banco comunal, Raquel, está juntando un poco D. dinero, con lo que quiere abrir un negocio D. compra y venta D. frutas al por mayor. Pero paralelamente, seguir cultivando más productos oriundos D. la zona. Es el sexto crédito con MFP y, como integrante más antigua D. su banco comunal, está satisfecha del trabajo alcanzado hasta hoy. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá comprar plantas, para renovar sus plantaciones D. cítricos D. esa manera poder tener frutos, más grandes y jugosos.
texts.en:
48-year old Raquel is married to 52-year old Guillermo. They have six children, but only three still live with them in their own house located in the community of Kivinaki (in the central rainforest of Peru). Raquel has worked as a farmer for 20 years, growing bananas, corn, and citrus fruits. With help from her husband and children, she works in the fields every day. The part she enjoys the most is seeing the results of the effort she puts in; with each harvest she sells her produce for a good price. 

From these harvests and with help from her community bank, Raquel is putting together a bit of money with which she wants to open a wholesale business buying and selling fruit. At the same time she wants to continue growing more produce native to the area. 

This is Raquel’s sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP. As the longest-standing member of her community bank, she is satisfied with what she has achieved to date. With the loan she plans to buy new citrus plants for her fields so she can produce bigger, more juicy fruit.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruit plants

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 55 años es viuda y comparte con su hijo en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 10 años que posee una tienda, de esa manera se genera los ingresos que necesita para sostener a su familia. Ella vende frutas, dulcesy demás productos comestibles, en un local arrendado cerca de su casa. En ocasiones su hijo lo ayuda en la venta, por lo que es su principal apoyo. Su jornada laboral empieza en la madrugada, ya que a esa hora llegan los distribuidores de frutas y verduras y reparten a comerciantes menoristas, como es su caso. Espera continuar con al venta de éstos productos, puesto que le es rentable y con esos  ayuda en la manutención de su familia.  Ella se siete satisfecha con su trabajo, pues le hace una persona independiente, y por tal desea aumentar de mercadería y tener mas variedad de productos. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería y aprovechar esta época navideña donde realiza más ventas.
texts.en: Genoveva is 55-years-old. She's a widow and she owns her own house, which she shares with her son. For more than 10 years she's had a store to generate income that she needs to maintain her family. She sells fruit, candy, and other food products in a rented store space near her house. Sometimes her son helps her sell because it's his principal means of financial support. Her work day begins at dawn because that's when the fruit and vegetable distributors arrive to deliver their products to the retailers. She hopes to continue with the sale of these products because it is profitable and provides support in maintaining her family. She's satisfied with her work because it makes her independent. She wants to increase her merchandise and offer more variety. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She's very happy to know that she has financial support and she's happy to be part of her communal bank because all the members are people that she knows; they're responsible and supportive. She would like to thank everyone who gives to this loan because it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan she'll invest in the purchase of merchandise to prepare for the Christmas shopping season.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and other products to stock her store

loans.name: Evelin Rosario

texts.es:
La profesora Evelin  de 32 años de edad, tiene una hija que aun estudia su primaria, labora como docente de primaria desde hace 13 años, tiene una hija la cual estudia su primaria, su esposo labora como albañil, ambos comparten con los gastos familiares y son personas de bien.  

Solicita su sexto crèdito con AFODENIC mediante el Apoyo de Kiva para  construir una habitaciòn y mejorar las condiciones y por ende tener mayor privacidad.  

Su sueño es que su familia permanezca  bien unida, estar bien con Dios y que su hija siga estudienado para que sea una mujer de Bien.
texts.en:
The teacher Evelin is 32 years old; she has a daughter that is still in primary school. Evelin has worked as a primary school teacher for over 13 years. Her husband works as a mason and both share in the household expenses and are good people.

Evelin is asking for her sixth loan with AFODENIC (Kiva’s field partner) and with Kiva’s support to build a room and improve her living conditions and as a result have more privacy.

Evelin’s dream is for her family to keep being united and to be well with God and that her daughter keeps studying so she can be a respectable member of society.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en  el distrito de Pátapo, una zona predominantemente agrícola que produce principalmente caña de azúcar y sus derivados, se encuentra ubicada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
