Se dedica a la venta de alimentos, golosinas y bebidas gaseosas en quioscos, el ya lleva tres años en el negocio y actualmente se vale de el para solventar los gastos de su familia. Su esposa le apoya en esta actividad y actualmente cuenta con dos quioscos: el primero se encuentra ubicado en una escuela de la zona y el segundo frente a su domicilio. Ambos establecimientos cuentan con bastante acogida y le han servido durante todo este tiempo para salir adelante.

Carlos desea adquirir insumos para preparar comida y venderla por las noches en el quiosco que se encuentra ubicado frente a su domicilio, ya que, debido a la temporada de vacaciones escolares, el número de clientes del quiosco situado en la escuela ha disminuido. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Con el dinero del préstamo el tiene pensado preparar papas rellenas, salchipapas y hamburguesas.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is 44 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the district of Pátapo, a predominantly agricultural area that produces principally sugarcane and its products. It is located 45 minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.

He sells food, sweets and sodas in kiosks. He has been in this business for three years, and it is currently enough to cover the family expenses. His wife supports him in this activity, and he currently has two kiosks. The first is located in a school zone and the second is across from his house. Both establishments been received well and have served him all this time to get ahead.

Carlos wishes to acquire supplies to prepare food and sell it at night from the kiosk across from his house since, due to school vacation, the number of customers to his kiosk by the school has diminished. To achieve this objective, he needed to seek a loan of 1500 New Peruvian Soles with Edpyme Alternativa. With the money from the loan, he plans to prepare stuffed potatoes, salchipapas (sausage mixed with french fries) and hamburgers.

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare food and sell it at night

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is married and has 4 children. She has no formal education. Yaa has been selling palm oil and fish in Abrafo, near Abura, for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer. She and her husband combine their money to take care of the children. These expenses include paying for school fees, books, uniforms and other learning materials. Together they also pay for household expenses and the family's general sustenance.

Yaa's loan will be used to buy larger quantities of palm oil to increase her profit and further the expansion of her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide her children with the opportunity to enjoy a good education. She would also like to reinvest some the money back into her business.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of palm oil

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 36-years old.  She is married and supports her family by operating a business selling assorted items. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 18000. Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 15000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Ma. Elena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: El Sr. José Luis G. C. él es trabajador por cuenta propia en el negocio del Servicio de Venta de Cal  tiene treinta   años  de dedicarse a esta actividad, su servicio lo brinda en el norte del país vendiendo la cal, tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra del producto cal  y al mismo tiempo le invierte a su medio de trasportar el producto su camion y así brindar un mejor servicio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
José Luis G. C. works for himself in the business of selling lime.  He has had this business for 30 years.  He offers his service, selling lime, in the northern part of the country.  He has four school age children.

He has had five loans with CEPRODEL.  He has used each one to buy lime and to invest in his means of transportation, his truck.  That way he provides better service.  The loans from CEPRODEL have helped him immensely because he has improved the living conditions for himself and for his family.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a medical clinic in Kyegegwa.

loans.name: Margoin Yackeline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Margoin, ella tiene  39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad, uno de 14  y otro de 8 años, uno de los mayores es policía y los dos siguientes estudian en colegio, todos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por tres años y le gusta cómo se trabaja en el Banco.

Ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de productos lácteos, mientras el sale a entregar en su carro ella atiende el negocio en su casa, los productos que venden son: yogurt, quesos y mantequilla, también en su negocio venden bidones de agua, trabajan todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 18h00. Los productos los compran en Portoviejo a comerciantes que entregan al por mayor, llevan seis años que se dedican a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar queso, yogurt, mantequilla, entre otras cosas. Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres con Esperanza” (Hopeful Women) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed here back then.

We found Margoin, 39, here.  She’s married and has four children; two adults and one who is 14 and another who is 8.  One of the older ones is a police officer and the next two are in high school.  They all still live with her.   Her husband’s a merchant.  She’s been in the communal bank for three years and likes the way the bank operates.

She and her husband sell dairy products.  While he goes out to make deliveries in his car she stays home to tend to the business.  The products they sell are:  yoghurt, cheeses and butter.  She also has bottles of water for sale in her business.  They are open every day from 7am until 6pm.  They buy the products in Portoviejo from wholesalers.  They’ve been in business six years.

This loan is to buy cheese, yoghurt and butter, among other things.  Her dream is to have locale downtown.

loans.use: to buy cheese, yoghurt, butter, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 22-year-old, hardworking man living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. After failing to raise school fees for his education, he resorted to motorcycle riding and has been in service for a year. He has an ambition of buying his own motorcycle since almost 80 percent of his daily earnings have to be remitted to the owner of the motorcycle. Peter intends to use the credit facility to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 66 años, vive en compañía de su esposa y el menor  de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años se dedica a realizar bellos bordados típicos de los pueblos aledaños a su zona, trabaja generalmente en las noches en su casa ya que en el día trabaja de manera dependiente en una carpintería, de esta manera ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos a lo largo de sus años. Trabaja junto a su esposa y comparte esta labor que los une hasta ahora, los trabajos que realiza son mediante encargo de sus clientes que permanentemente solicitan de sus trabajos  y después de un mes viaja a repartir las faldas bordadas  a sus clientes y ellos al contando le pagan. Reconoce que ya no tiene esa misma fortaleza física y por eso demora un poco más en producir sus bordados, sin embargo ha perfeccionado en la calidad y los acabados de sus bordados y eso mantiene la fidelidad de sus clientes en seguir solicitando en su producción. Es su crédito número 8 con MFP, el banco comunal que integra significa mucho para el ya que aprendió muchas cosas positivas que lo ayudan en su vida diaria más que nada en el aspecto económico de la cual esta muy agradecido y por su parte seguirá trabajando con ese mismo sentido de responsabilidad. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos y telas para seguir bordando los pedidos de sus clientes y con una parte pagará los estudios universitarios del menor de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan is 66 years old and lives with his wife and the youngest of his four children in their own home.  For over 20 years he has been making beautiful embroidered garments which are typical in the villages in the area.  He generally works at home at night since during the day he works for a carpenter which has allowed him to increase his income over the years.  He and his wife share the embroidery activity that has kept them united.  

Their work is based on orders constantly being placed by customers.  After a month he delivers the embroidered skirts to customers and collects payment in cash.  He admits that he is not as physically strong as he used to be and takes a little longer to finish the embroidery, but he has perfected the quality and finish and this keeps customers loyal and coming back.

This is his 8th loan through MFP.  The communal bank means a lot to him because he has been able to learn many positive things that have helped him in his daily life.  He is especially grateful for the economic training.  He plans to continue working with a sense of responsibility.

He will use the loan to buy thread and fabric to continue embroidering orders for customers.  Part of the loan will go toward a university education for his children.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric

loans.name: Sinforiana

texts.en:
Sinforiana is 49 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sinforiana is borrowing PHP 16,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 56 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school.

Myrna has been a sugarcane farmer in the Philippines for ten years. She requested a PHP15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. This will be her nineteenth loan from NWTF.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng, age 53, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Leng raises pigs to sell, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who produces wooden furniture, earning an income of $1 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Leng has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase used motorbikes to resell. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy used motorbikes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man living with his parents. He is from Lebanon. In 2007, he decided to start running his own business. So, he opened a small mini-market where he sells dairy and daily products, soft drinks, detergents etc. 

He has obtained two Kiva loans and we note that he has a very good repayment history. Today, he is requesting a loan of $2000 US from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory. In the future, he is planning to enlarge his shop and add a small corner where he will start a home products trading business.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga is 33 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Currently they live in a rented apartment. 

He has been running a taxi business since 2008 and works on contract with a taxi company. His wife works as a salesperson at a building materials sales shop. His elder son goes to secondary school and the younger daughter attends a kindergarten. 

In 2000, the Mongolian parliament adopted a new land law according to which every Mongolian citizen who reached 18 was allowed to obtain a 0.07 hectare plot of land free of charge. Battulga recently has obtained a license on his land and now he is planning to build a fence around it. In the future, he is planning to build a family house on his land. 

The loan Battulga is taking will be used to buy enough wood planks to build a fence around his land and to pay for labor costs.

loans.use: To buy enough wood planks to build a fence around his land and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: This borrower is 35 years old, married and has eight children. She has a bakery. For good profit, she want to purses machine. 6 children are schooling, and she will use this loan for paying fees,expanding the business.

loans.use: paste

loans.name: Sheria Group

texts.fr: La cliente K., leader du groupe d’affaire « Sheria », est entrepreneur, âgée de 48 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous et 4 autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse de farines de manioc.  Son mari est un gardien (sentinelle) auprès d’une entreprise privée. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal de  Nyabushongo.  Il y a 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  17 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  3 sacs de farines de manioc à marchander et le reste d’argent sera affecté à son projet de construction de sa maison.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  construire une maison confortablement. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Sheria » est 14 femmes. Néanmoins, 2 autres collègues du marché nyabushongo se sont improvisées sur la photo du groupe , d’où 16 figures visibles.
texts.en: K., an entrepreneur, is the leader of the "Sheria" business group.  She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 10 children who are all in school and 4 others who already have their own homes.  She sells manioc flour.  Her husband is a guard (sentry) at a private enterprise.  She sets up her merchandise at the Nyabushongo communal market.  She has been operating this small business for 10 years.  Meanwhile, she has completed 17 loan cycles with Hekima.  This new loan will enable her to stock up with 3 bags of manioc flour to sell and the remainder of the money will be used for building her house.  In addition, her goal is to educate her children and to build a comfortable home. She thanks Hekima for its actions in support of poor women excluded from traditional banks.  It is fitting to mention that there are 13 women in the "Sheria" business group.  There are 3 other colleagues from the Nyabushongo market included in the group photograph, where 16 people are visible.

loans.use: 3 bags of manioc flour and funds for her housing project.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: Jean  est commerçant, né au Rwanda.et il est le client d’ACB depuis 2009. Il est marié, il  a  38 ans, il a 5 enfants entre 5 ans et 13 ans, et tous vont à l’école, Il  a 2 ans des études secondaire. C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter 40 cartons d’eau minéral, 20 cartons des savons, 25 cartons des biscuits, 20 cartons de jus de pommes. Il  n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’améliorer  la qualité des services pour attire la clientèle, et accroitre la capacité de son business pour  la satisfaction de son clients   . Pour ses ambitions il voudrait construire sa propre maison et devenir un grand commerçant dans la région, et assure l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is a merchant who was born in Rwanda. He has been a client of ACB since 2009. He is married and 38 years old, and he has five children, aged 5 to 13, all of whom go to school. He has two years of secondary education. 

This loan cycle is his third one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy 40 boxes of water, 20 boxes of soaps, 25 boxes of cookies, and 20 boxes of apple juice. No problems at all are expected in repaying his loan. 

His strategy for business growth is to improve the quality of service for attracting customers and to grow his business capacity for satisfying his customers. As for his ambitions, Jean would like to build his own house, to become a major merchant, and to ensure his children are educated.

loans.use: to buy 40 boxes of water, 20 boxes of soaps, 25 boxes of cookies, and 20 boxes of apple juice

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is 39 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.  He and his wife have had a furniture shop business for six months. The couple works hard to improve the services they offer. The business has a monthly income of about 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which Orlando uses to pay for motorcycle transport, his family's daily needs, and allowances for his children.

Orlando hopes to improve the quality of the chairs, tables, cabinets and and beds he makes.  He plans to use this loan of 15,000 PHP to buy wood, varnish, and iron to repair the furniture and shop to make it more comfortable to work at.  He wishes to be able to give his children a good education and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase wood, varnish, and iron for a furniture shop business

loans.name: Zhyldyzkhan

texts.ru:
Жылдызхан 51 год, замужем , является матерью  8-ых детей.   Жылдызхан - активная, решительная и трудолюбивая женщина.   Ее муж  Алижан поддерживает свою семью тем, что занимается перевозкой пассажиров.  
Жылдызхан  начала свой бизнес в  сельском хозяйстве в 1991 году.  После развала Советского Союза многодетной семье было трудно, и  для того, чтобы прокормить свою семью, женщина решила заняться разведением скота и продажей молочной продукции  на местном рынке. На сегодняшний день семья занимается животноводством, полеводством,  садоводством, и реализацией своей продукции. 
На данный момент  Жылдызхан достигла хорошего результата  - ее хозяйство, насчитывающее пять дойных коров и восемь овец позволяет получать доход в сумме около 10,000 сом (KGS)  в месяц от продажи молочной и мясной продукции. Для дальнейшего расширения и развития своего бизнеса, Жылдызхан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) для увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Zhyldyzkhan is 51 years old, married and is a mother of eight children.  Zhyldyzkhan is an active, decisive and hard-working woman.  Her husband, Alijan, supports the family by providing passenger transportation.  Zhyldyzkhan started her business in 1991.  After the fall of the Soviet Union, the family was going through hard times, and she decided to get involved in breeding livestock and sales of dairy products at the local market in order to feed her family.  Today, the family is involved in animal husbandry, farming, gardening and sales of their products.  Zhyldyzkhan achieved a good result.  Her household that includes five dairy cows and eight sheep yield a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS) from the sales of dairy and meat products.  Zhyldyzkhan went to "Bai Tushum and Partners" to obtain a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) in order to expand and develop her business further by increasing the quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Zilolahon's Group

texts.en:
Zilolahon is the leader of this group. She is 23 and divorced. She is raising her three year old daughter. The daughter goes to a kindergarten. 

Zilolahon works as a teacher at school, in order to earn her livelihood she cultivates cotton. She applies for the loan because she needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers for cultivating cotton. In the future, Zilolahon wishes to provide her daughter with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 46, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a driver, and is mother to their four children. Two are already working while one is still studying in college and one in high school. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Elena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located near the roadside of their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of  500 Philippine Pesos (PHP)in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elena hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school and office uniforms. She has had this business for 20 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed for the tailoring shop. Magdalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to travel abroad to buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all of them  go to school. She also cares for her father. She operates a retail shop. She sells her products in a rented shop. She has been in business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, salt and soap. 

Her aspiration for her business is to grow it into a wholesale shop and also to build rental houses. Her major business challenges are seasonality and ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and soap.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and blessed with eight children. For the last five years, he has been practicing poultry farming to support his family. He also does dairy  and pig farming to supplement his income. He has employed one person to assist him to manage the business. 

In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. Peter has requested for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens for his poultry farm.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma wants a loan to buy chickens for her poultry farm. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of her four children. She has been raising chickens for six months. 

She desires to educate her children and buy a car for transport. Her dream is to move her business to a permanent location.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 48-year-old Lebanese divorced man living on his own. He’s a hard worker, dependent on himself.  

In order to collect money and build a good future he opened his own minimarket in 2010 after being involved in this domain for the past fifteen years.  He knows well how to select his products and serve his customers as well as he can. Today, he wants to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen S.A.L to buy added goods such as daily and dairy products, canned bottles and many other items for his business in order to increase his sales therefore his profits.

In the future, he plans to open his own supermarket.

loans.use: to buy added goods such as daily and dairy products, canned bottles and many other items.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BENKADI sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à Ouayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
KONIBA, à droite de la photo,  fait le commerce de chaussures, il ya environ  2 ans et souhaite devenir grossiste. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  une centaine de paires de chaussures en plastique. Elle s’approvisionne dans au grand marché de Sikasso chez les grossistes.  Elle les revend en détail de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes; au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi group are married women who are on average 33 years old with three children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their first loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, seeking to meet the needs of their customers.
Koniba, on the right of the picture, has been active in the shoe retail business for about 2 years, and wants to become a wholesaler.

She will use the loan to buy a hundred pairs of plastic shoes. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the general market in Sikasso. She sells them retail as an itinerant vendor and from her home, for cash to both women and men customers.

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 17,500 FCFA, part of which will be used to pay the loan and interest, and the rest to be put into savings.

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: 03.09.117.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Thúy is 36 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 03.09.117.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of four members. Thúy lives with two dependents in Thiệu Hóa district, Thanh Hóa province

In 2010, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thúy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Katonzi Men And Women Group

texts.en: Edmon is a 32-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a photography studio for five years. He started with 1,500,000 shillings and now has 6,000,000 shillings of working capital. His hardships are theft, inadequate capital to purchase modern equipment, and high transportation costs. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is diversifying his businesses to include farming. Edmon wants money to buy modern equipment for his studio. He is a member of the above mentioned group, where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy modern equipment for his studio.

loans.name: Beth Dev

texts.en: Beth Dev is a married and a mother of 5 dependents. She is 45 years old and lives in Buracan, Bonifacio. Beth Dev owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of 15,600 per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 8 years. Beth Dev requested a loan of 25,000 from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Beth Dev been a good member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Beth Dev wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Emilia Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de carácter muy jovial y sobre todo con mucha alegría a pesa de que ha pasado por muchas adversidades y a pesar de todo ello ha logrado salir adelante, sobre todo porque es madre y su hijo es el regalo más importante que Dios le ha podido dar y quien es su mayor motivación y su razón de vivir. La vivienda de Blanca se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Carhuaz, la cual se encuentra en la sierra peruana, Carhuaz tiene un clima muy frio y es muy visitado por los turistas de diversas partes del mundo, ya que podemos encontrar al “Nevado de Pastoruri”.

Día a día Blanca trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa en el mercado de su ciudad, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos del hogar; ella cree que esta saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque le gusta su trabajo y sobre todo porque es amable con los clientes.

Blanca está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá terminar de construir su vivienda ya que le faltan materiales de construcción para construir las paredes y parte del techo, de esta manera ella podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Blanca is a very enthusiastic and joyful person despite all the hardship that she's been through. Despite all this, she has managed to get ahead especially because she is a mother to her son who is the best present God could ever have given her and who is her motivation and reason for life. 

Blanca's house is found in the city of Carhuaz, which is found in the Peruvian highlands. Carhuaz is very cold and is visited by tourists from all over the world as there you can find the 'Pastoruri Glacier'. 

Day by day, Blanca works in her small clothes business in the city's market. She works for around 10 hours a day and with her profits she is able to pay her household costs, albeit with much effort. She believes that she is doing well because her enjoys her work and especially because she is kind with her clients.

Blanca is very thankful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to their help she will be able to finish building her house as she still needs some building materials to build the walls and part of the ceiling. 

Through this, she will be able to improve her quality of life and continue working and fighting to make her dream come true: "Give her son a good education and finish building her house".

loans.use: to build her house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with one child who is not in school. She does not have additional family members. Grace sells secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She gets additional income by selling soft drinks at the market. She works seven days a week. She has requested 300,000 shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of secondhand clothes to sell. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to open a stall which sells both clothes and soft drinks. Grace lives in a rented house, and her family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es: Abelina es muy joven, está casada con el señor Carlos y es mamá de cuatro niños los cuales asisten a la escuela. Ella y su familia viven en una comunidad muy tranquila, es una zona mazahua y sus habitantes son muy amables, siempre tratan de salir delante de alguna manera. Abe, como las personas de su comunidad la conocen, tiene un gran espíritu emprendedor: a sus  27 años tiene una papelería que lleva funcionando ya siete años. Abe platica que inició su tienda de abarrotes porque tenía necesidad de apoyar a a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos; en primera instancia pensó en poner una tienda de abarrotes pero ya tenía mucha competencia. Entonces pensó en aprovechar el hecho de que había una escuale muy cerca de su casa y pensó que una papelería también sería un muy buen negocio. “Inicie vendiendo solo algunas libretas, colores, lápices, bolígrafos, sacapuntas, lo más indispensable, pero poco a poco vi muchas ganancias y cada vez los clientes me solicitaban más cosas de papeleria”. Explica que con créditos pequeños que la institución le ha hecho ha podido levantar su negocio poco a poco. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito para comprar una fotocopiadora, anteriormente no la había podido comprar precisamente por falta de dinero. Todos los días Abe abre desde muy temprano su papelería para atender a sus clientes, le gusta tener mucho contacto con sus clientes por eso siempre trata de darles los mejores precios. La meta de Abe es poder llenar un poco mas su papelería, ella considera que le hacen falta varias cosas y le gustaría seguir con su negocio porque es una muy buena manera de poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar; de lo contrario, si llega a cerrar su papelería tendría que salir a trabajar y descuidar a sus niños.
texts.en:
Abelina is very young.  She's married to Carlos and the mother of four children who attend school.  She and her family live in a very peaceful community.  It's a Mazahua area and the residents are very friendly and try to get ahead somehow.

Abe, as she's known in the community, has a great enterprising spirit.  At the age of 27 she has a school supplies store that she has had for seven years.

Abe says she started her store because she needed to help her husband with the household expenses and the children's education.  At first she thought about setting up a grocery store but there was a lot of competition.  Then she considered making the most of the school that was close to her house to start a school supplies store, which would also be a very good business.  "I started with only a few notebooks, colored pencils, pencils, pens, pencil sharpeners, the most essential things.  Little by little, though, I saw a lot of profit and the customers were always requesting more supplies."

Abelina says that she has been able to establish her business little by little with small loans from the institution.  Currently she's requesting a loan to buy a photocopier.  She couldn't buy one previously because she didn't have the money.

Abe opens her store very early every day to serve her customers.  She likes having a lot of contact with her customers and always tries to give them the best prices.

Abe's goal is to be able to stock her store a little more.  She thinks she needs a few things and would like to continue with her business because it's a very good way to help with the household expenses.  On the other hand, if she has to close her shop she would have to go out to work and would neglect her children.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Matiko would like to buy 5 steers

loans.name: Leleo

texts.en: Vegetables are really important in our daily lives and that is what Leleo M. belives in. She grows different varieties of vegetables like pumpkins, cabbages, cucumbers and tomatoes to name a few. A determined and hard working woman  most of her times is spent in selling her produce at the market. Leleo earns eighty-tala everyday of the week.  However, bad weather is a constraint for Leleo’s small business sometimes. Nevertheless she is always willing to overcome these problems and she is confident that her son who has a small business of his own can assist her whenever she is in need.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, rage, cabbages, cucumber, pumpkin (seeds), knives, cement, sand, and timber.

loans.name: Lilian Marleny

texts.en:
My business is selling vegetables and fruits. I have had this business for four years. Now I need to buy more vegetables and fruits. Sales have been very good this season and I have run out of product to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio es la venta de verdura y frutas hece 4 años que tengo este negocio, ahora necesito comprar las verduras y frutas en esta temporada la venta hacido muy buena y me he quedado sin producto.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Mehrihon

texts.en: Mehrihon has been engaged in trade for 9 years. She is 52 years old and she has 3 children. She is divorced from her husband. She began her business with a small counter and has gradually expanded it. Now she rents a trading place in a big shop. The expansion of business demanded additional money and one and a half years ago she came to Microinvest and received her first loan. In her business, there were important changes as she previously only sold children's clothes, but now she sells children's footwear as well. Soon it will be school season and Mehrihon plans to use a new loan for the purchase of school uniforms.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
"LAPO has rained good things on me," says Mrs. Lucy Osahonkhoe. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Lucy hopes to expand her business with the requested loan amount of US$ 400, i.e. buy more food items for resale in an open-air market.

Lucy has been in this business since 2000 and is a LAPO leader in one of the unions. She is 45 years old, married, and mother of five children.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is 39 years old, married, has three children and owns a hardware store where she sells all types of tools for construction. She has run the hardware store from her home for more than 8 years. Maria says that sales have been good due to the fact that the store is in a neighborhood that is experiencing a lot of growth, where there is a lot of construction on new houses and this generates sales because the store is fairly lucky to have the variety of merchandise that it offers. With the loans that the Fundación Paraguaya awarded her in the past, Maria was able to buy a wider variety of merchandise to supply her business. Nevertheless, she says that she’s going through months of high sales when it comes to construction, and she plans on requesting another loan to expand her showroom, as it is quite small and it is impossible to adequately exhibit all of her merchandise. Maria wishes that the economic situation of her country would improve, and that more jobs are created, because the high level of emigration that the country is experiencing due to the lack of work makes her very sad.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria tiene 39 años está casada y tiene 3 hijos, posee una ferretería, dónde se vende todo tipo de artículos para construcción, la misma lo tiene en su mismo domicilio, y hace más de 8 años. Comenta la señora Maria, que registra buen movimiento de venta debido a que está en un barrio en proceso de crecimiento, dónde existe gran cantidad de construcción de nuevas casas y eso genera movimiento ya que su ferretería es bastante surtida por la variedad de mercaderías que posee. Con los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya la señora María pudo comprar mercaderías y surtir más su negocio, no obstante afirma que está en los meses de mayor movimiento en cuanto al tema de construcción y tiene pensado solicitar un nuevo préstamo para ampliar su salón ya que actualmente por el pequeño espacio que posee le imposibilita exhibir adecuadamente sus mercaderías. Uno de sus anhelos es que mejore la situación económica del país y se generé más fuentes de trabajo ya que le causa mucha tristeza el alto índice de emigración que atraviesa actualmente el país, por causa de la falta de trabajo.

loans.use: Buy paint, wire, lime, electric accessories, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Julliet's Group

texts.en: Julliet's venture is selling matooke (green bananas). She intends to use the profits to buy a plot of land, pay school fees for her children and also expand her current business.

loans.use: To buy more matooke (green bananas) and  increase her stock

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
"I have a business where I sell various goods, such as baseball caps, purses, belts, backpacks, and beauty products, and a few other things. I'd like to invest in purchasing merchandise to bring my customers different items, but I don't have the money for the investment. I am asking for $1200 to invest in my business."

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo una negocio D. venta D. artículos varios, como cachuchas, bolsas, cintos, mochilas y productos D. belleza; así como algunas cosas más, me gustaría invertir en L. compra D. mercancía para traer a mis clientes artículos diferentes pero me hace falta algo D. dinero para L. inversión”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in my business

loans.name: Kibuuka Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Getrude N.. She is currently in the business of selling milk and is requesting a loan to purchase a freezer. Getrude is 31 years old and is married. Her husband is a casual laborer. She has 1 child aged 2. Each week, Getrude makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add it to her business. Getrude has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy extension cables, bulbs and sockets and the loan was paid back on time.

Getrude is joined in her small group by Judith N., Sauba N., Pauline K., and Lydia N.. Judith N. has a business selling electrical gadgets and wants to increase stock. Sauba N. is currently operating a business selling foodstuff and wants a loan to add more stock. Pauline K. operates a retail shop business and wants to purchase more shop items. Lydia N. is currently in the market vendor business and is requesting a loan to add to her business.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and increase the quantity of milk

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela P. is married to Miguel Mercado and has three children (Alejandro, Alexander who is 6 years old and Tania who is 11 years old). Her husband is a carpenter and makes wood bodywork for trucks. They dream that their children become dental and nursing professionals. Currently, they all study. Graciela says that she began in her profession when she was young since she was raised by her grandmother, who sold “chipas” (cheese bread snack), and she helped her in the kitchen. She now has her own business and sells basic necessities. The loan that she is requesting will be used for the expansion of her shop so that she can have a pantry. They hope that their country has new politicians who are interested more in the people.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra.Graciela P. està casada con el Sr.Miguel Mercado y tienen 3 hijos (Alejandro,Alexander de 6 años y Tania de 11 años de edad). Su marido es carpintero y fabrica carrocerias de madera para camiones. Sueñan que sus hijos sean profecionales odontologos y enfermera, actualmente todos estudian. La Sra. manifesto que se inicio en este oficio desde muy pequeña ya que se crio con su abuela, quien vendía chipas y ella le ayudaba en la cosina. Actualmente ya cuenta con su propio negocio y ademàs vende articulos de primera necesidad. El credito solicitado serà destinado a la ampliaciòn de su local comercial y de esa forma tener una despensa. Esperan que nuestro pais tenga nuevos gobernantes que se interesen màs por el pueblo.

loans.use: To expand and improve her shop.

loans.name: Mutallim

texts.en:
Mutallim T. is a 41-year-old farmer and father of three living in Saatli, Azerbaijan. For the past eight years, he has bred cattle for meat. His three sons assist him with his business. With their profits, they have been able to build a shed on their land.

But last year, prices for many supplies rose. As a result, Mutallim has requested a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars to purchase three calves so he can expand his business.

loans.use: To buy three calves for a cattle farm

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou T. is 46 years old, married with 1 child and 2 grandsons in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Colobane Fass in Ziguinchor for 2 and a half years. She would like to strengthen her business, which consists of buying and selling smoked fish. Her income allows her to take care of her family, and she has always respected her financial obligations. Fatou is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of 6 monrhs in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Fatou T., 46 ans, mariée 01 enfants et 02 petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Colobane Fass à Ziguinchor depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter et revendre du con fumé (poisson fumé). Ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille. Elle a toujours respecté ses engagements. Fatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell smoked fish

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad is a member of the community bank Las Divinas, located in the street Apurimac 130, in the district of Calleria in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 61 years old and the mother of 10 children. Her husband is a bricklayer, but his meager income does not meet the family's expenses. As a result, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos Trinidad decided to start her own beauty products business.

Trinidad works selling a variety of beauty products. She rises at 7 AM in order to prepare breakfast for her children. Later she spends the day distributing her beauty products to her clients until 5 pm. With this loan of 1700 soles (Peruvian currency) which will be repaid in 6 months she will buy a large quantity of beauty products in order to increase her sales.

Apart from her commitment to support her children, Trinidad works because of the way it makes her feel, and because it allows her to independently manage her finances and help with the household expenses. She is appreciative of the support that Manuela Ramos provides her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Trinidad pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr. Apurimac 130, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 61 años y es madre de 10 hijos, su esposo es albañil, pero sus ingresos económicos son muy bajos y no son suficientes para su familia, es así que Trinidad con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

La señora Trinidad se dedica a la venta de diversos productos de belleza, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, para luego dedicarse a la repartición de sus productos de belleza a sus clientes hasta 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compro mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para incrementar sus ventas.

Trinidad a pesar de contar con el apoyo de sus hijos trabaja para poder sentirse bien y para que sus ganancias los maneje de manera independiente para poder ayudar en los gastos de su hogar, esta agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: Buy a variety of beauty products.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 37 years old and married with five children. She lives at Okokhuo in Edo State, Nigeria. She is into the planting of pineapples and plantains. She has been in the business of farming since 1999. She sells her farm produce in the local market to get money. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more pineapple suckers for planting and also to pay to clear her farmland.

loans.use: To buy more pineapple suckers and pay for the clearing of her farmland

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Maria tiene 49 años, vive con 4 D. sus 6 hijos, que ya son mayores e independientes. 
Durante muchos años ha cumplido su noble tarea D. ser madre y realizó para ello, valerosas tareas, hoy que ya terminó esa tarea, pero no desea parar, pues sigue dedicándose al negocio   D. la venta D. abarrotes y golosinas en el pequeño kiosco que adecuó en su casa, en este pequeño establecimiento, pero bien surtido, atienD. todo el día, por ello que siempre está atenta en ver lo que necesitan sus vecinos, para que pueda adquirir la mercadería, para ella, una dificultad, es el incremento constante D. los precios, que no le permite obtener las ganancias esperadas.
Maria trabaja porque siempre le ha motivado el ser algo en la vida y superarse constantemente. 
Solicita este préstamo para acrecentar su capital D. trabajo, comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería para surtir con mas productos su pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old, living with 4 of her 6 children, who are now grown and independent. For many years she fulfilled her noble calling to be a mother and completed that work. Now that she is finished, she does not want to stop, so she has started a business selling groceries and sweets in a little kiosk that she built in her house. She attends this small but well-stocked establishment all day long, always attentive to notice what her neighbors need, so she can acquire the merchandise. One difficulty is the constant rise in prices, which prevents her from earning the hoped-for profits.

Maria works because she has always been motivated to be something in life and to constantly better herself. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her working capital. She will buy a large quantity of merchandise in order to supply her small shop with more products.


Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her small shop

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora tiene 4 hijos todo menores de edad, es separada, ante de dedicaba a la venta ambulante de mercería por el interior del país. Luego vio la necesidad de quedarse con sus hijos y como esfuerzo logro abrir su negocio. Hace 1 año , ya que tiene una escuela frente a su domicilio

El crédito otorgado por la Fundación, será utilizado en las compras de mercadería varias para vender en su negocio tales como juguetes de todo tipo para niños y niñas, cuadernos, libros, lápices, útiles varios de oficina, etc.

En el futuro sueña con ampliar su negocio y abrir un ciber, fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Nora has 4 young children and is separated from her husband. She used to sell merchandise in the interior of the country as a traveling salesperson. She then saw the need to stay at home with her children and, with great effort, was able to open her business in her home which faces a school. She has had her business for one year.

The loan she receives through Fundacion will be used to purchase a variety of merchandise for her business such as all types of toys for boys and girls, notebooks, books, pencils, and various office supplies.

Her dream is to expand her business to provide internet services and photocopying services.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Lialiana Yajayda

texts.es:
Con 2 hijas menores, 1 de ellas en el colegio, y con su esposo (chofer) vive la señora Yajayda. Hace un mes decidió poner una tienda y, enhorabuena para su familia, le ha ido muy bien, sin embargo, sus comensales le exigen cada vez más productos y se le suelen acabar algunos rápidamente. Ella luce maravillada con sus hijas, sólo busca lo mejor para ellas, por lo que decidió poner la tienda en primer lugar (antes se dedicaba a trabajos eventuales, de muy poco e inestable rédito).

Para tan noble, maternal labor necesita de 500 soles como préstamo, lo que le posibilitaría la compra al por mayor de sus productos, incrementando sus ganancias y beneficios para sus menores hijas, a quienes adora.
texts.en:
Señora Yajayda lives with two young daughters, one of whom is in high school, and with her husband (a driver). It has been one month since she decided to open a store and, in a good time for her family, it has gone very well. Her clients demand more goods every time they come, and they have begun to return more quickly. She is shining with astonishment with her daughters, she only wants the best for them, and for them she decided to open the store in the first place (as before she worked at casual jobs, which paid very little and were very unstable.) This noble, maternal work needs 500 soles as a loan, which would make it possible for her to buy more of her products, increasing her profits, and benefiting her young daughters whom she adores.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have more in her store and to buy toys to sell for Christmas

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Koemlorn B. is a villager in Preak Thom village in Kandal Province. She is 41 years old and the mother of a child who is a construction worker. Her husband is shown on the right of photo. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Nhoel Sophan, is a construction worker. Their family needs more income to support their family and improve living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Koemlorn B. requests for a loan to repair their house to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr:
Madame A. Améyo est une jeune dame de 32 ans. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle réside actuellement à Kpémé.
Le commerce d’alimentation générale est sa principale source de revenus lui permettant de subvenir aux charges de la famille car le revenu de son mari n’arrive pas à couvrir tous les besoins de la famille. 
Pour renforcer son commerce, elle sollicite un financement afin d'approvisionner suffisamment sa boutique en marchandises. Ceci lui permettra d'accroitre son chiffres d'affaires et ses profits.
texts.en:
Améyo A. is a young woman of 32. She is married, has 3 children, and currently lives in Kpémé. Her main source of income is the sale of groceries, which allows her to support her family as her husband's income is not sufficient to pay all of the family's expenses. She is requesting a loan in order to bolster her business: she will buy supplies in order to have a well-stocked store. This will allow her to increase her sales and her profits.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Boeng Tras village in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, have formed a village bank loan group of which Mrs. Mom K. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. At this time, she does not have enough money to buy fuel for a pump to water her field and rice seeds. Therefore, she has decided to request a loan to buy fuel. Her husband, Mr. Mung Sok Thy, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Mom K. is 38 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom attends the local school. The others are too young to work or study. 

All but one member of this loan group will receive monthly payment loans.  The last member  will receive an end-of-term loan, on which no principal need to be paid until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make principal payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fuel for an irrigation pump.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana N. is 50 years old. She is married and has nine children - five daughters and four sons. Her three youngest children are still in school - junior high and elementary. The other ones have already completed their education and are now working. Some are engaged in the trading business in the city, while the others earn income as farmers. Susana's family lives in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small commercial and farming community located near Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Susana works very hard to help her husband financially support their family. She earns income trading banana and oranges, which is a business run by many women in the community. Susana buys bags of oranges and unripe banana from farmers in the nearby villages, stores the banana to ripe and then sells it to retailers in the local market. She has been in this business for ten years and has always dreamed of saving enough money to support her children in school. She is therefore asking for a loan to buy banana and oranges in bulk to be able to increase her business profit margin.

loans.use: Purchase of banana and oranges

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es: Lastenia tiene 70 años, vive en su casa junto a con su esposo y sus dos hijos. A ella siempre le agradó realizar pasteles y todo lo referente a repostería, pues es el don que tiene, el cual ha estado perfeccionando estudiando desde joven y ahora tiene 20 años dedicándose a la venta de tan deliciosos aperitivos, los cuales son muy solicitados en su localidad, debido a que hay muchas celebraciones para degustar de dulces. Para las fiestas,  recurre doña Lastenia gustosamente a atender pedidos, aunque para cumplir con ellos requiere de mayor inversión para los ingredientes que utiliza. Pero este negocio es muy rentable pues en los eventos sociales el costo por entrega es mayor, lo que la beneficia y suele ganara el doble. Lastenia espera ser muy reconocida en su labor y abrir una fuente de soda en su casa, la cual está aún en construcción. Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP y se muestra muy contenta con el trabajo realizado dentro de su grupo, ya que pudieron organizarse adecuadamente. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes y productos para preparar sus bocaditos, y espera atender así mayor cantidad de ventas.
texts.en:
Lastenia is 70 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. She has always enjoyed making cakes and all sorts of baked goods--it is a gift, which she has been perfecting through study since she was young. Now she has 20 years of experience selling delicious appetizers, which are very popular in her neighborhood because there are so many celebrations where sweets are enjoyed. For the holidays, Lastenia happily fulfills orders, but to complete them requires more investment in the ingredients she uses. This business is very profitable because the delivery costs for social events are higher, and she can make twice as much. Lastenia hopes to become very well known for her work and open a soda fountain in her house, which is still under construction. This is her 10th loan with MFP, and she is very pleased with the work carried out within her group, which is well organized. She will invest this money in ingredients and produce for preparing sandwiches, and she expects this to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for desserts

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia tiene 18 años, vive con su esposo y su bebé. Se dedica a la venta de panes que elabora su esposo en un horno artesanal, este negocio lo viene realizando desde hace un año, sale muy temprano por la mañana a repartir los panes en las tiendas y bodegas de su barrio y lo que pueda quedar lo vende en una esquina de su casa, de esta manera garantiza los ingresos económicos para su familia. El trabajo es sacrificado porque su esposo elabora los panes durante la noche y ella siempre se levanta a las 4 de la madrugada para repartir, pese a ello, Lilia sabe que su negocio es rentable, porque el pan es un producto comestible que siempre se vende. Para el futuro Lilia y su esposo esperan aumentar su producción y expandir su mercado. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y la primera vez que lleva un trabajo en grupo con el banco comunal que actualmente integra, ella fue invitada a integrarse cuando el banco ya estaba formado, por ello se compromete a  ser activa en las actividades que realicen. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de sacos de harina y manteca en grandes para abastecerse de estos productos y prevenir pérdidas en caso del alza de precios.
texts.en:
Lilia is 18 years old, and lives with her husband and baby. She sells breads which her husband makes in an artisan oven. She has been doing this for about a year, and goes out very early in the morning to deliver the bread to the stores and markets in her neighborhood, and whatever is left over she sells on the corner of her street. This is how she makes sure her family has an income.

The works is a big sacrifice because her husband cooks the bread at night, and she always gets up at 4:00 in the morning to make the deliveries. In spite of this, she knows that the business is profitable, because everyone needs bread, and it always sells. In the future, Lilia and her husband hope to increase their production and expand their market. This is the first time she has asked for a loan with MFP, and the first time that she participates in a group that is currently forming in the communal bank. She was invited to join when the group was already formed, and she has promised to be an active member. The money that she is requesting is to buy sacks of flour and butter at wholesale, to be able to stock up on this produects and avoid losses in case prices rise.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of flour

loans.name: Uli

texts.en: Uli T., 39, is a widow with 5 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the general store business. She sells to the general public 7 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about US $104).  SPBD loans are Uli’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her general store

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es: La Señora Sofía Esperanza S. T. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Sofía tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica de Doña Sofía es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que la ubicación es en su casa de habitación. Doña Sofía ha recibido varios prestamos Fundación León 2000, y esto le ha ayudado a invertir cada día en su negocio. Por lo que sus propósitos son de mantener activo este negocio para que el día de mañana pueda generarle los ingresos necesarios. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo incrementando sus productos como gaseosas, refrescos naturales, pan, golosinas, granos básicos y otros productos de consumo en general. El sueño de Sofía es darle las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda ya que se acerca el invierno y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
Señora Sofía Esperanza S. T. is 47 years of age and single. She has one son who is still in school. Doña Sofía's business is a local store which is located in the house where she lives. She has been running it for more than five years. Doñia Sofía has received several loans from Fundación Leon 2000 and this has helped her to invest in her business every day. Her goal is to keep this business operating so that in the future it can bring her a sufficient income. That's why she is requesting financing for the working capital to stock up on products such as carbonated drinks, natural soft drinks, bread, sweets, basic cereals and other products for general consumption. Sofía's dream is to make some necessary improvements to her house, now that winter is coming, and she wants to be prepared

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Aisha K. from Mbeya. She is single with two children aged 6 and 10. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Aisha has been running a grocery business since 2006. A grocery store is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to, to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient. Aisha works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Aisha currently earns about $80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase various items for her grocery store. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Aisha thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase various items for her grocery store

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Chun S. is 49 years old and lives with one of her children in Phnom Penh city. She rents the rooms in her house to earn a living and is able to make US$3 per day. She is also aided by her daughter who works in a garment factory.

Chun S. is asking for a loan to repair rooms so that she can increase the renting price.

loans.use: To repair rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: add to her inventory

loans.name: Kamarniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Камарнисо женщина - 40 лет. Замужем имеет 3-х детей.Она занимается продажей женской одежды. Она торгует в Торговом Центре "Бадри Мунир" находящийся в районе "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда.В пятницу она выходит на рынок "Джума-базар", а в воскресенье на рынок "Якшанбе-базар". Камарнисо закупает товар в городе Бишкек  Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром 2 раз в месяц.Камарнисо уже 4 года кредитуется у нас.Когда она начинала у нее было маленькое количество товара. но сейчас Камарнисо расширилась и за свой последний кредит, она закупило партию женских костюмов.
texts.en:
Kamarniso is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. She sells women’s clothing at the Badri Munir Shopping Center, located in the Panchshanbe district of Khujand. She goes to the Djuma-bazar on Fridays and to the Yakshanbe-bazar on Sundays. Kamarniso buys her merchandise in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyzstan Republic. She travels there twice per month. Kamarniso has been our client for 4 years. When she first started, she had a small quantity of merchandise, but now Kamarniso expanded and bought a stock of women’s suits with her last loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny es una joven de 22 años muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Rodolfo de 20 años y su Hija Jennifer de 5 años, a quien desea brindar un buen futuro. Su negocio se encuentra en Ananea (distrito de Juliaca), tiene una tienda donde vende muñecos de peluche, los cuales consigue en el mercado San José (mercado de Juliaca), su negocio es muy concurrido y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa amistosa. Ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes y los aconseja sobre cual es el muñeco más bonito para que se lo lleven, tiene 2 años con este negocio y le está yendo muy bien, aunque todavía no se siente realizada. Ella considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es soportar el intenso frió que hace en Ananea, ya que está muy cerca de la cordillera. Para un futuro cercano desea tener una tienda más grande donde pueda atender con mayor tranquilidad a sus clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con sus cuotas y espera poder hacerlo, además que no desea traerle problemas a su banco comunal, donde ha sido bien recibida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más muñecos de peluche para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en stock.
texts.en:
Yeny is a very happy 22-year-old woman. She lives in her parents' house along with her husband, Rodolfo, who is 20. Her daughter Jennifer is 5-years-old, and Yeny wants to give her a good future. Her business is located in Ananea (in the district of Juliaca). She sells stuffed animals, which she obtains in the San José market in Juliaca. Her business is very frequented and she always greets her customers with a friendly smile. She enjoys chatting with her customers and advising them about the loveliest stuffed animal to buy. She has had this business for 2 years, and it is going very well for her, but she still doesn't feel accomplished. She thinks the most difficult part of her job is tolerating the intense cold in Ananea since it is very close to the mountains. In the near future, she wants to have a bigger store where she can attend to her clients more peacefully. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she knows that she has to meet her payments and she hopes to be able to do this. She also doesn't want to cause any problems for her communal bank, where she has been well-received. With the 1,000 PEN she is requesting, she will buy more stuffed animals to increase the quantity of merchandise she has in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
La señora Paquita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 69 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, que ya son independientes. 

Motivada por su experiencia en la crianza D. gallinas se amino a convertir esto en un negocio, en inicio en muy pequeña escala invirtió los  S/. 300.00 D. crédito que recibió, obteniendo muy buenos resultados por lo que continúa con este negocio hasta la actualidad, en su propia casa.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 comprará gallinas ponedoras D. huevos, vitaminas, alimento balanceados en sacos para mantener las aves sanas y gordas y puedan producir mejor. 

Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Paquita is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes), which is located in the District of Bellavista, Department of San Martín. She is 69 years old, widowed, and the mother of 5 adult children.

Motivated by her experience in raising chickens, she started a small-scale business with the loan of 300 soles that she received. Her home-based business continues to experience good results.

Her new loan of 2000 soles will be used to buy egg-laying hens, vitamins, and sacks of feed so that her birds become plump and healthy so that they can produce more eggs.

She is very happy to be working and receiving the services of Manuela Ramos. She thanks the Institution for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. Sra. Paquita hopes to continue her membership for a long time and help other families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase egg-laying hens, vitamins, and feed

loans.name: Diama

texts.fr: diama T. est parent bénéficiaire depuis 1997.elle géré une boutique depuis cinq ans dans son quartier a camberene.elle sollicite un crédit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour renforcer son fond de roulement pour ainsi accroitre son stock a vendre.ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer activement a l'entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diama T. has been a recipient parent since 1997.  She's been running a store for five years in her district of Camberene.  She's requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for bolstering her working capital and thus for growing her stock of goods to sell.  Her profits allow her to help care actively for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María tiene 39 años de edad, tiene seis hijos y vive junto a su esposo a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo; en Batangrande, distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe.

Hace un año que se dedica a la ganadería junto a su esposo, ellos tienen 4 vacas que producen diariamente 15 litros diarios los que, al igual que todos los ganaderos de la zona, venden a la empresa acopiadora local a 0,92 céntimos el litro, esta empresa los vuelve a vender a una de las principales empresas procesadoras de lácteos del país.

Su esposo se dedica esporádicamente a trabajar como peón agrícola, aunque también siembra maíz chala para alimentar a su ganado, la cantidad de ingresos que perciben no les basta para mantener a su familia y a sus hijos, que aún estudian, por este motivo se encuentran solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensan invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de leche de sus animales así como en la construcción de Bebederos y Comederos que faciliten su alimentación.

María sueña con mejorar gradualmente su ganado, aumentando la producción con una adecuada alimentación y con el mejoramiento genético de la raza, ella también desea mejorar su casa con las ganancias que recaude a futuro y otorgarle a sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar una carrera técnica de corta duración.

Ella es muy querida por sus vecinos quienes la consideran una mujer amable y servicial.
texts.en:
