María is 39 years old, has six children and lives with them and with her husband. They live 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo in Batangrande, in the district of Pítipo and the province of Ferreñafe.

For one year she has worked in cattle farming with her husband. They have four cows that produce 15 liters daily. Like all the other cattle farmers in the region, they sell their milk to the local stocking business for 92 cents a liter. This business in turn sells to one of the principle dairy producers in the country.

Her husband works sporadically as an agricultural laborer. Although she also sows corn husks to feed their livestock, the quantity of income that they receive is not enough to support their family and their children, who are in school. It is for this reason that they are asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that they want to invest in providing a balanced diet for their livestock to increase their production of milk, as well as in the construction of drinking and feeding troughs that facilitate feeding.

María dreams of gradually improving her livestock, increasing their production through an adequate diet and with genetic improvement of the breed. She also hopes to improve her house with the earnings that she collects in the future as well as grant to her children the possibility of studying for a technical degree for limited time. She is very well-liked by her neighbors who consider her a very loving and serving woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide a balanced diet to increase milk production and stable improvements

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun S., age 44 (available in the photo with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Koem Khoem, 43, were married in 1987 and have four daughters. The eldest daughter was married and lives in the family home.  One is a garment factory worker and other two attend school. The family lives along national road number one apporximetely15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Oeun and her husband have been farming for about 20 years. They grow papaya, corn…etc. One of Oeun’s daughters just finished her baccalaureate degree and she wants to continue her studying at University in Phnom Penh, so Oeun is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to pay school fees for her daughter and she will use a part of her loan to farm as well.

loans.use: To pay school fee for her daughter and use for farming.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: C. Charlotte est née le 17 Juillet 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Charlotte réside au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou depuis trente ans. Mariée à SEMILIKO Gérard un chauffeur, Charlotte est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Cependant, Charlotte vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Charlotte a été à l'école jusqu'au secondaire et s'est ensuite mis depuis douze ans dans la vente de divers (papiers mouchoirs, savons, lait, pâte alimentaires, défrisant pour cheveux). Charlotte vend également du pétrole et des boissons locaux appelé Sodabi de façon ambulante. Charlotte fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Charlotte a obtenu auprès de ALIDé deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé. Pour agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et les besoins de sa famille, Charlotte sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Charlotte C. was born on July 17, 1979 in Cotonou, the Capital of Benin. Charlotte has lived in the Cadjehoun quarter of Cotonou for thirty years. Married to Gerard Semiliko, a driver, Charlotte is the mother of three children who have all attended school. She lives alone with her children however, and solely supports the financial needs of the family. Charlotte attended secondary school and for the next 12 years worked at her business selling assorted products (soaps, paper napkins, milk, meat spreads, hair conditioners). She also sells fuel and local drinks called Sodabi by hawking. Charlotte buys her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She has completed and repaid two previous loans with ALIde To increase her business and to better satisfy the needs of both her customers and her family, Charlotte is requesting this third loan from ALIde.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted supplies for resale (meat spreads, preserves, soaps and cans of fuel)

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion Q. is from Valencia City. She is 40 years old, and married with 4 school-age children. To make a living, Concepcion owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of revenue comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Concepcion has owned her shop for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Concepcion joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concepcion is requesting her first loan for 5000 PHP. She will use it to purchase additional products to sell. She will use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Matiya's Group

texts.en: B. Matiya is the leader of his group in Ibanda. He is 36 years old and married with six children who are all in school. He has a retail shop in Omububaare trading centre that has been in operation for fifteen years. At the moment, Matiya is able to make approximately $43 in profits a week, and this enables him to take care of his family. He is a friendly man and determined, and this has enabled him to win more customers. In the future, he would like to turn his shop into a wholesale business, and also to have a happy and educated family. Matiya is seeking a loan to enable him to add more stock in his shop so that he can boost his business further.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more general merchandise.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Mr. Nhem B., 52, is a teacher of English. He teaches at a local public school. He earns a salary of $80 each month, which helps contribute to providing for his family’s daily food. Nhem B. is married to Choup Reum, age 53, who sells a few vegetables to earn some money.

This couple has been married for years and is blessed to have eight children; one is married, and the other seven attend school. Nhem B. is asking for a Kiva loan to add to his small amount of savings in order to buy a new motorbike for his children to ride to school.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike for his children to ride to school

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena sells used clothing in the City of Leon. Her clothing stand is an open-air stall. She started the business 17 years ago using her own savings and it has been located in the same place ever since. She is requesting a loan to invest in working capital for her business. She would like to buy a bale of used clothing to resell in her store. Maria works from 6am to 5pm everyday. She travels to Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, twice a week to purchase merchandise for her store.

Maria is single with two children. Both of her children are school aged. She has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years and this is her 30th loan. Her past loans have helped her gradually expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen M. is 30 years old, single, and has one child. He is a barber by profession but he also owns a motorbike which he uses as a taxi.

This is Stephen’s first loan and he intends to open another barber shop. Stephen’s shop is at Kero-port were his clients are the residents and area commuters.  He has been in this business for six years.  Stephen plans to venture into the transport business in full force and even own a van one day.  He seems determined so we wish him success in all his endeavors.

loans.use: To establish another barber shop.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 23-year-old single woman. In 2006, she decided to open a beauty salon in her town after seeing a need for such a service in the region. This young woman is very talented and caters to a wide range of clientele in the village and its neighborhoods. Today, Fatmeh is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase beauty products and hair accessories in order to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: purchase beauty products and hair accessories

loans.name: Cristo El Salvador Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “CRISTO EL SALVADOR”

La Alcancía Comunal “CRISTO EL SALVADOR” es llamada así porque sus miembros son personas muy católicas y han encontrado un soporte en su religión.
Lucia es una de ellas, ya que tras la pérdida de su esposo quedó viuda a cargo de sus 7 hijos, entonces tuvo que apoyarse en su fe para continuar adelante, y así lo hizo, pudo criar a sus hijos hasta verlos adultos, todo gracias a su trabajo que consistía en lavar ropa y en apoyo que sintió al tener fe en Cristo, pero ahora a sus 65 años Lucia enfrenta otro reto, perdió a 2 de sus hijos dejándola a cargo de sus 3 nietos.
Lucia tenía que trabajar para criar a sus nietos, pero el trabajo de lavar ropa ya no es recomendable para su salud, y entonces gracias a una donación Lucia recibió una carreta ambulante para la venta de dulces, gaseosas, galletas, etc.
Lucia piensa usar el préstamo de EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, para llenar su carreta ambulante de los productos surtidos que necesita para poder obtener dinero y así cumplir su sueño que es el de poder ver a sus nietos grandes y prósperos.
texts.en:
“CRISTO EL SALVADOR” COMMUNAL BANK Christ the Savior communal bank is so-called because its members are devout Catholics, who have found support in their religion. Lucia is one of them because her husband's death left her a widow with 7 children to support. She had to lean on her faith in order to continue on. She did so and was able to raise her children until they became adults. She did all this taking in laundry and trusting in her faith in Christ. But now, at the age of 65, Lucia faces a new challenge: the deaths of two of her children has left her in charge of three grandchildren. Lucia must work to support her grandchildren but taking in laundry is no longer feasable at her age. Thanks to a donation, Lucia received a pushcart that she can use to peddle sweets, soft-drinks, cookies, etc. Lucia plans to use EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD's loan to stock her pushcart with an assortment of products that she can sell to raise money and see her dream of having her grandchildren grown and properous, come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia E. sells Fante kenkey (locally made with corn, commonly found in the central region of Cape Coast) with varieties of sauces and soups in Elmina. She also sells soaps to earn additional income.  Emilia has received no education.  She is married to a carpenter and has five dependents. Emilia has been selling soap and kenkey for sometime now. She supports her husband in the payment of utility bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy corn and other ingredients for the making of the kenkey, and soap. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy corn and other ingredients for the making of the kenkey, and soap

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en:
Roudayna is a 32-year-old married woman. A mother of three young children, she opened a clothes and women’s accessories shop five years ago to help her husband with the family's income and to pay for their children's schooling.

Today, Roudayna is asking for her second loan of $1,800 to buy additionA. merchandise to fill her shop with because it's situated in a busy area. She has been able, over the years, to have a growing number of clients pass by her shop and she needs to be always on top of their requirements.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan is a very active lady. She operates a clothes-selling business in the community. Her clientele base is her neighbors. Once a month she goes to various bazaars of Lahore, especially “Ichra & Azam market,” for purchasing new clothes. Her income allows her to share the financial burden of her husband. Her husband's name is J. M. and he works in a factory at a meager income. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal clothes to expand her clothes-selling business and to fill the orders from her customers.

She has four other ladies in her loan group. Zahida wants a loan to buy items such as cosmetics and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. Parveen wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Another Parveen wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing clothes business. Nazir begum wants a loan to buy a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Adeshola

texts.en:
Adeshola is 35 years old and is a single parent with a child under her care. She is hardworking and has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years.

Adeshola sews clothes for both males and females and even sells tailoring accessories. She has been in this business for ten years. She makes sure her customers’ demands are met while indirectly improving herself financially.

Adeshola is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you and promise to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Moussa Tièdian

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Tièdian Koné est un homme marié de 56 ans qui vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier central  de Kolondièba dans la  troisième région  administrative de la république Mali. 
Moussa Tièdian fait l’achat vente de céréales et de pièces détachées pour motos et vélos depuis maintenant 10 ans. 
Son magasin de pièces détachées, sis au cœur du marché central de Kolondièba est d’accès  facile et très fréquenté. 
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, il adhère au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son quatrième prêt.    
Il  compte acheter une grande quantité de pièces détachées à Bamako. Avec une clientèle constituée de réparateurs de motos et vélos, il vend généralement au comptant et  à détail. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA par mois qui servira à   prendra en charges  les frais scolaire et de santé  au niveau de la famille.
texts.en:
Monsieur Moussa Tièdian Koné is a married man aged 56 ans who lives in a polygamous family in downtown Kolondièba, in Mali's third administrative region. He has been buying and selling cereals, and also motorbike and bicycle parts, for 10 years. His parts store, in the central market of Kolondièba, is easy to get to and very busy. To increase his capital, he belongs to the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. He is currently paying back his fourth loan from the program, He plans to buy a large number of parts in Bamako [Mali's capital]. He usually sells for cash, and at retail, to his customers, who are motorbike and bicycle mechanics. He is predicting income of 50.000 FCFA a month to pay for school fees and family health care.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy motorbike and bicycle parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new computer and other devices for the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a second-hand car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida lives with her husband and six children in Multan, city of sweetmeats and clothes in Pakistan. Her husband is uneducated and works in a factory but his income is not enough to support the whole family. Shahida does embroidery work to help cover the financial expenses of her family.

  
She wants to expand her embroidery business by buying embroidery items (sketches, clothes and beads) in bulk. For that purpose she is applying for a loan. She is very hopeful that she can make her embroidery business more profitable and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items for her embroidery business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with three children who all go to school. She also takes care of her elderly parents. She owns a ladies salon in Nakulabye Kiyaye zone and works on all types of hair styles, like weaving, plaiting, relaxing and cutting. She wants to use this loan to buy more hair conditioners, relaxers and boxes of braids and weaves. She has been in this business for eight years. Her customers are mainly women. She works seven days a week. 

Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation of these boxes from Kikuubo in Kampala city to Nakulabye. Aisha goes shopping  once a week and uses public transport to and from shopping. She is aspiring to own a bridal salon. She joined MCDT to boost her business by getting additional capital. Aisha resides in and rents a two roomed house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of hair relaxers, conditioners, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe BENKADI II  sont  des femmes mariées du village de Tiebele Zanguerekan dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles,  ont en moyenne 30 ans, 6 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les deux prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
TENE D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana ainsi que dans les  marchés  environnants en détail (souvent en gros) au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
TENE D. compte réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de sa production agricole, un bénéfice de 95.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group BENKADI II are married women from the village of Tiebele Zanguerekan, in San prefecture, Segou region, (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and average 30 years of age and six children each. They grow peanuts. Concerned with making their crops profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After having correctly repaid the two previous loans, they are now on their third farm loan. Ms. Tene D. intends to use her loan for buying a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, sundry equipment, and some supplies at the big market of Kimparana city. After the winter, the harvest is stored for a while, so that it gains in value. It is then sold at the big market of Kimparana, as well as at surrounding markets. The produce is sold retail for cash to customers generally from big cities. After selling her produce, Ms. Tene D. plans on making a profit of 95,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan interest and covering normal family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies, seeds, and equipment

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina P. Alcalá es costurera profesión que desempeña por mas de  5 años, cuenta con su taller en su misma vivienda; donde realiza trabajos como Vestidos de novias, Quinceañeras, levantar bastillas, alguna confección en particular depende de lo que desee el cliente. En este momento Ernestina requiere un préstamo para comprar telas ya que viene la temporada escolar  cuando mas requieren de su trabajo y quiere estar preparada por eso pide el apoyo.
texts.en:
Ernestina P. Alcalá has been a professional seamstress for more than 5 years. She relies on her workshop in her home, where she makes clothing such as wedding Dresses, dresses for girl's 15th birthday celebration (Quinceañeras), raising hemlines, and custom tailoring at the request of the client. At this time Ernestina requires a loan to buy fabrics since the school season is approaching when there are more demands for her work. She wants to be prepared, therefore she asks for the support.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothing to sell.

loans.name: Koem Lean

texts.en: Mrs. Koem Lean L. lives in Prey Chheu Teal village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice, which she sells to support her family. She is a widow with two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is employed by a private company. Although she tries to work hard, she earns very little money to support her family. To earn more money, Mrs. Koem Lean L. is applying for a loan to buy two mother pigs for breeding and pig food in order to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy two pigs and pig food

loans.name: José Fanor

texts.es: El Sr. José Fanor H. M. es trabajador activo del Ministerio de la Familia “San Rafael del Sur”   el  se desempeña  como Atención Familiar, tiene  veinte y un año de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo esta solicitando para cambio de techo de unos de los curtos de su casa, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. José Fanor H. M. has been employed by the “San Rafael del Sur” Family Ministry for 21 years in the Attention to Families department. He is married and has a school aged child. He has had 6 loans with CEPRODEL that have been used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. This loan is requested for building materials and supplies to replace the roof on some of the rooms of the house. Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for him in that they have improved his and his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to replace the roof: zinc metal sheeting and tubing, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agricultrice maraîchère, Mme D. Adjo est née en 1970 à Goumoukopé dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et a à sa charge trois (03) enfants. Elle a la double avantage de produire et de commercialiser elle-même ses récoltes. Ce financement est une opportunité qui lui permettra d’accroître sa production agricole par l’achat d’intrants agricoles et l’extension de sa surface cultivable. Cela va sûrement renforcer son niveau de revenu.
texts.en: Agricultrice maraîchère, Mme D. Adjo est née en 1970 à Goumoukopé dans les Lacs. Elle est mariée et a à sa charge trois (03) enfants. Elle a la double avantage de produire et de commercialiser elle-même ses récoltes. Ce financement est une opportunité qui lui permettra d’accroître sa production agricole par l’achat d’intrants agricoles et l’extension de sa surface cultivable. Cela va sûrement renforcer son niveau de revenu.

loans.use: achat d’intrants agricoles et l’extension de sa surface cultivable

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mr. Em O. and his wife (pictured) have been married since 1968 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home, two are garment-factory workers, one is a construction worker and another one attends school. 

Mr. Em O. works in the commune offices. His wife is a tailor. He is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle for his son to ride to school.  

Mr. Em O. was not available for the photo, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his son to ride to school

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La señora María Cañete es la presidenta del comité y se dedica a la venta de ropas, mediante esta actividad ella logra obtener un ingreso para su familia, asi puede brindarle mejores bienestar a su familia.
Ella comenta que el comité que integra es muy unido y todas se ayudan mutuamente y de esa manera salen adelante todas juntas.
Cada integrante retira el crédito para invertir en su actividad o para algunos gastos importante que tienen sus familias.
La señora María solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas, como camisa, remeras, y otras prendas de vestir para contar con variedad de mercaderías.

Ella forma parte de un comité muy unido y cada integrante como ella tiene una actividad independiente que le genere ingreso y lo van mejorando con la ayuda de las capacitaciones y los créditos que recibe de la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Señora María Cañete is the president of the group and makes a living by selling clothing.  Through this activity, she makes an income for her family so she can offer them well-being.

She told us that their group is very united, and they all help each other mutually.  In this way, they all succeed together.  Each member is withdrawing the loan to invest in her business or to help with some important expenses that her family has.

Señora María is requesting a loan to buy clothing like shirts, t-shirts, and other garments so she can have a larger variety of merchandise.

She is a member of a very united group, and each member has an independent business that generates income.  They are improving their group with the help of training courses and the loans that they receive from Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To purchase t-shirts, shirts, dresses, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Maritza De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La señora Maritza G. labora en Uponic se desempeña como Profesora de Enfermería;  es viuda y tiene 4 hijos que ya no dependen de ella ,solicita crédito para compra de materiales de construcción y ampliar su vivienda. Agradece a CEPRODEL por su pronta respuesta y apoyo en la comodidad de mi hogar.
texts.en: Mrs Maritza G. works for UPONIC (Universidad Popular de Nicaragua) as a Nursing Professor.  She is a widow and has 4 children who are no longer dependent on her.  She is requesting this loan to buy building materials and extend her house.  She is grateful to CEPRODEL for their prompt response and support in improving the comfort of her home.

loans.use: Improvements to her home.  Purchase of cement, iron, sand and gravel

loans.name: Reina Alicia

texts.es:
Reina, tiene un negocio de comida, tamales y pupuseria, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas Tatiana de 10 años estudia 4°grado y Diana de 14 años de edad estudia 7° grado en la escuela. Reina tiene ya 8 años de dedicarse al negocio, tiene una prima que  le ayuda a atender a los clientes, también lo hacen sus hijas cuando salen de clases, su horario de atención es de 5:00am a 2:00pm, ella aprendió a cocinar por su madre que se lo enseño perfectamente, este tipo de negocio tiene una desventaja que los productos se dañan si no se consumen luego.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, carnes y bebidas para la preparación de los alimentos que a diario ofrece, este préstamo la ayudara a que en esta temporada de fiestas en el municipio mucha gente visita la feria y ella aprovechara para ofrece más comida.
Los sueños son tener un comedor amplio con capacidad para muchas personas, recibir muchas ganancias para solventar las necesidades del hogar y ayudar a sus hijas en los estudios para que puedan ser unas profesionales.
texts.en:
Reina has a food business selling tamales and “pupusas” (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans).  She lives in San Francisco Gotera in the Morazán department.  She is 41 years old, and she lives with her husband and their two daughters.  Tatiana, age 10, is in fourth grade.  Diana, age 14, is in seventh grade in school. 

Reina has had this business for eight years.  She has a cousin who helps her wait on customers.  Her daughters also help her when they are out of classes.  She tends her business from 5:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m.  She learned to cook from who mother, who taught her perfectly.  This business has the disadvantage in that the products spoil if they are not consumed immediately.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy products like rice, beans, meat, and drinks in order to prepare that food that she sells daily.  This loan will help her in that during the season for parties in the municipality a lot of people go to the fair.  She will take advantage of this and offer more food.

Her dreams are to have an ample eatery with room for a lot of people.  Also, she wants to get a lot of earnings in order to cover the household necessities.  Additionally, she dreams of helping her daughters with their education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, meat, and drinks

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista 1”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 03 años, su   primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y artesanías.  Paralelamente se dedica a tejer prendas que vende en su misma bodega y a sus amistades.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar lanas para sus tejidos, negocio que le permite tener otros ingresos.

Su sueño para el futuro  es progresar como empresaria y hacer crecer su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y las charlas de capacitación.


En la foto se muestra junto a uno de sus hijos
texts.en:
33-year old Lidia is a member of the Bellavista 1 Community Bank located in the province and department of Puno. She and her husband have two children. She completed high school.

Lidia has been working with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan of S/.500 soles was invested in her business--she sells groceries and crafts. She also knits clothes which she sells in her store or to her friends.

Lidia is seeking a new loan of S/.200 soles to buy wool for her knitting so that she can earn more money.

She most enjoys the meetings and the training sessions organized by her Community Bank.

Lidia is shown in the photo with one of her children.

loans.use: to buy wool of different colours

loans.name: Arlen Patricia

texts.es: Arlen Patricia tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Inicio como empleada de una empresa fue con el paso del tiempo que ella decidió hacerse cargo de su propio negocio. el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, ropa y otros productos. Sueña con mejorar su habitación y su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Arlen Patricia is 31 years old. She makes a living selling general merchandise. She has had her business for more than three years. She has one young son under her care. The majority of her customers always request a wide variety of products. Arlen started out working for a company but with the passage of time she decided to start her own business. She is requesting the loan to purchase footwear, cosmetics, clothing and other products. Her dream is to improve her home and her quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jackson Turpesio

texts.en:
Jackson Turpesio, age 27, runs a motorcycle transport business at Bissil, which is a very busy market. He is married to Mary, age 20, and together they have one child, Naserian, age four. Jackson was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Jackson has been running this business for a period of eight years and his monthly profit is Kshs 4,000. This loan of Kshs 15,000 is his first loan from KADET and he intends to use the loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike. If this loan boosts the business, he will buy another motorbike.

Jackson dreams of starting a motorbike transport company, buying many motorbikes and employing many people. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí, de 29 años, vive en casa de su madre con su hijo; juntos se esfuerzan todos los días para salir adelante.Desde hace 4 años, vende cosméticos y prendas de vestir, comercializa de manera ambulante a las personas que conoce y ofrece sus productos al crédito  para después cobrar de acuerdo al tiempo pactado entre sus clientes. La  venta de cosméticos le resulta muy beneficiosa y rentable porque recibe incentivos de la marca y además  puede ofrecer ofertas y promociones  para que sus clientes se mantengan fieles al consumo de sus productos, es por esta razón que desea incrementar su capital de trabajo en cosméticos y prendas de vestir.Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica.Noemí tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de mas mercadería, pues quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Noemí is 29 years old.  She lives in her mother's house with her child.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead in life.

For four years, Noemí has been selling cosmetics and clothes.  She makes her sales door to door and sells to people that she knows.  She offers her products on credit and then collects payments in accordance with the terms she has agreed with her customers.  Her cosmetics sales are very profitable and useful to her because she receives incentives from the brand owners and she can provide her customers with offers and promotions so that they remain loyal to her products.  For this reason, she would like to increase her working capital for her cosmetics and clothes business.

This is Noemí's first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a part of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  Noemí is grateful to the people who will fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  Noemí plans to invest the money she has requested in buying more merchandise since she would like to be able to offer the very best to her customers.  in this way, she hopes to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to improve her business

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is 46 years old.  She is married and supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:   a sewing business, a cloth fabrication business, and a tricycle operator business. She lives in E.B. Magalona, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. 

Lynette is borrowing PHP 15,000 to fund her business operations. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Lynette aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Fernando B. le está haciendo falta pintarla principalmente y desea cambiar la fachada de la misma. Pretende realizar algunos maceteros de concreto algunas molduras que hagan ver una casa más bonita.
En este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar esos cambios a su vivienda, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo.
El planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo de técnico de eléctrico de la comisión de agua potable (municipio), es el ingreso que tiene para su familia, ya que tiene dos hijos adolescentes quienes están estudiando. 
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es su esposa la señora Lucían Martínez ella nos atendió el día que se realizó la visita a la vivienda de la familia B..
Están agradecidos por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual han realizado mejoras a su vivienda ya que son personas mayores de edad y es muy difícil que les otorguen préstamos.
texts.en:
The home of Mr. Fernando Baez is principally lacking paint and he would like to change the façade. He is trying to make some concrete pots to trim the yard so that the house has a nicer appearance. Currently, he does not have the money necessary to make such changes to his home and this is why he is requesting the loan. 

He plans to repay the loan with the income from his job as an electrical technician where he works for the municipal water commission. This is the income that he has for his family because he has two teenage children who are still in school. 

The person in the photograph is his wife, Lucia Martinez. She served us the day of our visit to the Baez family home. 

They are grateful for the cooperation in the previous loan, which they used to make improvements to their home, because they are elderly and find it difficult to obtain credit.

loans.use: to finish the roof and repair the exterior of the house.

loans.name: 'good Guys' Group

texts.en:
Lawrence G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Good Guys'.  He is 31 years old, married, and has two children between the ages of 3 and 7 years old. He also cares for two siblings. Lawrence is a high school graduate. 

Lawrence has been operating a foreign exchange bureau on Mechlin Street, in Monrovia, Liberia for 7 years. He plans to use his 20,000 LRD portion of this 60,000 LRD group loan to add more money to his business. Lawrence describes himself as a peace-loving man whose goals are to expand his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: to add more money to his business

loans.name: Min's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen members who will use their portions to support different purposes. Mrs. Min, born in 1962, was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Min and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice for a living. With their farming, they still do not earn enough income to support their family. In order to improve their family’s condition, Mrs. Min would like to ask for a loan to buy chickens for breeding. The couple has seven children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and the other five are students who also help their parents with farming.

loans.use: To buy chickens for breeding

loans.name: Nuevo Diamante 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Evelis is the coordinator of the group Nuevo Diamante (New Diamond) 1 & 2. Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom have recently immigrated to the Dominican Republic) and Dominican clients. The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town north of Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and three children.

Evelis has come to Esperanza with the goal of growing her business but, also, because it is a way of development for the community. She is not only interested in the money; she cares about the community. She operates a business where she sells household and beauty products. She is associated to a franchise. She sells those products and motivates others to join and go forward. 

With this loan she intends to increase her inventory. She believes that this will allow her to supply more clients (other businesses, households and salons) and to distinguish herself by always having what is needed in stock, while providing high quality products. She will use the profits to save and to address some needs in her family. In the long term she would like to continue growing her business with Esperanza to the point where she can sell more products, reach more clients, motivate others and eventually have enough profits to purchase her own home and to continuing helping her children. She especially wants to pay for their studies. Thank you so much for your support!

loans.use: to buy household products

loans.name: Fuerza Trabajadora (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fuerza Trabajadora esta conformado por 9 mujeres y un hombre que trabajan en diferentes actividades como el comercio, la agricultura, cría de animales, etc. y esto les ha permitido mejorar la economía de sus hogares, son personas emprendedoras y siempre ven la vida de una manera positiva.  Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad  más importante  del país, Cuenca tiene muchos lugares turísticos en donde se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza.

La Señora. Nora S. vive por el sector de Todos Santos en la ciudad de Cuenca. Tiene 33 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 13 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio, su segunda hija en una escuelita de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo está en el pre kínder. Su esposo labora como mesero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Nora vende comida rápida (hot dogs, hamburgesas, papas fritas, etc.), se dedica a esta actividad hace 4 años y labora de lunes a sábados solo por las tardes. También vende cosméticos de la marca Yanbal hace 5 años,en esta actividad no tiene ni día ni horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana quien es socia activa del mismo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y productos para su negocio de comida rápida como: pan, carne, salchichas, papas, colas, etc.

Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Fuerza Trabajadora” (Workforce) consists of nine women and one man who work in different activities such as trade, agriculture, livestock breeding, and other businesses that enable them to improve their household finances. The members are enterprising individuals who always approach life in a positive manner. They live in Cuenca, the third largest city in Ecuador. Cuenca has many tourist attractions where its natural beauty can be admired.

Sra. Nora S. lives in the District of Todos Santos in the city of Cuenca. She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 14, 13, and 4). The first child is in high school, the second child attends a school in the city, and the last child is in pre-kindergarten. Her husband works as a waiter. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Nora sells fast food such as hot dogs, hamburgers, fries, and other items. She has been in this business for four years and works Monday through Saturday, but only in the afternoons. Nora has also been selling cosmetics from the Yanbal line for five years. In her cosmetics business, she does not have specific days or an established schedule by which she works.

This is the first loan she is receiving from the Communal Bank after being invited by her sister, who is also an active member. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics and supplies for her fast food business such as bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, sodas, and other items.

Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and supplies for a fast food business such as bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, sodas, and other items.

loans.name: Vahram

texts.en:
Vahran A. is from the village of Haykavan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is married, with two sons (five and sixteen years old).  Vahran is a trained auto mechanic and has been working on the family farm for the past thirty years.  He considers himself to be a hard-working professional farmer.  He would like a loan to purchase potato seeds, barley seeds and fuel for this year’s growing season.  Vahram expects this investment to increase the family income by twenty percent.  He dreams of saving enough money to finish the construction of the family home and provide university education for his children.  

Vahram was born in Haykavan and is surrounded by close friends and relatives.  The village is well irrigated to support agriculture activities.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, barley seeds and fuel

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Growth is very important in life, as it indicates progress and not subtle death. Apolonia D., 42, believes in this and incorporates it in her beliefs, business, and lifestyle. Apolonia finished a degree in AB Library Science in college, and is married to Nelson, a driver. She is also an active community partner of CCT*. Two children were born into their family, one is studying in elementary school and one who is not yet of school age. Their family resides in Munting Ilog, Silang, Cavite.

At present, Apolonia is focusing on growing her businesses— a public transportation business and an agricultural garden grown for profit. Each day her husband goes out to provide transportation services to people in their community. The fruits, vegetables, and ornamental plants being grown in her agricultural garden are being sold in the market for profit. Apolonia has been doing this for ten years now. Every month, her perseverance yields her an average of Php11,900.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Apolonia is requesting a loan of 19,000 PHP.  She believes that this is one step to take in order for her to grow her business. She sees applying for this loan as a great help to her. With the loan money on hand, she intends to buy essential materials for her jeepney transport business. She will purchase wheels and other spare parts for the improvement and maintenance of the vehicle. Apolonia sees this loan as a great opportunity for growth, and she prays that the Lord will continually bless those people whom He uses to bless her and her family.

It becomes a real challenge to Apolonia whenever the jeepney goes under repair, since it is one of their main source of business income. But she refuses to back down and finds ways to solve the dilemma. Apolonia believes that soon, her business will grow, even the agricultural garden she grows for additional profit. Above everything else, she prays that her children will grow to become successful in completing their education. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy parts to maintain her jeepney vehicle

loans.name: Ma

texts.en:
Mrs. Ma is married with a school-aged child. She lives in the Siem Reap province. To make a living, Mrs. Ma sells wares such as soft drinks, candy, snacks, and cooking supplies, along the street. To help meet the family’s living expenses, her husband works as a local farmer and earns approximately 3 USD a day. The couple shares the responsibility to provide for the family.

Some of Mrs. Ma’s stall items have been exhausted and she would like to replace them. She is requesting a loan to buy additional inventory and continue selling her wares.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory

loans.name: Joba Ysabel

texts.es:
Joba de 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, contando con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece a la provincia de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Joba es a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas en su domicilio desde hace algunos años, al encontrarse su negocio en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora y así pueda obtener más ingresos para su casa.  También cría aves de corral que una vez alcancen su desarrollo ideal los vende y es otro ingreso para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

El crédito solicitado por a Edpyme Alternativa es de 500 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos una vez que sus ventas aumenten, podrá pagar su préstamo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.   El deseo de Joba es tener más adelante una tienda grande y surtida que le genere mayores ingresos para brindarle a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas.
texts.en:
Joba, 29, lives with her husband and two children in her own house, which only has electricity.  It is located in the district of Tambogrande which belongs to the province of Piura.  This area is mainly involved in agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

For a few years, Joba has been selling groceries and beverages out of her home, which means she can attend to customers at any hour of the day. This provides her with another income to help cover household expenses.

With the loan of 500 PEN requested through Edpyme Alternativa, she plans to buy more merchandise and expand her business with other products.  Once sales increase she can pay back the loan and give her family a better lifestyle.  In the future she would like to have a larger store with a wider array of products.  This would increase her income so she can give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 28 years old, married to Francis and supports a family of five. She has had a farming business for the last five years, with a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Servicing her third loan of 24,000 KES from KADET, she plans to purchase wheat seeds and get fertilizers for her farm. This will help boost her production, hence increasing her yields.

In future, she intends to invest more in farming and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 50 years old and married with two children. To earn a living, she works in tailoring. She has been operating this business for over ten years. She has sustained her business because of the financial support from Kiva's partner, Faulu Kenya.  Besides this, she also does farming to earn extra income.  She was previously selling cereals. Lucy hopes to expand her business in five years and employ many people. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more fabric.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Angel de 42 años de edad, esta casado hace 21 años con la señora Eliodora de 46 años de edad; y tienen tres hijas, una de 20, la otra de 12 y 9 años, la mayor se encuentra trabajando en el exterior y las otras estan cursando el 7mo. Y 4to grado.
El Sr. Angel se dedica al transporte de pasajero desde el año 2004, desde joven contaba con vehiculo de carga que utilizaba para transportes en general, ya sea de verduras, frutas y servicios, de fletes, como este trabajo es muy cansador por el trayecto largo que tenia que realizar, cambió su vehículo e hizo trabajar como colectivo interno de la ciudad de Caaguazu, donde el trabajo se volvió menos agotador.
El cliente solicita este préstamo para la compra de cubiertas nuevas y con lo que podrá ofrecerle seguridad a los pasajeros.
texts.en:
Sr. Angel is 42 years old and has been married for 21 years to Sra. Eliodora, age 46. They have three daughters (ages 20, 12, and 9). The eldest daughter is working abroad and the other two are in the 7th and 4th grades respectively.

Sr. Angel has been transporting passengers since 2004. As a young man, he obtained a vehicle for general transportation, whether it was carrying vegetables, fruit, people, or freight. Making repeated long trips was very tiring, so he replaced his vehicle and started working as part of a collective within the city of Caaguazu, which is less stressful.

Angel is requesting this loan in order to buy new tires, which will provide safety for his passengers.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Revendeur  de lits, de meubles et divers, Kodjo est âgé de 51ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et à sept enfants.
Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2001 et se bat du meilleur qu’il peut pour assurer une  bonne éducation à  ses enfants.
 Il s’approvisionne  à Lomé et revend au marché noir d’Akodessewa.il est à son premier crédit dans notre institution.
texts.en:
Kodjo sells beds and various types of furniture.  He is 51 years old.  He is married to a saleswoman and has seven children.  
He started this business in 2001 and has done the best he can to provide a good education for his children. 
He gets his supplies in Lomé and resells them on the black market in Akodessewa. He is on his first loan with our institution.

Revendeur  de lits, de meubles et divers, Kodjo est âgé de 51ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et à sept enfants.
Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2001 et se bat du meilleur qu’il peut pour assurer une  bonne éducation à  ses enfants.
 Il s’approvisionne  à Lomé et revend au marché noir d’Akodessewa.il est à son premier crédit dans notre institution.

loans.use: to buy furniture and beds for resale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rosario has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks for her store.

Rosario is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rosario hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks.

loans.name: Mamadou Lamine

texts.fr:
Mamadou Lamine est  un homme  âge de 25ans. Il est marié.  Ils n’ont pas encore d’enfant.
Mamadou Lamine a travaillé comme Pâtisserie depuis 2001. Il fait la pâtisserie pour les clients d’un grand hotel. Depuis un an il a ouvert son propre pâtisserie ou il cuisine les gâteaux et les pizzas pour les gens de sa localité. Il travaille avec 3 employés. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est d’équipé sa cuisine.
Mamadou Lamine a requis son 1er crédit de UIMCEC afin d’acheter l’ équipement cuisinier et la matière 1ere en grande quantité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Mamadou Lamine voudrait bien établir le réputation de son restaurant. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit agrandir sa pâtisserie.
texts.en:
Mamadou Lamine is a 25-year old man, who is married but does not yet have any children. He has worked as a pastry chef since 2001 and bakes for the customers of a large hotel. He opened his own patisserie a year ago and makes cakes and pizzas for the people in his town. He works with three employees. His main problem at the moment is to fit out his kitchen.

Mamadou Lamine has requested his first loan from UIMCEC in order to buy kitchen equipment and raw materials in large quantities. In the coming years he would like to be able to build up his restaurant's reputation. He says that he is planning to extend his patisserie with the profits.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment for his patisserie

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 55-year-old married woman who has sold socks as wholesale and retail since 1990.

Amira helps her husband in making their living, she works hard on improving their situation as much as she can.

She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her capital with new socks collection with good prices, highly requested by parents for the school season, She has been an Al Majmoua borrower for nine cycles, with a perfect paying back history. All of her previous loans helped a lot in improving her business and her social and financial situations.

Amira hopes to expand her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new socks collection to sell for the back-to-school season

loans.name: C9239 Huguka Ukore Group

texts.en:
Ereda is the leader of a group called “Haguruka Ukore”, which has a total of six members, each with a different business. Ereda owns a small general store which sells different kinds of fruits.  Ereda is 40 years old and is married, with three children between 8 and 12 years old. Her business is open from 8am until 6pm every day, including weekends. This is a successful year in her business.  Ereda is the first person on the left side. Ereda and her group have requested the loan in order to purchase more products such as passion fruit, pineapples,apples, and so on. 
Ereda and her group have many plans for the profits that they hope to earn from this loan. They would like to provide food for their families, pay school fees for their children, renovate their houses, as well as purchase more stock for their store.

loans.use: To increase her business by buying more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Luz has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Luz has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: El señor Fidel es sastre y confecciona trajes para varón. El crédito lo requiere para el comprar materia prima como ser: telas, hilos, forros, botones y demás insumos requeridos para su especialidad. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani en la Ciudad de La Paz; Fidel es casado y tiene dos hijos. Fidel se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que obtuvo anteriormente pues le ayudaron a mejorar la situación económica de su familia. También es cliente antiguo de Kiva, pues esta es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva, y la sexta a través de Impro.
texts.en:
Sr. Fidel is a tailor who makes men’s suits. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials such as thread, fabric, lining, buttons, and other supplies that are required for his specialty. He lives in his own home in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. Fidel is married and has two children.

He is very pleased with the loans he received previously because they have helped to improve his family’s financial situation. Fidel is also a long-time client who has appeared on Kiva. This is the third time he has a requested a loan through Kiva, but it is his sixth loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, lining, buttons, and other supplies for making men's suits.

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en: Janjay  is 26 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is  single and she is a college student. She has an eight-year-old  child that is in school and lives at home. For the past  two years she has been selling clothes in the local market. She likes her business because she sells quality and very expensive clothes  and has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes  for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes  for her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari sari store in the Philippines. She also earns money from food vending.  She has been in business for 10 years.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari sari store.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Aliou  a 40 ans, marié et père de six enfants. Il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou II dans la ville de Sikasso.
Aliou n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études, s’est vite initié au domaine  de la tôlerie avec la réparation des voitures accidentées et la confection des carrosseries, il y a de  cela cinq  ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses prestations.
Dans le souci de mieux progresser son activité afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida  de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y environ une année. Après plusieurs dépôts d’épargne volontaire, il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter,  5 feuilles de tôle 6,  5 feuilles de tôle 10, et 3 feuilles de tôle 20 . Il achète ces matériels en Côte d’Ivoire avant de les utiliser dans son atelier. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Aliou is 40 years old, married and the father of 6 children. He lives with his wife and children in a traditional, extended family setting in the popular district of Sanoubougou II, in the town Sikasso. Aliou was unable to continue with his education but quickly found himself work as a sheet metal worker. He has been repairing cars and making car bodies for 5 years, and is much in demand due to the high quality of his work.

Wishing to develop his business and satisfy his growing customer demand, Aliou joined the microfinance instutition Soro Yiriwaso a year ago. Having made several voluntary savings deposits, he is now requesting his first individual loan. He will use the money to buy 5 sheets of metal (size 6), 5 sheets of metal (size 10) and 3 sheets of metal (size 20). He gets the materials that he uses in his workshop from the Ivory Coast.

Aliou predicts an average monthly profit of 100 000 francs, which he will use to pay the household expenses, pay off the interest on his loan and build up his working capital.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is a 38-year-old married woman, mother of three children. Christian opened a grocery store in 2008, in order to help her husband in their living, and to start a career that might develop in time.

Christian is a hard working woman, she is well known in the region with a good reputation, in addition to the hard work she puts and the effort she makes to develop herself and her family's situation. 

Christian never stops future plans, she is working hard to provide her family with the best living, and that's why she applied for a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua, in order to start a new business that can help in her development.

Christian will open a speciA. reA. estate office.  She will start this kind of business because she is well-known and most of her customers support her to do so because of her excellent communication network.

loans.use: to start a new business in real estate.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BADEYA sont en majorité des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39  ans et en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygamiques à Ouayerma II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur douzième  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
ALIMA, à droite de la photo, fait la vente de condiments, il y’a environ 7 ans et jouis d’une très grande notoriété dans cette activité.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  8 sacs d’oignons, deux paniers de piments frais, 1 sac de piments séché, 5 paniers de des choux, 5 sacs de sel de cuisine, 4 cartons de cube maggie. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et au grand marché de Sikasso.
Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the BADEYA group are in the majority married women with an average age of 39 years and 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Ouayerma II, one of the working class neighbourhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).
This is their twelfth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in the interests of satisfying their customers.
Alima, on the right in the photo, has been selling condiments for about 7 years and has a solid reputation in this business.
She plans to purchase 8 bags of onions, two baskets of fresh peppers, 1 bag of dried peppers, 5 baskets of cabbages, 5 bags of table salt and 4 cartons of maggi cubes. She buys her stock in the local villages and at the big market in Sikasso.
She sells her wares with her family at the big market in Sikasso town to a clientele of men and women who pay cash for retail purchase.
She aims to make an average monthly profit of 42.500FCFA some  of which will be used to repay the loan and the interests and some for savings.
Her ambition is to increase her sales to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy seasoning.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
To overcome poverty, Renalyn owns and manages a general store in her village, while her husband manages their rice farming business. They endure the hardships and difficulties they encounter in life because they want to educate their two children and give them a bright future. With her husband, they have planned to improve their sources of income so that they can satisfy their needs and support the education of their children.

To work out their plan, Renaly is requesting for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, oils, sugar and soaps to sell in her store. Through this loan, she believes that she make improvements in her business and hoping that she will be successful in carrying them out.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, oils, sugar and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Maurecia

texts.en:
Maurecia, 46, is married and has three children, two of them in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maurecia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Maurecia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

In the future, Maurecia would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 28 years old, married, and blessed with a two-year-old child. To earn a living, she runs a salon. She has been in the business for ten years and has employed one person. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. Lucy hopes to open a big salon in the future. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shampoo.

loans.use: To buy shampoo for her salon.

loans.name: Ayedah

texts.en: Ayedah is a 33 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Al Zarqa Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements,she wants to expand her home also she would like to increase her family social economic status.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 60 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ella es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos que ya son mayores, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente María no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayuda a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Locro para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace varios años María trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de leche, ella cuenta con un pequeño establo de vacas, las cuales cría para poder ordeñar y obtener la leche para su venta, María trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de maderos, alambres, fierros y otros materiales, para poder hacer la ampliación y un cercado más alto de su establo; de esta manera María seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is a 60-year-old woman and she lives in the city of Nazca.  She is a single mother and has three adult children.  She loves them dearly and they are the central focus in her life.  She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic woman that has put all of her efforts toward helping her family get ahead. Unfortunately, María was unable to complete elementary school because at an early age she had to work in order to help her parents with the household expenses.  In her free moments she likes to listen to music and sometimes she cooks a delicious Locro (a thick stew) to share with her family.

By her own initiative, and with a lot of struggle and dedication, María has run her own business of selling milk for many years.  She began with a small stable of cows that she bred so that she could obtain their milk and sell it.  María begins work in the early-morning hours and works for about 12 hours per day.  She feels lucky to have this work and believes that it has gone well due to her experience and because of the friendly service that she gives her customers.

María is very thankful for the Kiva loans and gives thanks for the help that they have brought her. With this loan she will buy wood, wire, iron, and other materials so that she can extend her stable and make a higher fence.  By doing this María will be able to continue working and striving to achieve her biggest dream: to complete the construction of her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Damazo

texts.en:
Damazo is 33 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is Married  and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Damazo has been working hard to manage his clinic, which sells drugs. 

To help expand his business, Damazo has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for his business, and will help Damazo to generate greater profits and to expand on the business. Damazo hopes that in the future he will be able to to expand more on the business. 

Damazo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Damazo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for his business

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey lives in Khnkoyan village with his mother. His mother teaches at a local village school and Sergey himself has been running the farm. Over 10 years of hard work, Sergey was able to build a successful farm with some stable income. Specifically, he keeps cows, calves, oxen and chickens, as well as cultivating potatoes.

Sergey feels very responsible to gather a good income and provide better living conditions for his mother. He has now applied for this loan to purchase six calves and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will greatly assist Sergey to improve his farm, and he will wait for lenders' support.

Sergey has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that his farm is successful and that he is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Sergey has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for six calves and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Jesus De Nazaret Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal JESUS DE NAZARET, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Carmen Rosa  tiene 18 años, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la venta de frutas como platanos, naranjas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de  esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de plátanos, manzanas entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde  a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

loans.use: para la compra de plátanos, manzanas entre otros.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos makes furniture in a shop that he runs out of his home. He started off as an assistant for another furniture maker and learned the trade quickly. With the help of his father and with the money he saved from his job he decided to open up his own business. He rented a location where he could work and sell and he also invested in a couple of tools necessary. He soon realized that the costs of renting were too much and he moved the business into his home.

He is seeking this loan specifically to buy the tools necessary to work more efficiently and make better products. Currently he rents most of the machinery necessary for the work which is getting expensive and inefficient. This business provides for him, his wife and his three children. He uses his earnings to put his kids through school and dreams of them having college degrees.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy tools for his furniture making operation

loans.name: Lanuola

texts.en:
Elei printing is very popular both locally and even overseas. Lanuola makes elei prints at home and delivers them to local flea markets, as well as selling them to tourists and even Samoans residing in foreign lands. 

Strong family support is always behind this business success as the husband is the designer and the children are the sellers.

Normal weekly profit is about 200 tala, but is higher during holiday seasons as elei make good gifts and are used for outfits at holiday parties and functions.

Lanuola is applying for a loan of $1,200 from SPBDF to purchase additional materials.

loans.use: To purchase Paint, screen, design, Material, upeti, etc. (HI) sand, cement, European timber,

loans.name: Afghan Gul

texts.en: Afghan Gul lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an uneducated widow and she is a traditional embroiderer. She wants to expand her business. She took her 4th cycle group loan and opened a shop and makes a good income for her family. Now she wants to take anther loan to buy new machines and change the design of her shop to attract more clients. She wants to help her family and enter her children in school to study. She and all members of her family are very happy with this business.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Gul Bahar

texts.en: Gul Bahar lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow, and she lives with her children. Her craft is traditional weaving. She is working with her children in her home. She took her 3rd cycle group loan and bought new weaving machines. She made a good income and enrolled her children in better education centers. Now she wants to take anther loan to complete the purchase of her necessary materials and continue her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials

loans.name: Odia

texts.en: "Rental and sales of VCD plates is a very good business if you invest in the business," says Mr. Odia A.. An Edo man by tribe, he owns a shop and hopes to expand his business by buying more VCD plates for sale and rental, if the loan of US$475 is given to him. He is 35 years old, and has been in this business since 2003.

loans.use: To buy more VCD plates for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify and increase his product offerings

loans.name: Sabrohon

texts.ru:
Sabrohon, 57, is married and has 5 children. In spite of her age, Sabrohon actively engaged in business to help provide for her family.
