At present, Sabrohon, with the help of her daughter and granddaughter, raises cattle. Sabrohon has been a MicroInvest client for 1.5 years. She asks for this loan to finance a purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Sabrohon 57 лет. Она замужем и у нее 5 детей. Она старается, несмотря на возраст заняться предпринимательской деятельностью, чтобы получить доход для своей семьи. На данный момент она занимается животноводством – откормом скота. В этом ей помогают ее дочь и внуки. С Микроинвест она сотрудничает уже 1,5 года. новый займ она просит для закупки корма для скота.

loans.use: To purchase food for cattle

loans.name: Nurani

texts.en: Nurani is a 44-year-old woman who owns a small shop which sells snacks, crispy chips, cigarettes, etc. Since Nurani joined MBK, her business has been growing very fast, and she has been able to earn US$4.7 per day. Her husband A. has no regular job. Nurani is asking for a loan to buy more inventory for her shop. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for a shop

loans.name: Kireka A3(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Rose Mary B.. She runs a retail store and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to increase her stock. Rose is 49 years old and married to a doctor. She has 6 children ranging in age from 24 to 37 and her children go to school. Each week, Rose makes approximately UGX 80,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start another business Rose has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 to invest in business and paid back the loan on time.

Rose is joined in her small group by Margret N., Gladys Nakkazi, Rose N., and Hanifah Z.. Margret N. rears poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to construct another poultry house. Gladys Nakkazi sells used clothing and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to add stock. Rose N. is currently sells milk and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more milk cans. Hanifah Z. runs a restaurant and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to purchase more foodstuffs.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her retail shop

loans.name: Nsumbi B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Prossy N.. She is currently in the business of running a salon and is requesting a loan to purchase a generator. Prossy is 27 years old and is single. Each week, Prossy makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a hair steamer. Prossy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy chemicals and cosmetics and the loan was paid back on time.

Prossy is joined in her small group by Juliet N., Barbara M., Jamilah M., and Afuwa N.. Juliet N. has a business operating a restaurant and wants to buy more food. Barbara M. is currently operating a business in poultry keeping and wants a loan to renovate her chicken houses. Jamilah M. operates a business in poultry farming and wants to buy broiler chicks. Afuwa N. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to add to her business.

loans.use: To add capital to salon business and boost it

loans.name: Yolanda  Maribel

texts.es:
Mrs M. started making floral arrangements since a very early age. It is a work that inspires her and moreover, she has enough time to take care of her business and of her children.

She started with a small investment and until now she has been able to supply her shop with the best materials to create the floral arrangements that her customers like.

Her sister also works with her; she drives to the city, where a big part of her clients are located, in order to deliver the floral arrangements.

Yolanda Maribel lives with her 2 sons and she sustains them with the income she gets from her flower shop.

She now requests a loan to buy supplies as artificial flowers, vases, flowerpots, sponge, etc to create her floral arrangements.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra M., comenzó aprendiendo su oficio D. la Floristería a temprana edad, es algo que la inspira y le da el tiempo necesario para atender su negocio y poder estar pendientes D. las necesidades D. sus hijos, inicio invirtiendo poco en la elaboración D. flores hasta la fecha a podido surtir su negocio con materias primas óptimas para la elaboración D. los arreglos florales mas buscados ,en el negocio colabora su hermana que se dedica a llevar los arreglos florales a la zona metropolitana ya que parte D. su cartera D. clientes esta ubicada en ese sector.

Su grupo familiar esta compuesto por dos hijos D. la solicitante que viven actualmente en su vivienda y que ella sostiene con sus ingresos ella actualmente esta solicitando el crédito ya que tendrá que hacer una fuerte inversión en la compra D. materia prima para la elaboración D. flores.

loans.use: To buy supplies as artificial flowers, flowerpots, vases, sponge, etc to create her floral arrangements

loans.name: Janeth's Mji Mwema Group

texts.en:
Janeth is 40 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, aged 21,17 and 14 years old. Janeth owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 10am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

In the past, Janeth has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwajumbe and Benadetha, who have businesses dealing in soap sales and a cafe.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
Kelly has worked in her salon for 10 years, but for two she has been dedicated, along with her husband, to the buying and selling of steel. Likewise, her husband manufactures furniture and surgical materials, that have this metal as a raw material, in a small workshop located in his house. They sell furniture, like refrigerators, showcases, etc. to the public in general.

The loans that she has received have served to invest in the purchase of steel.

Kelly would like to have a larger workshop equipped with industrial machines, since now she relies only on small machines. Kelly would not hesitate to close the salon if with that she could expand her steel furniture business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Kelly atiende en su peluquería desde hace 10 años, pero desde hace dos se dedica, junto con su esposo, a la compra y venta de acero. Asimismo, su esposo manufactura muebles y material quirúrgico que tienen como materia prima este metal en un pequeño taller ubicado en su casa. Ellos venden muebles, como refrigeradoras, escaparates, etc. al público en general.

Los préstamos que ha recibido han servido para invertir en la compra de acero.

A Kelly le gustaría tener un taller más grande equipado con maquinarias industriales, ya que ahora solo cuenta con máquinas pequeñas. Kelly no dudaría en cerrar la peluquería si con eso puede ampliar su negocio de muebles de acero.

loans.use: To buy more steel for making furniture.

loans.name: Toeun

texts.en:
Mr. Toeun H. runs a farm in Prey Chum Village in Kampong Speu Province with his wife, Mrs. Heng Nean. Aside from this business activity, he also collects palm juice to produce palm sugar. His rice plantation now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy a cow to add to an old cow to use as draft animals.

Mr. Toeun H. is 25 years old and is the father of three children, one of whom is attending school, while the other two are staying at home because they are too young to work or study. Previously, Mr. Toeun H. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers to support his field. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to an old cow to use as draft animals.

loans.name: Saira Elizabeth

texts.es:
Saira is a young 22-year old mother who cares for her 2-year old daughter. She is her child’s only means of support. She dedicates herself to selling merchandise such as decorations and jewelry, an activity she carried out even before her daughter was born. She is very grateful to her mother, who taught her from a young age the art of sales. She markets her wares as a traveling saleswoman, particularly at schools. Previously, she sold food at the entrance of the university but the extreme increase in the cost of ingredients (such as cooking oil) left her with no profits. To continue forward, she asks you for a loan so she can increase her supply of merchandise. Please help sustain this young woman as she tries to support her child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Saira es una joven madre de familia de 22 años, tiene a su cargo a su pequeña de 2 años, es el único sustento que tiene su hija, por tal motivo, incluso antes de que naciera su pequeña, se dedicaba a la venta de mercería en general especialmente diferentes clases de adornos y joyería, está agradecida con su madre, que le enseñó desde muy niña el arte del vender, su trabajo consiste en la venta ambulante, especialmente en la puerta de los colegios, anteriormente ella vendía comida en la puerta de la universidad, pero el incremento exagerado de los precios de los insumos, tales como el aceite, no le dejaba ganancias. Para seguir adelante, solicita ante ustedes un préstamo para el incremento de su mercadería. Apoya a esta joven madre, para el sustento de su pequeña hija.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise (various decorations) to sell.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde is single, and lives with her two sons (15 year old Jimy and 11 year old Orlando, who are still studying). She is from the district of Ayaviri, but for the past 6 years she has been living in the city of Juliaca. She sells gold, which she acquires in the La Rinconada mine. She sells it throughout the week in Juliaca, on Sundays in Arequipa, and on Wednesdays and Thursdays in the city of Moquegua. Her work takes up most of her time, and for her it is very difficult to constantly be on the road, but her business is going well and she does what she needs in order to support her children. She sacrifices every day in order to provide a better future for her sons. Matilde would want to grow her business and in the future have an additional business such as a bookstore or a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Matilde es soltera, vive con sus hijos; Jimy de 15 y Orlando de 11, quienes aún son estudiantes de secundaria. Ella es natural del distrito de Ayaviri, pero hace 6 años vive en la cuidad de Juliaca, se dedica a la venta de oro, el cual adquiere de la mina La Rinconada. En Juliaca vende durante la semana, los días domingos en la ciudad de Arequipa, y los días miércoles y jueves en la ciudad de Moquegua.Usualmente, su trabajo le toma la mayor parte del día, para ella es muy difícil tener que estar de viaje en viaje constantemente, pero el negocio va bien y es lo que ella necesita para poder mantener a sus hijos. Se sacrifica día a día para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor porvenir. Matilde quiere incrementar su venta de oro y en adelante tener un negocio adicional, como una tienda de comestibles o una librería.

loans.use: To increase capital for her gold selling business.

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.es:
Ruperta tiene 58 años. DesD. hace varios años ella se dedica a la venta ambulante D. comida. Todas las noches ella sale con su carrito sanguchero, y regresa a casa muy tarD. después D. tanto trabajo.
Sin embargo, ella pensaba invertir en otro negocio, y así lo hizo con el último crédito que recibió. Ella, con la ayuda D. su esposo compró lubricantes para autos y empezó a distribuirlos en talleres mecánicos. Aunque ella dice que ahora se dedica a sus dos negocios, cuenta que le  urge un crédito para dar impulso a su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Ruperta is 58 years old. Some years ago she decided to sell food from a cart. Every night she leaves with her cart and returns home very late after her hard work. Regardless, Ruperta is hoping to invest in another business, and she did so with her last loan. With the help of her husband, she bought automobile oil and distributed it to auto shops. Even though she now dedicates her time to two businesses, she'd like to use this new loan to move her new business ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her new automobile oil business

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, especificamente en el mercado central, la señora Eusebia L. se dedica al negocio de venta de granos básicos el cual los comercializa en su propio tramo con el propósito de mantener su familia la cual requiere del apoyo de la señora Eusebia.

Es importante destacar que ella posee una gran cantidad de clientes y hoy en día se le han agotado sus estantes por lo que ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de dichos granos básicos y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio ya que son sus sueños convertirse en una gran comerciante en su sector.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in the central market, Mrs. Eusebia Lopez works selling basic grains in her own stretch of the market; she uses the money she earns to maintain her family which needs her help economically. It is important to highlight that she has a large number of customers and she is currently out of stock; that is why she has requested a loan from Ceprodel in order to buy those basic grains and move forward with her business. Her dream is to become a great saleswoman in her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains

loans.name: Shaig

texts.en: Shaig was born in 1983. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in the Masazir village of the Absheron region. He has been in this business for three years and now needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the spare parts for improving his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed T. is a trader who also operates a corn milling machine at Abrubemu near Elmina. He has been doing this business since 2003. He is married and has eight dependents, and his wife is also a trader. He has received junior high school education.

Mohamed will use this loan to buy spare parts for his machine due to the fact that his machine has been developing problems. He will use the profit he gets to pay the school fees of his children and then use the rest to expand his business.

In the picture, Mohamed is in the process of milling corn which was brought by one of his customers.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his milling machine.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Хасанова Дильбар жительница Вахшского района. Работает на рынке района , где торгует одеждой. Работает в сфере бизнеса уже два года. Бизнес развивается неплохо , полэтому она решила увеличить товаооборот , путем получения кредита . Это поможет ей обеспечивать своих детей , так как она разведена и является кормильцем двоих детей. Кредит планирует погашать в теченгие 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilbar KH. lives in Vakhsh region. She sells clothing at a regional market. Dilbar has been in business for two years. She is doing well, so Dilbar decided to finance a business expansion. This loan will help Dilbar to provide for her children as she is a single mother of two. Dilbar KH. plans to pay off this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en: Adijat sells provisions and food products and hopes to expand her business with a loan amount of $275 (N40, 000) to purchase more products to increase her inventory. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a LAPO client and says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance for their financial support. Adijat is 45-years-old and is married with four children.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Jesús de Praga.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 40 años, cinco hijos de 24, 20 y 18,  ellos trabajan,  no viven con Maria, el  8 y 5 años están en la escuela estatal.  
No pudo terminar de estudiar el colegio por que su mama se queda viuda  y tuvo que trabajar. Empezó comprando y vendiendo ropa  de segunda,  alquilo un puesto en el mercado señor de justicia, vende ropa nueva en las afueras del hospital Maria Auxiliadora.      
Maria necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para comprar pantalones en Av. Grau.
En Finca recibió crédito para comprar mercadería, aprendió a trabajar mas, a ser responsable con sus pagos y como trabajar el dinero.    
El sueño de Maria es tener un puesto de ropa y llevar mercadería a provincia.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Jesús de Praga. Maria is 40 years old and she has 5 children. Her children that are 24, 20 and 18 years old work and they do not live with Maria. Her youngest children, ages 8 and 5, are public school students. Maria was not able to finish her education because her mom was widowed and Maria had to start working. Maria started buying ansd selling secondhand clothing to make a living. She rented out a space in the "Señor de Justicia" marketplace and she sells clothing outside of the Maria Auxiliadora Hospital. Maria needs a loan of $375 (1,200 Soles) to be able to purchase pairs of pants on Grau Avenue to sell. In the group Finca Maria has received loans to buy more merchandise and she has learned to work more and to be responsible about making her payments. She has learned how to handle money better. Maria's dream is to have a clothing store and to take merchandise to provincial areas to sell.

(Translated by Dorian of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of $375 (1,200 Soles) to be able to purchase pants to sell.

loans.name: Estrellitas De Huancaro Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “ESTRELLITAS DE HUANCARO”; estos socios son un grupo de 13 miembros, 3 varones y 10 mujeres, es un grupo muy dinámico y divertido, ellos viven en el barrio de Huancaro alto, en el distrito de santiago.

Nuestros socios compartes sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, ellos forman un grupo de comerciantes y 2 de ellos tienen sus tiendas de abarrotes, ellos se dedican a comprar y vender granos (trigo, maíz, habas, pallares), frutas, choclos; Para lo cuál requieren del préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de sus granos, frutas y abarrotes.

Los socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado y se ratifican en el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones y cancelar su préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “ESTRELLITAS DE HUANCARO”; it is a group of 13 members, 3 men and 10 women. It's a very dynamic, fun group. They live in the Huancaro Alto neighborhood, in the district of Santiago. Our members participate in both domestic and commercial activities. They are a group of merchants. Two of them have their own grocery stores where they buy and sell grains (wheat, corn, broad beans, butter beans), fruits, and corn. They need the loan in order purchase grains, fruits, and dry goods. The members appreciate and value the loan offered, and promise to fulfill their obligations and repay the loan in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains and supply grocery store.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en:
Komiljon T. is 23 years old. He is not married. Due to his family’s financial situation, Komiljon did not have many opportunities to study at the University. That’s why after finishing the school he tried to become independent and find a way of earning money in order to help his parents with family expenses. Since 2007, Komiljon has supported his family through his efforts. During this time he has tried various types of activities. Finally, a year ago he started his own business selling cell phones. Komiljon believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. Currently, his business is doing well, but Komiljon needs to increase the stock of his goods in order to serve the demands of his clientele. For this purpose he requests US $400. Komiljon is grateful to all supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expand cell phone store inventory

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca tiene 31 años, vive con sus padres en casa de ellos con su hijo pequeño. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos a sus vecinos, a personas conocidas y también en ferias comerciales los fines de semana. A inicios de su negocio tenía pocos pares de zapatos pero supo invertir sus ganancias y hoy tiene una cantidad de mercadería considerable. Blanca adquiere sus zapatos viajando a otra ciudad, luego los distribuye a sus clientes, y en ocasiones sus familiares la apoyan en la venta cuando no puede cargar los paquetes pesados. Para Blanca esta actividad es muy  satisfactoria, por las ganancias que tiene, además porque los zapatos son un tipo de mercadería que no es perecible y si no se llega a vender no se devalúa. Para el futuro, Blanca quiere tener su propio puesto de venta de zapatos para que su negocio sea más estable. Es la segunda vez que tiene préstamo con MFP, y está muy segura que en este nuevo ciclo el trabajo con su banco comunal será más satisfactorio que el anterior. El dinero que solicita será para comprar mayor cantidad de zapatos, y de esa manera tener un mayor margen de ventas.
texts.en:
Blanca is 31 years old. She and her little son live with her parents in their house. For the past 2 years, she has sold shoes to her neighbors and acquaintances, and on the weekends at local markets. When she began her business she had very few pairs of shoes to sell, but she knew to invest her earnings, and today she offers a considerably larger quantity of merchandise. Blanca acquires her shoes in other cities, and later distributes them to her customers. Occasionally her relatives help her with the sales, when she cannot carry the heavy packages. For Blanca, this activity is very satisfying, both because of the money it earns, and because shoes are not perishable, and do not lose value if they are not immediately sold. For the future, Blanca wants to have her own permanent space to sell her shoes in, so that her business could be more stable. This is the second time that she has had a loan with MFP, and she is very certain that in this new cycle her work with the communal bank will be more satisfactory than her previous experience. The money that she asks for will be used to purchase a greater quantity of shoes, enabling her to expand the profit margin she makes on her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Razia M.farooq Sultan Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a wife of M. S., and for the last five years has lived in Borewala, Pakistan, a town that is famous for its shrines. She has two children, one daughter and one son, both enrolled in a local school. Razia baji helps support her family and pay their school fees by making clothing. Her husband is a salesman and sells baked items such as breads to different bakeries. Razia baji is applying for this loan to buy items for her husband to sell so that he can earn a profit. 

She leads a loan group that includes two other women who live in her town. Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy flour to sell. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy items for her business, which sells window shutters.

This is a group loan. Funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To help expand three small businesses

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en:
Lynie S. is 46 years old, married and has three children. She is a resident of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. One of her children has already finished college and is presently working as a teacher in their municipality. The family is engaged in farming rice.

Lynie was recognized as a member of PMPC in February, 2003, under the microfinance program PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People). She has had six previous loans. Her last loan of 4,500 PHP was used to buy fertilizers and chemicals for their rice field. This loan of 36,000 PHP is to purchase a motorcycle for hire so she could have additional income. It will also be used to transport her daughter to and from the school where she teaches.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela tiene 40 años, es profesora de nivel inicial, vive con su esposo quien brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro, tienen una hija de 9 años y también viven con su sobrino de 19 años. Por las mañanas trabaja en una institución educativa y por las tardes tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas) en su propia casa, donde atiende de lunes a domingo. A Mariela le gusta su trabajo porque mediante éste hace muchos amigos y gana clientes, además le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada y cuenta con clientes regulares que son generalmente los trabajadores de una empresa cercana a su casa, quienes acuden a su negocio por la buena atención y amabilidad que les brinda. Para más adelante, Mariela quiere tener un local más grande y con un mejor ambiente. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros se comprenden y demuestran mucha responsabilidad. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más cervezas y gaseosas para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariela is an elementary teacher who is 40 years old. She lives with her husband who works as a moto-taxi driver. They live with their 9 year old daughter and a 19 year old nephew. She works as a School teacher in the morning and sells beer and soft drinks from her home in the afternoon, from Monday through Sunday.

Mariela likes her job because she makes lots of friends and gets customers. Her business is cost effective because it is located in a very busy area. She has regular customers that are usually employees of a company located near her house, who go to her business because of the kindness and good service that she offers. Mariela wants to have a bigger and nicer establishment.

This is her 8th loan with MFP. What she likes about the community bank is that all their members show understanding and demonstrate a sense of responsibility. With the loan requested she is planning to buy more beer and soft drinks to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita O. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Teresita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business selling fruit. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to be used to purchase additional inventory & towards working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For working capital and additional inventory.

loans.name: Dimocrita

texts.en:
Mrs. Dimocrita G. is 59 years old, married with 6 adult children, and a resident of Bulobito-on, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental.

Dimocrita is a very good cook. Eight years ago she started a small restaurant and a variety store serving local dishes and selling native delicacies to both locals and tourists who visit the sea-side town of Hinigaran. Now with her children grown, Dimocrita wants to expand the small business that currently earns PHP 12,000.00 or about $250/month with the help of one of her daughters, so that it could also support her other children and their families.

With her daughter helping run the small restaurant and variety store, Dimocrita is now able supplement their family income, by working as the cook cum caretaker for one of the finest Beach Resorts in the area, but her real dream is to be able to expand her restaurant business.

The PHP19,500 loan she is borrowing will be used for additional working capital so that they could offer a wider variety of dishes and native delicacies to their growing number of loyal customers.

This is Dimocrita's 15th loan cycle with NWTF- Project Dungganon, and she has been a client of good standing since 2000.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: improvement/expansion of the borrower's business

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 53-years old and married with seven children. Julia has a small home-based restaurant. Her husband works in a timber business.

Julia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for six years and is a member of the communal bank “San Fernando II.” She invested her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in food for her restaurant and will do the same with this loan of 3,000 soles. Julia plans to purchase rice, noodles, sugar, oil and other basic necessities for preparing her meals.

For the entire time that she has been working with Manuela Ramos, Julia has been punctual with her loan payments. Her business has grown quite a bit. Now, not only does she sell meals out of her home, but she also prepares lunch for the staff of two nearby businesses: a bank and a petroleum company. Julia’s goal is to help her daughter through university.

loans.use: To purchase cooking supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de l'aluminium

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn C. is from the village of Cabaksahan, Iligan City. She is 32 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Analyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Analyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
S., age 46, is married to Pum, age 47. She has three children, two of whom are employed as garment workers. The other one attends school. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. Palm-tree-climbing jobs are very common for poor people who live in the commune. 

S. has a plot of farming land. She and her husband have earned a better income since her first two children grew up and went to work. S. is looking for a loan to buy a cow because her old cow doesn't support her field work. Her husband also appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: C. Martine est née en 1961 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Martine vit depuis environs 48 ans au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou. Martine est mariée à ASSOGBA Firmin un maçon, et a sept enfants, dont six sont à sa charge. Tous les enfants de Martine sont scolarisés. Martine et firmin supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. N'ayant pas été à l'école, Martine a commencé très tôt le commerce. Martine vend en effet depuis trente ans des condiments de sauce (tomate fraîche, gombo, piments, oignons, etc.), et aussi du charbon de bois et de l'akassa (aliment fait à base d'amidon de maïs) dans son quartier. Martine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Bohicon au Bénin. Martine a déjà eu deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Pour accroître son fonds de roulement afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et d'assurer l'avenir de ses enfants, Martine sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Martine C. was born in 1961 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Martine has lived for about 48 years in the Cadjehoun area of Cotonou. Martine is married to Firmin Assogba, a mason, and she has seven children, six of whom are in her care. All of Martine's children are in school. Martine and Firmin provide for the family together. Not having gone to school, Martine began in business very early on. In fact, for thirty years, Martine has been selling sauce ingredients (fresh tomatoes, okra, spices, onions) and also charcoal and akassa (a food made of corn starch) in her area. Martine obtains her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and in Bohicon in Benin. Martine has already had two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. To increase her working capital in order to better satisfy her customers and assure her children's future, Martine is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sauce ingredients (fresh tomatoes, onions, spices) and bags of maize

loans.name: Jaimee

texts.en:
Jaimee C. manages a village store in the Barangay Mozzozzin Norte Sta. Maria Isabela. She is 30 years of age and married to Fedrick. They are blessed with three children: Maverick, age 7, Ferdick Jr., age 6, and Cedrick, age 2. The first two of her children are enrolled in a public school in their village. 

This business really helps improve their living conditions. For many years, Jaimee has tried to expand her business; unfortunately, she has usually failed because of her life's difficulties and a lack of financial capital. But she has not given up. Consequently, she wants to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. She knows that using the money wisely will lead to better business opportunities in the future.

loans.use: additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
El socio ESTANISLAO pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural de la provincia de Calca, del departamento del Cusco, ubicado a una hora de la provincia de Cusco.
  
El socio tiene 68 años de edad, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos, los mayores son independientes y el menor estudia en la universidad la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil.

El socio requiere el préstamo para la educación de su hijo menor y para los gastos familiares. El hijo menor del socio esta estudiando en la ciudad del Cusco. El socio tiene que pagar la habitación, los libros, la alimentación, los pasajes, la ropa y los materiales que exigen los docentes a su hijo. 
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Estanilao is a member of the Virgen Asunta Communal Bank. He is from the Calca province in the department of Cusco, which is located one hour from the province of Cusco. He is 68, married, and has four children. The older children are grown and independent. The youngest child is studying in the university to be a civil engineer. The member needs a loan for his youngest son’s education and for family expenses. His youngest son studies in the city of Cusco. The member has to pay for his housing, books, food, transportation, clothes, and the materials the professors require his son to have. The member is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means. He promises to make his payments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses for his son

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 59 years old, married, and has 3 children.

She sells crates of drinks at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business all her life and has the experience to ensure that she makes sales and keeps her customers. She plans to expand her business and increase her capital in the future. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Epi

texts.en:
Epi is 59 and married with 3 children (ages 25-38).  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.    Epi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2009, Epi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Epi's 1st loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. 

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15 

The following social metrics for Epi are provided by SPBD:
Overall Social Metric Score:               1.8 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama C. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est très expérimentée en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 17 fois successivement. Elle vend des habits (boubous) en tissus teintés. Avec les bénéfices elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Adama C. is a married 41-year-old mother of 9 kids. She is very experienced with taking loans, having benefitted from 17 consecutive loans. She sells clothes (boubous) made from dyed fabrics. She will use her profits to help her husband support her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her clothes-selling business

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov D. is 29 years old and lives in Trapeang Reang village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Noeung Tep, are farmers who own 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice. Besides farming, Mr. Noeung Tep is also a cow middleman. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

In order to support her husband’s business, Mrs. Pov D. needs 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy a motorbike for transportation. The couple has three children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation to support her husband's business

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro M., age 55, is from the town of Alicia, Isabela. She is widowed and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Socorro works in the services sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services to local community members. Socorro has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Socorro joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Socorro is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide manicure and pedicure services. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Socorro from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide manicure and pedicure services

loans.name: Martha Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Martha Auxiliadora P., tiene la edad de 47 años es cada y con su esposo vive en el Barrio Sierras Doradas, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales dos de los mayores trabajan y apoyan en los quehaceres de la finca y el menor estudia la secundaria, Dña. Martha se dedica a su venta de abarrotes y productos varios desde hace 2 años y fue con su esfuerzo propio que pudo realizar la apertura de su negocio.

La crisis por la que está atravesando el país, hizo que las ventas bajaran considerablemente  y la falta de capital, obstaculiza la inversión para nuevos proyectos. Dentro de estos proyectos esta la remodelación de patio trasero de su hogar y para esto solicita de este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, esto le ayudaría y beneficiaría a sus hijos debido a que son alérgicos al polvo, de tal forma que embaldosando esa parte de la casa resguardaría la buena salud de los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Martha Auxiliadora is 47 years and lives with her husband in the Sierras Doradas neighborhood. They have 3 children, the two oldest of which work and help with the chores of the farm and the youngest studies in high school. Martha has worked selling groceries and various products for 2 years and it was able to open her business through her own efforts. The crisis that has swept her country has made her sales decrease considerably. And this lack of money hinders the investment in new projects. One of these projects includes the remodeling of the back patio of her home, which is why she is asking for this loan, so she can buy construction materials. This would help her and would benefit her children as they are allergic to dust, so tiling this part of the house would protect the good health of the family members.

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: remodeling the back patio of her house

loans.name: Labiba

texts.en:
Labiba is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon, with her husband and two children. She has been working as a sewer and embroiderer for over ten years. She works from home, repairing all type of clothes and also making clothes, scarves, cushions covers and more. Labiba is successful in her work because she does it well and knows how to treat her customers, who are mostly friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues because she did not have a lot of customers. Labiba decided to set up her business because of her experience – she has been sewing from a young age. She enjoys her work. 
Labiba has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to repair her sewing machine and purchase thread for her work. This is her third loan and she has always paid on time.

loans.use: To repair her sewing machine and purchase thread

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 29 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Konobougou, sous préfecture de Barouéli, région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements, de condiments et d’articles divers.
Ces femmes du groupe  Djiguisseme sont leur prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des paquets de condiments alimentaires, des habillements et des articles divers.
Elles s’approvisionnent en habillements au Burkina, en condiments et articles divers à Konobougou et environnants. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Konobougou et à Bamako, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguisseme Group, all married, are on average 29 years old and have 3 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Konobougou, a sub-prefecture of Barouéli in the Ségou region (fourth administrative district in the Republic of Mali). They met through family connections and sell clothing, spices and miscellaneous goods. These women of the Djiguisseme Group *are requesting their loan with from Soro Yiriwaso* which will be used to buy packages of edible spices, clothing and miscellaneous goods. They get their clothing supplies in Burkina Faso, and their spices and other goods in or near Konobougou. They conduct their sales in the Konobougou and Bamako markets, for cash, *retail* and credit, to a client base made up of both women and men. They expect to achieve an average monthly profit of XOF 35,000 each, which will be used for the daily expenses of the family. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing, spices and miscellaneous goods.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris hails from Agbara in Ogun State and she lives with her husband who is a businessman in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells drugs and groceries and she has been in the business for the past 10 years. 

She hopes to see her business grow more than her expectations. She is asking for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more drugs and groceries  to sell. 

Doris is 40 years old and has 5 children. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support especially in these hard times.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs and groceries  to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 32 years old and single. He is a dedicated farmer in Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. He has been farming for the last 13 years and has two employees. He sells his maize, milk, and beans to the local market. He also earns some income from a quarry business (balast) and a kiosk in the same area.

He requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs.70,000 after he had completed his first loan for Kshs.45,000. He will use this new loan to buy chickens (45,000 Kshs.) to start a poultry project, and a dairy goat (for 25,000 Kshs.). His main challenge is the high competition in the market and the fluctuating prices. In the future, he intends to buy a lorry that will help transportation of his produce and for his quarry business. With the added income he hopes to earn from this loan, he hopes to build a decent home for his parents. 

He added that "Juhudi Kilimo is a very effective and friendly financial institution."

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat and expand his poultry project
